loans.name: Loida's Group

texts.en:
Loida C., age 34, is from the village of Maddarulug Sur. Loida is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Loida C.'s Group.

Loida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loida owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products to members of the local community. Loida has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Loida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She eished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Loida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Loida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Loida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items in order to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice K. became a Solio agent in December. Since then, she has been leasing solar chargers to ten members of her community. Beatrice enjoys her Solio while her immediate neighbors are connected to electricity. Their lights cannot be compared to the brightness of her Solio-powered lights. 

Beatrice can also charge her own phone and use her radio while saving on the daily expenses of batteries and mobile-phone charging stations. With the profits from leasing solar chargers and the savings she receives from using her own Solio, she has now decided to open a grocery business. "Long live Solio" is now her motto!

loans.use: To purchase a solar powered kit

loans.name: Bora

texts.en: Mrs Bora was born in 1982 and is married to Mr Koem Oun, who is 31 years old. The couple are chicken breeders and farmers who own a 1.2-hectare plot of land where they cultivate rice. They sell some of the rice and consume the rest. Mr Koem Oun also cuts firewood to sell. Although they work a lot they can only earn a little income. In order to improve their situation, Mrs Bora is asking for a loan to buy five piglets and pig food to start a new business, pig breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more chickens. The couple supports two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy five piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta Sánchez Núñez desde hace 3 años cuenta con su negocio de Frutería denominada Enriqueta, donde ofrece variedad de Frutas y verduras, huevos, chicharrones de cerdo y abarrotes de buena calidad. Su esposo trabaja en una frutería conocida de la ciudad donde surten la mercancía; pero le están ofreciendo la oportunidad para traerla en el viaje donde sus jefes la compran y así conseguirla a un bajo precio. Para esto necesita capital para comprar la mercancía y así obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Enriqueta Sánchez Núñez has had a fruit sales business, called Enriqueta, for the last three years where she sells a variety of fruit and vegetables, eggs, chicharrones (fried pork skin) and good quality groceries.

Her husband works at a fruit store in the city where they supply the merchandise but they are offering him the opportunity to bring her along on the trip where his bosses buy it so that she can get it at a lower price.  She needs capital to buy the merchandise and obtain better profits this way.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another outlet of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more local food stuff for business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 50 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente.  Vive en casa de sus padres en le distrito de la victoria a pocos minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Martha  se dedica a la comercialización de verduras en el mercado Quiñones.
Ella compra verduras  por cantidad, y le permite vender a un precio cómodo a sus clientes. Martha cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el rubro en los cuales ha ido adquiriendo clientela fija. 

Martha esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000  nuevos soles, para que ella pueda ampliar su negocio comprando mas mercadería y  otros tipos de verduras en mayores cantidades, esto le ayudará a tener una mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, abastecer a pequeños distribuidores y convertirse posteriormente en una distribuidora mayorista.

Martha es una clienta conocida por Edpyme Alternativa, por tanto  se consta su responsabilidad y puntualidad, Martha quiere seguir  mejorando sus ingresos económicos en su hogar, para que así pueda brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Martha is 50 years old, single and has one dependent child. She lives in the home of her parents in the District of La Victoria, which is a few minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Martha sells vegetables at the Quiñones Market. She buys produce in bulk, which allows her to offer her products to her customers at an affordable price. Martha has four years of experience in this business and has built up an established clientele.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can expand her business by purchasing more merchandise and other types of vegetables in large quantities. This will help her have a wider variety of products to offer to her customers and to small distributors. Eventually she would like to become a wholesale distributor.

Martha is a recognized client of Edpyme Alternativa because she is conscientious about being responsible and punctual. She wants to continue improving her household income so that she can provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat is married with three children.  She sells clothing at the central market in the city of Khujand, a business in which she has been involved for fifteen years.   Adolat is very persistent, disciplined and creative, which helps her succeed in her business.   Her business is located in a good spot at the market and she always has many customers.  

Adolat requests a 7000 Somoni loan to increase her assortment of clothing for sale.  She works hard to develop her business.  Adolat's goal is to be a successful and an independent person who is able to provide for her family and also help others.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Annaliezl

texts.en:
Annaliezl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines. 

Annaliezl has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Annaliezl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her ready-to-wear clothes business.

She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Maria Valeria

texts.es: Maria Valeria se dedica a la venta de maíz frijol vende en el mercado de su comunidad, vende los días jueves y domingos y los otros días se dedica al tejido típico, a la crianza de pollos  ella solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz por quintal, frijol  pepita seca, su sueño es tener un lugar especifico para poder vender sus productos de consumo diario, sabe que con la ayuda de Dios lo va a poder hacer.
texts.en: Maria Valeria sells corn and beans in the market in her community. She sells on Thursdays and Sundays and the other days, she works on typical textiles and raising chickens. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of corn by the quintal, beans and dried seeds. Her dream is to have specific place to sell her products of daily consumption. She knows that, with the help of God, she can do it.

loans.use: buy essential food products

loans.name: Natividad Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre Natividad, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama la calle donde está situado el lugar de reuniones, de ahí, es por eso que escogieron este nombre, esta historia es acerca de la señora María Félix, ya que es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 42 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos esteban, Ángel y cristal, de los cuales los tres estudian, el mayor está cursando el tercer año de prepa, uno más segundo año de secundaria y la más pequeña esta en sexto año de primaria, ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de antojitos mexicanos desde hace mas de 10 años.

Doña María Félix decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, para sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación, y continuar invirtiendo en su negocio, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de los insumos necesarios para continuar con la preparación de sus ricos platillos como son: jitomates, cebollas, papas, variedad de chiles, aguacates, pollo, maíz, tortillas, quesos y demás especias.

La señora María Félix desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner un restaurant de comida mexicana, también comprar sillas y mesas y así tener una mejor producción e incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que así podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que pueda seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Dice que todos sus compañeros, son personas responsables y pagadoras puesto que todos se conocen de hace tiempo, ya que son de la misma comunidad, y también son muy amigos así que no tienen ningún problema entre ellos.

Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, para así seguir apoyándose a sí mismo y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.

Otros de los compañeros de doña María Félix son: María Leonor, Reyna, María Isabel, Aurelia, Ana Lilia, María de Jesús, María de los Ángeles, Teófila y blanca Carol quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: venta de carne, frutas, comida, ropa, dulces, tamales, refrescos, calzado, algunos abarrotes y panadería.
texts.en:
This group is called Natividad.  The members decided to give the group this name because it is the name of the street where they have their meetings. This story is about María Félix who is the group's representative.  She is 42 years old, married, and has three children: Esteban, Ángel and Cristal, who are all in school.  Her eldest is in his third year of high school, the next child is in his second year of junior high school and the youngest is in her sixth year of elementary school.  María Félix has been preparing and selling Mexican snacks for ten years.

María Félix decided to start this business because she needed to improve her family's quality of life and get her children ahead in life as she didn't have enough financial solvency to provide them with a better education and continue investing in her business.  She invested the loan that she received in buying the supplies she needed to continue making her rich dishes such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, a variety of chilis, avocados, chicken, corn, tortillas, cheese and spices.

María Félix would like to continue investing in her business so that she can grow it even more.  She would like to build premises, buy tables and chairs, and set up a restaurant selling Mexican food.  She would like to improve her production and increase and improve her sales and income so that she can continue supporting her children in their education and improving their quality of life.

María Félix says that all her fellow group members are responsible people and good payers.  They have all known each other for quite a long time as they are from the same community.  They are also good friends so there are no problems between them.

María Félix is very grateful to Kiva lenders and to Fundación Realidad since, thanks to them, she is getting ahead in life and has been able to own her own business.  This allows her to continue supporting herself and improving her family's quality of life.

The other members of María Félix's group are: María Leonor, Reyna, María Isabel, Aurelia, Ana Lilia, María de Jesús, María de los Ángeles, Teófila and Blanca Carol.  They carry out a variety of business activities such as selling meat, fruit, meals, clothes, sweet treats, tamales, footwear and groceries, and running a bakery.

loans.use: to invest in buying tomatoes, onions, potatoes, a variety of chilis, avocados, chicken, corn, tortillas and cheese

loans.name: Les Soeurs Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LES SOEURS est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Annick est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Annick est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Annick est mariée à un couturier du nom de Edmond. Le couple à deux enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Annick vit depuis sa naissance au Bénin. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,  Annick vend depuis quinze ans des sacs de maïs. A côté de cette activité, Annick vend des bijoux au Bénin.  Annick s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Annick sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LES SOEURS, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group Les Soeurs is made up of 3 women who live in the same house. This is the first time that the group has asked for financial help from ALIDé, in order to increase their level of activity. 

The group's representative, Annick, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 31 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a tailor called Edmond. The couple has 2 children, both of them have received schooling and are still in their parents' care. Annick has lived in Benin since she was born. In order to meet her needs, and those of the children, Annick has been selling sacks of corn for the last 15 years. Alongside this business, she sells jewelry in Benin, which is also where she obtains her supplies. With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing turnover and income, along with the other members of the Les Soeurs group, Annick is asking for a first loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and jewelry.

loans.name: Gaddy

texts.fr: Gaddy   est un Evangéliste, il est âgé de 43 ans, il est marié, et il est né au Rwanda.  Il a 8 enfants  dans son charge et ses enfants sont  entre 6mois et 20 ans et 7 vont à l’école .Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans des études  secondaire. C’est son quatrième   cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Il va payer les frais des études  pour ses enfants. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  de facilite ses enfants à accéder aux études supérieur pour qu’ils préparent leurs futures. Dans l’avenir il voudrait avoir une famille bien éduqué, et assure le développement  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gaddy is a preacher. He is 43 years old and married, and he was born in Rwanda. He supports eight children, who range in age from 6 months to 20 years. Seven of then attend school. Gaddy has three years of secondary education. 

This loan cycle is his fourth one with ACB. He is going to cover the cost of schooling for his children. His strategy for growth is to facilitate his children's access to higher education, so as to prepare for their future. He would like to have a well-educated family in the future and to assure his family's development.

loans.use: to cover the cost of schooling for his children

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 28-year-old married woman who started working six years ago in order to help her husband in covering their expenses.

Zeinab is a hardworking woman. She started selling household appliances, but four months ago she added a new section in her shop which deals with food. In fact, she opened a grocery store which she believes will help a lot in increasing her family's income and will help in covering almost all of her child's needs.

Zeinab is a hardworking businesswoman and is smart enough to attract customers to buy from both shops although they might be not in need of what they are buying.

Zeinab is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to support her grocery store for Holy Ramadan month with the best quality of dates, nuts, syrups and sweets requested during this period. She hopes that this month will have a positive effect on her and will help in planning a bright future for her family, especially for her child.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Yucay, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Ketty; tiene 48 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia trabaja en transporte, ella tiene sus buses interprovinciales, la socia también alquila sus buses para prestar servicio turístico, la socia  cubre la ruta de Cusco- Urubamba- Ollantaytambo y viceversa; la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de neumáticos para su bus; la socia requiere invertir en la compra de neumáticos para mejorar su unidad vehicular. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de neumáticos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Ketty is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion” which is located in the District of Yucay, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old and single. Ketty works in transportation and has buses that travel through different provinces. She also rents out her buses for tours. The route that she covers goes from Cusco to Urubamba to Ollantaytambo and then in reverse order on the return trip. Ketty wants to invest this loan in the purchase of tires for her bus. She needs to purchase the tires to equip her vehicle, so she is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Ketty appreciates the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her bus.

loans.name: Presbiteria

texts.es: Presbiteria, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 39 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora con ganas de sobresalir en la vida, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Roberto de 57 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes les brinda una educación adecuada. Presbiteria trabaja con mucho esmero para sobresalir adelante con sus plantas de cacao, café, achiote y palillo, las cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudades de  Quimbiri y San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus frutos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos lo cosechado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le es muy rentable por que gracias a ello mejoró las fachada de su morada. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos ya que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su primer crédito y esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y prosperar gracias al apoyo de todos ustedes. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, comprará cortinas, trampas y mecheros para combatir la plaga de insectos que asechan sus sembrios.
texts.en: Presbiteria is a native of Quimbiri. She is 39 years old and is a cheerful and hardworking woman who wants to succeed in life. She lives in her own house with her partner Roberto who is 57 years old and their 4 beloved children for whom they want to provide an adequate education. Presbiteria works with great care to make her cocoa, coffee, achiote (a Latin American fruit) and pepper plants stand out. After harvesting she takes the crops to the collection centres in the cities of Quimbiri and San Francisco to sell as she already has several buyers there who knowing the quality of her product do not hesitate to wait and buy her entire harvest. What she likes the most about her work is sowing her land, making it fertile and productive. She has been doing this job for 13 years and feels that it is very profitable as thanks to it she was able to improve the front of her house. In the future, she hopes to continue saving her income as she wants to buy more land. This is her first loan and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will make her feel safe to buy what she is asking for and thrive thanks to your support. With the 2000 soles (PEN) she is asking for, she will buy curtains, traps and burners to combat the plague of insects that infect her crops.

loans.use: to buy burners, curtains and traps to combat insects.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
With his desire to improve his crop production, Edmund spends most of his time in his farming business. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders. He earns a yield twice a year of about PHP 20,000. Profits earned are just enough to cover their daily expenses. 

Edmund is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and molluscicides (pesticides for snails) used in farming. He wants to ensure more crop production for this next cropping season in November. 

In the future, Edmund would like to keep producing an abundant harvest and earn consistent profits to make his family economically stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Trần Thị Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Ngọc is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Yen Phong district in Yen Phong province.  Ngọc is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân nhóm 07 (7).

Ngọc is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, she operates a family member's business, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ngọc has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Ngọc joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This is her first loan from SEDA.  Ngọc plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Đoàn is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock food for pigs.

2.  Oanh is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs and chickens.

3.  Lan is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock, to buy chickens and food for pigs.

4.  Thơ is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising piglets.

5.  Thái  is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock food for chickens.

6.  Oanh is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock food for chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Maribel tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene 2 hijo, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella tiene su negocio de venta de anticuchos y vende en su local anticuchos de carne, corazón res y entre otros mas y todo están cocidos en base de carbón a la parrilla, ella trabaja conjuntamente con su familia con papá y hermana y formaron una sociedad. 

La socia Maribel solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio de anticucheria como por ejemplo aceite, carnes, carbón entre otras cosas más.

La socia Maribel pertenece al banco comunal” UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maribel está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel, 40, is married and has two children from this relationship.  She was born in the city of Cusco, where she works.  She has a business selling "anticuchos," grilled meat on a skewer.  In her place she sells meat and beef heart anticuchos, among other types, and all are cooked on a charcoal grill.  She works together with her family, with her father and her sister, and they formed a partnership.

Maribel is requesting the loan to buy more ingredients for her anticucho business, such as oil, meats, and charcoal, among other things.

Maribel belongs to Unión, Fuerza y Amistad Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her business selling "anticuchos" (grilled meat on a skewer).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize for resale

loans.name: Cristian Del Socorro

texts.es: Cristian Del Socorro es una mujer que se dedica a trabajar en un centro de salud. El financiamiento que solicita será enfocado en la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, clavos, pega. Pues no había podido realizar estas mejoras que son necesarias porque no tenía el capital suficiente. Ella es una mujer trabajadora debido a las lluvias es que ha presentado este problema en su vivienda. El sueña con agrandar su vivienda y acondicionarla mejor.
texts.en: Cristian Del Socorro is a woman who works in a health center.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials such as zinc, nails, and mortar. She has not been able to make these improvements because she did not have enough money.  She is a hardworking woman and has this problem with her home due to the rain.  Her dream is to expand her home and improve its condition.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like zinc, nails, and mortar.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs an Avon dealership business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dealership for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending. Josefa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
Саломат, женщина 50-ти лет, которая с 2002 года сотрудничает с Арвандом. В начале своей деятельности Саломат торговала женским нижним бельём, и оборот её бизнеса был небольшой. Ассортимент товаров тоже был невелик. Муж Саломат работает поваром в столовой и его доход полностью идет на семейные расходы. К тому же один из сыновей клиентки находится на заработках в России, и каждый месяц присылает им денежные переводы на проживание. Саломат год за годом увеличивала свой товарооборот при получении очередного кредита и на полученные доходы выдала замуж дочь, отремонтировала свой дом. За девять лет кредитной истории Саломат ни разу не нарушила условия организации. Она за это время сменила своё место деятельности, на сегодняшний день арендует контейнер на большом вещевом рынке «Сомон» и её товарооборот увеличился в несколько раз. А также повысилось и улучшилось социальное и семейное положение.
Свой новый кредит Саломат собирается употребить на закуп сезонных товаров.
texts.en: Salomat is a 50 year-old woman, who has been working with Arvand since 2002.  At the beginning of her entrepreneurial activity, she sold women's undergarments and had a small business turnover.  The selection of goods was also limited.  Salomat's husband works as a cook at a cafeteria, and his entire income gets used for family expenses.  Also, one of the client's sons works in Russia and sends them money for living expenses every month.  Salomat has been increasing her good turnover year after year with the help of the loans and used the resulting profits to marry off her daughter and repair her house.  Over the nine years of credit history, Salomat has not once violated the terms of the organization.  Over this time, she changed her place of business and today leases a container at the large clothing market, "Somon," and her goods turnover increased several fold.  And also their social and family condition increased and improved.  Salomat plans use her new loan to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Arzullah

texts.ru:
Arzullah jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. Arzullah 45 let. On ochen trudolubiviy chelovek. 
On 14 let nazad nachal rabotat masterom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje rabotayet masterom i chinit doma. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya usovershenstvovaniya i razvitiya yego biznessa v dalneyshem i etim uvelichit kolichestvo mesachnix doxodov.
texts.en: Arzullah is married with two children. He lives in the Baku region with his lovely wife and kids. Arzullah is 45 years old. He's a very hardworking person. He began working as a master 14 years ago. He learned the business from his father, who also works as a master and fixes houses. He currently needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy the necessary tools to realize and grow his business, which will increase his monthly revenues.

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Bella Virginia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bella, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, algunos están comprometidos pero aun viven en su casa, uno de sus hijos sufre de diabetes al igual que su esposo el cual ya no trabaja por lo mismo.

Ella para ganarse su sustento diario y así con esto sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de fundas de hielo y helados, los mismos que a veces ella prepara o compra en una fábrica de la localidad, este pequeño negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace varios años y es con esto se ha ayudado para salir adelante, en la actualidad desde hace tres meses también está preparando almuerzos pero solos los fines de semana,  le está yendo muy bien en este negocio y está obteniendo buenas ganancias.

Este crédito es para comprar fundas plásticas, helados y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda. 

Ella está repitiendo su crédito en el Banco ya que con el  que recibió logro comprar ciertas cosas necesarias para poner el negocio de comida el cual le está dejando buenas ganancias, con lo cual ha mejorado su vida.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida diaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Jaime Roldos meets every fortnight in Jaramijo Canton (Manta). This area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround its coasts. The majority of the residents are very hard working and much of their work is related to the sea. 

It is here that we meet Señora Bella. She is 52 years old, married and she has 6 grown-up children. Some of them are engaged but still living at home. One of her children suffers from diabetes, as does her husband who no longer works for this reason.

To earn a living and get her family ahead in life she sells bags of ice and ice cream that she sometimes makes herself or else buys at a local factory. She’s had this small, home-based business for several years now and she’s used it to help get ahead. For the past three months she has also been making lunches, but only at the weekend. This business is going very well for her and she is making good profits.

This loan is for buying plastic bags, ice cream and supplies for preparing her food. She is the founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because the loans are a great source of help.

She is taking another loan with the bank as with her previous one she managed to buy the necessary things to start her food business, which is delivering good profits and improving her life.

Her dream is to get ahead in her business and daily life.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, ice cream and supplies.

loans.name: Ngirankugire / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe NGIRANKUGIRE/RSZ. Il a 52 ans, marié et ayant 3 enfants dont le moins âgé a 15 ans et le plus âgé a 30 ans. Un seul enfant va à l'école. Jean a 3 personnes en charge. Jean a 3 ans de sécondaire.
C'est le 2ème cycle de crédit que Jean fait avec ACB Ltd. Avec le crédit, Jean va acheter beaucoup de manioc pour faire la farine qu'il vendra à ses clients.
Il a une stratégie d'avoir la bonne correspondance avec les clients, ce qui lui permettra d'être le fournisseur de farine des maniocs dans la région.
Avec le profit, il pretend éduquer ses enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en:
Jean is part of the Ngirankugire/Rsz group. He is 52 years old, married and has three children of whom the youngest is 15 and the oldest 30 years old. Only one child goes to school. Jean has three dependents. Jean completed three years of secondary school.

This is the second loan cycle that Jean is requesting from ACB Ltd. With the loan, Jean is going to buy a lot of manioc to make flour which he will sell to his customers.

He has a strategy to have good correspondence with his customers, which will allow him to be the supplier of manioc in the region. With the profits, he plans to educate his children and take care of their health.

loans.use: to buy manioc stock.

loans.name: Kimanzi

texts.en: Kimanzi is a 72-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 12 to 30 years. He operates a food market where he sells sugar, maize flour, salt, soap, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the loan kes 10,000 to purchase more wheat flour and cooking fat. His business goal is to run another retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Reyes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REYES” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada donde la señora Ignacia es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chamarras, venta de dulces, venta de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de papa, venta de zapatos, venta de abarrotes.

La señora Ignacia  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su Mamá. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su Tía.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) que comprará de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato  y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Ignacia, ya que se tuvo que reincorporara a su negocio de inmediato.
texts.en:
The "Reyes" communal bank will begin its third loan cycle with ProMujer, as part of Centro Sakata. It is made up of eight members, and led by board of directors, of which Ignacia is the secretary. 

The businesses carried on by the members are varied, and include selling jackets, candy, shawls, clothing, food, potatoes, shoes, and groceries. 

Ignacia says that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, and that she joined at the invitation of her mother. Currently she has a business selling food, that she has been working in for some years, having learned it from her aunt.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital, so that she can purchase foodstuffs that she will buy in La Ceja. After preparing it, she will sell it at her stand. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family as best she can, since she is in a common-law relationship, and has four children.

When you ask her what he likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes saving.

Ignacia does not appear in the photo, as she had to get back to her business right away.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Eliseth De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Elizeth hace y vende nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace 10 años, inicia su negocio vendiendo ropa usada, zapatos de segunda, carteras y que actualmente ejerce ese negocio. Con  los nacatamales tiene seis puntos de ventas en su ciudad lo que genera empleos a varias cabezas de familia de su  localidad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas usadas, carteras de segunda, materia prima para hacer nacatamales como carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, arroz, perecederos, etc.
texts.en: Eliseth has been making and selling nacatamales, a typical dish made primarily from corn and pork, in her home for 10 years.  She started her business selling used clothing, second-hand shoes, and wallets.  She still maintains this business.  She sells the nacatamales in six places in her city, which generates employment for various people in her area.  The loan will be invested in buying used packs, second-hand wallets, and raw materials to make nacatamales, such as pork, chagüite leaves, rice, perishables, etc.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as corn, rice, pork, chagüite leaves, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa, quien se dedica  a la venta de ropa, dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Luis pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Electrónica, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en alguna de estas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca, ya que es el plato favorito de todos.
Por iniciativas propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, lamentablemente Luis no pudo ejercer su carrera, pero se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de llantas nuevas para su auto, de esta manera Luis tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Luis is a 35 year old man who lives in the city of Ica with his wife and children who he loves and who are his primary motivation in life. He is a very friendly person, a hard worker and enthusiastic. Together with his wife, who works selling clothing, he dedicates all of his efforts to getting his family ahead. Thanks to his efforts, Luis was able to study the profesional career of electrical engineering. In his free time he likes to share free moments with his family and on some occasions he cooks a rich pork stew with seasoned rice because it is everyone's favorite dish. 

Through his own initiative, with lots of persistance and dedication, Luis works as a taxi driver offering transportation services. He works every day starting in the early hours of the morning and he can do it for approximately 12 hours. Unfortunately, Luis could not use his degree. However, he feels good doing his work and believes that it goes well because of the friendly treatment that he offers to his customers.

Luis is very grateful for the Kiva loans. Now, thanks to the help that they bring to him, he will be able to complete the purchase of new tires for his car. This way, Luis will keep his tool for his work in the best condition and he will be able to serve more customers. Through this means he will continue working and striving to accomplish his greatest dream-- to see his children become accomplished professionals and good men.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old. She is married with one child. Delia is a hardworking mother to earn a living.

She has been running her business for eight years, and she is borrowing from GDMPC to buy fingerlings and fishpond supplies.

Delia will save money for the future of her child.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings and fishpond supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Loan Use: Increase stock of Soft drinks,Peanuts,Cigarettes

loans.name: Hameda

texts.en:
Hameda was born in 1974 and is a mother of 4 children. They live in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. 

Hameda took a loan for her husband to re-build his shop and buys lots of goods for it so he can support his family financially. AFSG granted his loan which he used for purchasing required materials such as rice, beans, tea, sugar, etc.  


Hameda does not have an education but she has six years' experience in the handicraft business.

loans.use: To buy ghee, rice, tea, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in his own home on Manuel Caceres Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in La Paz. He is 52 years old and is separated from his wife. He has three daughters of which the youngest lives with him. David is a tailor and in the morning he makes heavy shirts, parkas and backpacks as ordered by retailers. At night he works for a radio taxi service. This loan will let him buy fabric in bulk so he wastes less, makes better goods and saves money over the way he does things now, which is to buy in small quantities, hurting his business. He has been an IMPRO client since 2004 and is considered a good client, eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

David vive en casa propia en la calle Manuel Cáceres de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, tiene 52 años de edad, esta separado de la esposa y tiene tres hijas de las cuales la menor vive con el desde hace doce años. David es tallerista y por las mañanas se dedica a la confección de chamarras, parcas, mochilas a pedido de comerciantes minoristas de ropa. Mientras que por las noches trabaja en el servicio de radio taxi; el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar materia prima en mayor cantidad porque así optimiza su utilización y mejora su nivel de utilidad, ya que a la fecha compra sus insumos en cantidad limitada, lo que le resulta perjudicial en su negocio. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004 , y tiene calificación de buen cliente, por lo cual se considera sujeto de crédito.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: A mother of six  (6) children, Mrs. Amen I. is a distributor of provisions and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in the business for four (4) years. She is looking forward to getting this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his mobile phone business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. S. Rosemary is 50 years old, married with 6 children.   She sells beans and necklaces and also sells phone recharge cards. She has been in this business since 2004 and with LAPO for 2 years. She lives in Benin and needs $400 to buy more beans and recharge cards for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more beans and recharge card

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Barno trades children's clothes and shoes in the main market of her village.  She is 28, married, and has one child.  Two years ago, when she just started her business, she sold children's underwear and small number of shoes in her assortment.  After she started working with MicroInvest and received a loan, she increased and improved the assortment of goods. She became engaged in trade after one of her friends asked her to help. Now she is happy she started doing that because now she has constant source of income.

loans.use: Trade of children's clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Kabojja B1(C) Group

texts.en: Latifah is 32 years old and married with one child. Her husband is a driver. She sells charcoal for a living. Latifah wants to use the extra profits to start up a poultry business. Robinah and Teddy both have retail shop businesses and want to use the loan to increase stock. Sarah sells crafts and wants expand the business with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for sale and increase stock

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a single mother of a six-year-old girl, and she lives in the café community of Santo Domingo where she carries on a small business.  She has been selling sweets and candies for eight months.  Margarita in general runs her business in a primary school, but every so often she also visits friends and neighbors to sell her goods.  She explains that she needs a local space for the business, so that she won’t have to leave her house every day and walk long distances to take her sweets to students and the neighbors.  With her loan, Margarita will buy many goods to keep preparing her delicious sweets and candies, and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to prepare sweets and candies for a small business.

loans.name: Glady

texts.en:
Gladys is a forty-year-old mother of two daughters. One of Gladys’s daughters is in university and the other is in secondary school. Gladys sells soaps and detergents on a busy corner in central Kumasi. This is her second loan with Sinapi Aba Trust. As a result of the business training she has received in connection with the loan process, she asserts that she is now able to save money more easily.

With the proceeds from this loan that she is seeking, she would like to purchase better quality detergents and to begin paying for her inventory up front (as opposed to with credit). The savings generated by the profits of her business are used to pay for her daughters' school expenses.

Gladys is a member of the trust group In Him is Life. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase higher quality soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Cao Thị Vượng is 53 years old. She lives in Lương Bằng, Kim Động with her husband and their son. She owns a store selling all kind of nước mắm. She has been in this business for 15 years. All her products are of good quality and she has gained her customer's loyalty and trust. Her husband works with her overseeing the operations. Her family income is 200-250 USD a month. She plans to expand her business so she is seeking a loan of 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị Vượng, 53 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và con trai tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Chị có một cửa hàng chuyên bán buôn bán lẻ nước mắm các loại. Chị Vượng làm công việc này đã được 15 năm. Sản phẩm của cửa hàng luôn bảo đảm về chất lượng và uy tín nên có đông khách đến đặt mua. Anh Sơn, chồng chị, cũng tham gia trực tiếp vào việc kinh doanh. Thu nhập của gia đình hiện nay khoảng 200-250USD/tháng. Với mong muốn mở rộng quy mô cửa hàng, vòng vốn này chị Vượng xin vay 1200USD để mua hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy fish sauce

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en:
Kahramon R. is 64 years old. He is married with six children, one of whom is still under his care. The rest of his children are married and have their own families and children, who adore their grandparents. He loves his children and grandchildren very much and does his best in order to make them happy and to provide them with a good education.

As such, Kahramon runs a farm, where he grows wheat, rice, and different kinds of vegetables, depending on the season. In fact, he has worked in agriculture for twenty years, and in that time he has gained a tremendous amount of experience and a love for the land. His two oldest sons help him with the business, which is stable and generates the main source of income for the family.

At the same time, the business requires a lot of effort and money to sustain the business. Currently, it is the prime season to work the farm, so Kahramon wants to grow wheat, potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Accordingly, Kahramon is seeking 1,000 Somoni ($300), to be repaid within 12 months, to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Kahramon thanks all for supporting him, and he promises to pay back his loan within the allotted time.

loans.use: To take advantage of the prime growing season by purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr:
Mrs. Félicité N. was born on February 11, 1974 in Lomé. She has three children but is a divorced woman. Back in 2006, she opened a document-processing center in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. In her center she also sells handbags.

She has already had one loan through WAGES and reimbursed it correctly. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to acquire two new computers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame N. Félicité est née le 11 février 1974 à Lomé. Elle a trois enfants mais est une femme divorcée. Depuis l’année 2006, elle a crée un centre de traitement de textes dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Dans son centre elle profite aussi pour vendre les sacs de sortie.

Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir deux nouveaux ordinateurs.

loans.use:
Purchase of two computers

Achat de deux ordinateurs

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann K. lives in the Tang Kruos Lech Village, Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer, and her husband, Mr. Chorn Sum, helps her in planting the crops. They have seven children, one of whom is doing housework, while three others are firewood collectors. The remaining three are still too young to work or study. Since her children’s firewood business is doing well, Mrs. Vann K. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her own savings and be able to buy cows for the transportation of firewood that her children sell door-to-door. Previously, Mrs. Vann K. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart, and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Purchase of cows for the transportation of firewood

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a single parent and has 5 children. She has received schooling through Senior High. Elizabeth sells fresh tomatoes and also fries plantains for sale at Abura, which she has done for over 20 years.

Elizabeth uses her income to take care of her family's financial needs. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase 5 more crates of fresh tomatoes. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: purchase 5 more crates of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 30-year old married mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in Kisumu Kenya. Since 2002, she has sold essentials items such as bread, rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, and so forth. Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation, and many years in business coupled with a well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to grow. She has applied for a loan of US $500. She plans to use part of the loan to purchase additional stock in bulk and to save part of it to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of essential items in bulk.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Socorro

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, es casada,  su esposo trabaja como operario en la Alcaldía de Managua, tiene 3 hijos de 17 , 10 y 5 años de edad, a los que quieren asegurarle un buen patrimonio para cuando ellos ya no estén. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, y también tiene 3 unidades de taxi, los cuales alquila. Tiene 8 años de experiencia en las ventas de ropa y zapatos, anteriormente también vendía cosméticos. El uso del préstamo será para comprar ropa y zapatos y así poder divesificar sus productos y ofrecer una mejor oferta a sus clientes y aumentar el nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the city of Managua, and is married. Her husband works in the mayor's office in Managua. She has 3 children who are 17, 10, and 5. She wants to secure a good inheritance for them for when she and her husband aren't around anymore. Elizabeth sells clothing, shoes, and also has 3 taxis, which she rents out. She has 8 years of experience selling clothing and shoes. She also used to sell cosmetics. She will use this loan to purchase clothing and shoes and to be able to diversify her products and offer more to her customers and increase her level of sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Fahed

texts.en: Fahed is a 42-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Fahed owns a taxi and, because of the age of his car, he wants to buy a new engine for it. Therefore, Fahed has requested a loan of $1000 to remove his old engine and buy a new one. This is the first time that he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for his car

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma H M. is 45 years old. She is a married woman with one child, aged 25 years. Mwajuma has been running a grocery business since 2008. She has two dependants who depend on her because they are orphans. She works seven days per week and 12 hours per day. She is requesting a loan of 275 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, salt, etc. In future she is planning to increase the quantity and range of the stock.

She thanks you for your support! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: T o purchase additional stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Komiti

texts.en: Komiti T., 29, is married with 6 children. She has 2 years of experience in an elei printing / clothes business. She sells to the public and village people 5 days per week. She is a new member, with just one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 50 Tala. SPBD loans are Komiti’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. is a 51 year old mother of six children who are currently in school. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high school. She is very supportive to her husband in taking care of the kids in school. Agnes lives with the family in a rented apartment. She trades in sewing accessories and has been doing this for the past twenty years. She sells items like lining materials, sewing thread, and school uniforms. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase savings to support the kids in school.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing accessories

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso P. nació en Concepción, según comento vino a Ciudad del Este en el año 1976, prácticamente a los 21 años, Empezaba a trabajar de jornalero, después de vendedor independiente, hasta que un día logró construir su casa en donde tuvo la idea de montar una despensa, que sigue en marcha hasta hoy día.

El señor quiere este préstamo para aumentar su stock de mercaderías por que había  invertido en la construcción de la muralla de su casa  y quedó con la necesidad de reinvertir en su despensa.

Su despensa tiene buena ubicación y esta a nivel de la competencia.
texts.en:
Alfonso P. was born in Concepción and says that he moved to Ciudad del Este in 1976 when he was almost 21 years old. He began working as a day labourer, later became an independent merchant, until one day he managed to build a home and had the idea to open a convenience store, which he still runs to this day. Alfonso wants this loan to increase his stock of merchandise because he had previously invested in building walls for his house and now needs to reinvest in his store. His store is well located and is well able to compete with other stores.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to stock his store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 40 años, vive con sus 3 menores hijos en la casa de su tía. Se dedica desde hace 2 años a la elaboración de chocolates en molde con relleno de diversos confites que son una combinación deliciosa, ella misma los fabrica en una ardua labor que dura  casi toda la noche. Sale desde las 5 de la mañana a repartir lo que ha fabricado a las tiendas, bodegas, cafetines de escuelas, entre otros establecimientos; para ello camina casi todo el día con la satisfacción de que todo lo que produce es vendido y no le genera perdidas. Isabel está agradecida con la persona que le enseñó a realizar estos dulces que hoy le sirven para sustentar su hogar. Aunque es muy sacrificada su actividad, tiene mucha satisfacción de generarse estos ingresos y ser independiente económicamente, y debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio Isabel está  planeando aumentar su producción. Es la primera vez que participa en un trabajo solidario, y está muy contenta en realizar una labor unida con su banco comunal. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de una máquina chocolatera valorizada en 1000 soles, con la cual podrá elaborar más dulces en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Isabel, 40, lives with her 3 minor children in the home of her aunt. For 2 years she has been creating molded chocolates filled with various sweet fillings, a delicious combination. She makes them herself, an arduous task that lasts almost all night. She goes out beginning at 5 in the morning to distribute what she has made to the shops, school cafeterias, and other establishments. She walks almost all day long, and has the satisfaction of knowing that everything she produces is sold, she does not suffer losses. Isabel is grateful to the person who taught her how to make these sweets that today support her household. Although she gives herself to her work, she gains much satisfaction in generating this income and in being economically independent. Thanks to the profitability of her business, Isabel is planning to increase her production. This is the first time that she has worked alone, and she is very happy to join together with her communal bank. This is her first loan through MFP. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of a chocolate-making machine worth 1000 soles, with which she will be able to create more sweets in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a chocolate-making machine

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El señor Máximo Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Máxima Collque y su hija.
El señor Máximo trabaja como albañil, en construcciones particulares de esta ciudad y su esposa es cocinera, vendiendo almuerzos en un puesto de venta de su zona.
Su vivienda será beneficiada con el servicio de gas domiciliario, para la que necesita realizar la construcción de una cocina para la instalación de ese servicio.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Son clientes de IMPRO desde el año 2002.
texts.en:
Mr. Máximo Quisp lives in his own home in the Pasankeri zone on the westen side of La Paz city. He lives with wife, Mrs. Máxima Collque, and their daughter. Máximo works as a brick layer, in housing construction in this city, and his wife is a cook, selling meals in a sales stand in their zone. Their home will receive gas service, so he needs to build a kitchen in order to install this service. This is the 5th time that they seek a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis completed qualifies them favorable and they can access this loan. They have been IMPRO clients since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kitchen to take advantage of home gas service being installed in their neighborhood

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is 44 years old, married, and blessed with eight children. She is a responsible mother and a loving wife to her husband. Her husband works in "pamiling" (traditional gold mining). They both cooperate in raising their family.

Vivian has a mini grocery store where she sells basic goods, including bananas, to walk in customers. She also buys and sells used clothing, locally called “ukay-ukay.” Her business has been made possible with the help of HSPFI (Kiva Partner).

Vivian is applying for loan amounting to PHP 10,000.00 to further improve her business, and is hoping for a positive response to her request.

loans.use: Business improvement

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
Hạnh Vũ Thị owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing furniture rental services to local community members. Hạnh is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Nam Định. She is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Hạnh has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,600,000 VND a month.

In 2000, Hạnh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Hạnh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand her business. Hạnh is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND to purchase materials for her business. This loan will be her tenth loan from TYM Fund. Hạnh plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. No. 5225000521.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture rental service

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 38 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abbas has been working as a mason since 1985. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Abbas is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have experience and it wasn’t easy for him to build a network of clients, but he has worked hard to learn new techniques in order to face his competition. Abbas decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Abbas will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort T. is forty years old, divorced, and has given birth to four children: two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Comfort is a food vendor. She cooks and sells kenkey, which is prepared from milled maize grains. It is served hot with ground pepper and fried fish. She sells by the road side in the mornings. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with one child. He makes and fixes furniture. Vladimir started this business nine years ago. It was one of his friends who suggested Vladimir try this business. It turned out that there was (and still is!) a high demand for furniture. It helped Vladimir to develop his business fast. Vladimir does his work quickly and with high quality. He is honest with his clients and they repay him with good recommendations and new clients.

Vladimir would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase materials for furniture manufacturing. He hopes to receive additional income and improve his living conditions. His business goal is to offer a larger variety of furniture items.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 29-year-old lady who is married to Patrick Kariuki.  Together they have been blessed with two children.

She has been in the men's clothing business for the past three years. Hellen's business is situated in the busy Nairobi city center. She travels regularly to Turkey to restock her business.

Before joining KADET, she was able to get a bank loan which she paid off.  Then she was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings will be her first.

Hellen's current income bracket is 80,000 Kenyan shillings per month. She hopes to open two more shops and create job opportunities for other people as her employees.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more stock for a men's clothing shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 57 year old father of four who owns a grocery store in the southern town of Tyre. He has had the store for two years and is requesting a loan of $1,300 to buy inventory for his store - namely food products. Ali's clients are mostly neighbors and other residents of the town. This is Ali's third cycle with Al Majmoua - when he first opened the store he found promoting it to attract clients difficult. However, the previous two loans he acquired from Al Majmoua have helped him improve his store and increased his determination to further expand it. Ali has a passion for running his own business and it is this passion that will drive him to further expand his business ventures.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the store

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Srta Gladys es soltera no tiene hijos pero vive en la casa de sus padres en un Barrio retirado a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad cabe destacar que viven con tres hermanos todos ellos trabajan y aportan en los gastos del hogar.

El negocio de Gladys esta montado en el predio de la terminal de Ómnibus hace muchísimo tiempo y que es atendida por ella y por su mamá. En la misma se dedican a la venta de bebidas como ser jugos, gaseosas, golosinas además venden carteras y remedios naturales para mate y tereré que son dos bebidas típicas y muy consumidas en nuestro país.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercaderías como ser termos y carteras que tiene que traer de otra ciudad denominado Ciudad del Este le conviene traer de ahí por el precio bajo que tiene y así le deja más ganancias.

loans.use: compra de jugos, gaseosas y golosinas.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a member of the Miraculous Maria Village Bank. She is 51 years-old and divorced, and sh has six children, all of whom are over 25 years old. 

Celsa has a hardware store where she sells construction materials. She began her business 2 years ago. For many  years, she has not been able to work because she has had to care for her daughter, who was in poor health. Celsa has been with FINCA for 1 year and, since then, she has been able to increase her business and buy more merchandise. 

Celsa needs a loan of 1800 soles to invest in carpentry materials, hammers, glue, lacquer, and more. Her dream is to expand her business more and continue to save. Also, she wants to open a convenience store for her daughter.

loans.use: To invest in carpentry materials, hammers, glue, lacquer, and more

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es: Victoria Y. es una de las fundadoras de la asociación “25 de Julio” del  centro Focal Santiago II, en la ciudad de El Alto, ella al igual que muchas de sus compañeras realiza diversas actividades para poder llevar el sustento a su familia, Victoria realiza viajes a la ciudad de Oruro para comprar variedad de artículos para el hogar (platos, ollas, vasos etc.) y luego los vende en la feria 16 de Julio (El Alto). Ella al igual que sus compañeras afirma que los créditos que obtengan serán invertidos para reforzar sus negocios, adquiriendo mercadería variada. Ya que sus demás compañeras también venden mercadería variada, como ser; venta de calzados para niños, ropa interior, mantas y otros.
texts.en:
Victoria Y. is one of the founders of the "25 de Julio" (July 25th) group in the Santiago II regional office in the city of El Alto. Like many of the members of the group, Victoria does many different types of work in order to be able to put food on the table for her family. Victoria travels to the city of Oruro to buy various household items such as plates, pots, glasses, etc., and then sells them in El Alto's July 16th fair. Other group members also sell assorted products such as children's footwear, underwear, blankets, and more. Victoria and the rest of the group plan to use the loan to strengthen their businesses, and to purchase assorted merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as plates, pots, glasses, children's footwear, underwear, and blankets

loans.name: Nilea Ana

texts.es:
La señora Nilea es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero de Agosto” de distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Izani, ella estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado porcino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar gaseosas al por mayor, también vende ganado ovino luego de mejorarlo.

Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa en Tacna.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Nilea is a member of the Communal Bank “Primero de Agosto” (First of August), which is located in the District of Zepita, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children. Nilea lives in the community of Izani and completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan of 300 soles enabled her to increase her business capital for buying and selling pigs. At the moment, she is requesting a new loan of 3000 soles to purchase sodas at wholesale.

After her business improves, she also plans to sell sheep. Nilea’s greatest wish is to purchase a house in Tacna. She enjoys her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena H. is 34 years old and lives in Sikatuna, Bohol.  She has been running her hog raising business since September 2008.  She sustains her family through this business. She has two children and wants them to finish their studies.

She needs additional capital for her piggery, so Rowena is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy more feed and more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more feed and more pigs

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeun S. is a villager in Ta Pov village in Takeo province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the other is a laborer. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ouch Sokha, is a bicycle repairer. Since this business is going well, he wants to buy more bicycle parts to use in his repair business. Thus, Mrs. Yoeun S. decided to ask for a loan for her husband's business and she would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer, and pesticides to support the rice field and make it more productive.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle parts and to buy fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old. Tessie is single. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a retail business selling personal products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cosmetics product such as shampoo, soap, lotion, make-up, lipstick, etc., in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es:
Rubí es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en Yarina Cocha, región D. Ucayali. Ella tiene 48 años y es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad.
Rubì trabaja junto a su esposo en la fabricación D. ventanas y puertas D. fierro. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las  Libertadoras” desD. hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en la compra D. algunos artículos D. abarrotes para vender en la vereda D. su casa.
