En la actualidad necesita un crédito D. 1000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà fierros para fabricar puertas. 
La meta D. Rubí es tener una tienda bien surtida D. abarrotes en la comodidad D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Rubí is a hardworking and active member and lives in Yarina Cocha in the region of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and is the mother of four older children. Rubí works with her husband making iron windows and doors. She has been part of the community bank "Las Libertadoras" for two years, and the first loan she received was for 300 PEN which she invested in buying groceries to sell from the sidewalk in front of her house. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,000 PEN with which she will buy iron to make doors. Rubí's goal is to have a well-supplied grocery store in the comfort of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron to make doors

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeun Chhin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 15 people who all live in Dak Por village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Thoeun C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns small piece of land on which to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she breeds pigs and chickens. Her husband, Mr. M. Thy, is a construction worker. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to meet their needs. 

Mrs. Thoeun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy cement and other equipment to build a house for her family. She is 35 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two are attending the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy cement and other equipment to build a house for her family

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna B. is 43 years old and married with 2 children, living in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Lorna's husband is a laborer and at the same time manages their farm, which is their main source of income (approximately 5000 a month).

Lorna was prompted to join Paglaum MPC in order to access financial services and other benefits, especially insurances. Lorna maintains a good record with PMPC as she has religiously repaid her previous loan. Lorna is now asking for a new loan of 7000 which will be used to plant more corn, helping them to save for their future and prepare for old age.

loans.use: fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Arely De Fátima

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, la señora Arelys del Carmen S. se desempeña como maestra de un pequeño colegio impartiendo clases a niños y ha logrado desempeñarse y sobresalir como una excelente maestra en el municipio.
Ella es casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar y la razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es porque ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde habitar. Es por estas razones que el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como ladrillos de piso y así mejorará dichas condiciones que es lo que anhela.
texts.en:
In the municipality El Sauce in León, Arelys del Carmen S. carries out the duties as a teacher in a small school, imparting classes to children. She has managed this very well and excells as an excellent teacher in the municipality. Arelys is married with 2 school-age children and the reason why she is seeking a loan is because she has begun improving the condition of her house, in order to give her children a dignified roof over their heads. It is for this reason that the loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as floor bricks. In this way Arelys will improve the said conditions, which is what she longs for.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Feliz Group

texts.en: In the city of Paraguarí, a group of women met in order to form a committee and take out a loan. They arranged a meeting to find out about the program, and accepted because it gave them the opportunity to increase their working capital and receive training sessions that would allow them to more fully develop themselves as people. They are very hard-working women, and this is a great opportunity for them, since they have never before received any kind of credit.  The committee is called Felíz (“Happy”), and they are currently in their fifth loan cycle. The group is made up of 18 hard-working, sacrificing women who strive each day to afford a better quality of life to themselves and their families.  All the group members are very active women, and have invested their loans in their respective activities. One of these women is Mrs. Antonia V., who sells fruits and vegetables in the Paraguarí market. She has a stand where she displays her fresh produce, which she buys from other group members. Some of the fruits she sells are oranges, bananas, pineapples and watermelon; some of the vegetables she sells are onions, tomatoes, carrots and hot peppers.  Her sales are very good, and help her pay her household expenses. Antonia says, “A lot of things depend on my income, like food and my children’s clothing and education.” She is a single mother. She is very grateful for this loan, which she used to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: Compra de frutas y verduras.

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es: José emilio P. de 51 años, sastre conocido en Sn. Martín Jilotepeque, casado y tienen 6 hijos, la familia lucha por obtener ganancias en sus trabajos. Emilio es sastre elabora pantalones, camisas, sacos y faldas, el nombre de su sastrería es "El Nuevo Peren" . Don José solicita el crédito para la comprar de un moloino de nixtamal, ya que donde viven no hay molinos, y el quiere sacarle provecho a eso, y el resto de dinero utilizarlo en comprar mas tela para su sastrería. Su sueño es tener un negocio donde pueda vender telas de todas las clases.
texts.en:
P. Emilio José is 51 years old and is a known tailor in San Martín Jilotepeque. Married with 6 children the family strives to earn money from their work. As a tailor, Emilio works on pants, shirts, bags and skirts. The name of his tailor shop is “The New Peren”. Mr. José is seeking a loan for the purchase of corn meal mill as they live in an area where there are mills and he hopes to be able to take advantage of that. The remaining money would be used to buy cloth for tailoring. His dream is to have a business where he could sell all types of fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the tailor shop as well as start a new business [with the corn mill]

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Mrs. S. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the capital of Phnom Penh. Since 1992, S. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. S., 34, is married to Chanthoeun and they have four teenage children. S. wants to look for a new source of income by investing in a new business line. In order to make that possible, she needs to have capital. Because S. has no working capital yet, she decided to seek a loan of $450 to be used to buy rice in bulk from other cultivators to store in her home and resell to earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Nilmini

texts.en:
Nilmini is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has two sons and two daughters who are still in school. Her husband is a businessman. They are very close and work well together.

Nilmini manages a bookbinding and photo-framing business which she started thirty years ago. She cooperates well with others, and has a lovely mood. She is very enthusiastic.

Nilmini has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her bookbinding and photo-framing business

loans.name: Richard Yoel

texts.es: Richard tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanos, la casa es de material noble, el apoya a su menor hermana con sus estudios, con los ingresos que obtiene con su mototaxi, la cual adquirio con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, el presta el servicio de manera muy cordial y amable, solicita el credito para hacerle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, también para poder actualizar el SOAT y poder adquirir el permiso de circulación, el sueño de Richard, es brindarle seguridad y bienestar a su familia y poder tener una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his brothers and sisters in the home of his parents, which is of good construction. He supports his younger sister in her studies with the income that he gets from his motortaxi, which he acquired with much effort and work. He offers his service in a very polite and friendly manner. He is applying for the loan to perform maintenance on the motortaxi and also to get his insurance up to date and acquire his driver's license. Richard's dream is to offer security and well being to his family and to have a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his motortaxi

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma C., 57, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Leo C., a carpenter, she is blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

Norma has been managing her own variety store while overseeing operations of their pedicab (a bicycle with a side car that can seat up to three passengers) business.

Norma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her business, Norma would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries needed to continue the operation of her store.

Norma dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she and her family can experience life’s simple pleasures like delicious food and acquire some material things.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to continue operation of her store

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa Maria R. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tiene vaR. años de tener su negocio, el cual lo ha administrado muy bien.
Rosa vive en la aldea de San Bernardo, Rosa es viuda, hace 6 años que su esposo murio y vive solo con un hijo
varon y una sobrina, los cuales le ayudan con el negocio a atender sus clientes.
doña Rosa se levanta las 5 de la mañana todos los dias para atender el negocio, el cual queda enfrente de una escuela y muchos niños compran antes de entrar a clases.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y a su sobrina.
texts.en:
Miss Rosa Maria R. sells general consumption products – she has a small general store in her house. She has had her business for several years, which she has run very well. Rosa lives in the town of San Bernardo. She is a widow, her husband died six years ago and she lives only with one son and one niece, who help her with the business by attending to her customers. Miss Rosa gets up at 5 in the morning every day to work in her store, which is located in front of a school and many children buy goods there before going to class. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise and therefore supply her store. She needs the income in order to get ahead and give a better quality of life to her son and her niece.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments, salt, rice, sugar, bread, cookies, soda, juice, butter, oil, cornflour and wheat flour, tortillas, milk, soup, salsa, pasta

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian S., 38 years old, is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has three school-aged children. Lilian owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale and also raises hogs in her backyard. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. Lilian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and hog feeds. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and hog feeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more medicine such as Paracetamol, Amoxicillin, Doxycycline and Aspirin.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr:
Monsieur Patrick est un jeune de 27 ans, qui est née dans le district de la Musanze de l’ancienne ville de Ruhengeri  en province du nord du Rwanda. Il est célibataire, il vit avec ses parents et  il a un diplôme de niveau secondaire.
Il est photographe cameraman. Son IMF est Amasezerano Bammunity Banking sa. 
Il prend un prêt aujourd’hui pour acheter un ordinateur pour pouvoir monter les cassettes vidéo des films photographiés et améliorés son travail et maintenir sa clientèle, ce qu’il fait d’habitude, il prend les vidéo et il va faire le Montage ailleurs et paie ces frais.  Il veut améliorer et valoriser son travail ainsi satisfaire les clients.Il contracte son premier prêt, il veut à la longue prendra un prêt pour le minerval car il compte étudier l’université après avoir stabilisé et améliorer sa situation financière, il pourra aussi se marier et avoir des enfants par les épargnes continuelles.
texts.en:
Mr Patrick is 27, a young person who was born in the old town of Ruhengeri, in the district of Musanze province, Rwanda. He is unmarried, he lives with his parents and he has a secondary level diploma. He is a photographer and cameraman. His IMF is Amasezerano Bammunity Banking . He wants a loan today to buy a computer to be able to assemble the video taken and improve his work and to maintain his customers. His normal procedure was to take the videos then take the post production editing elsewhere and pay these expenses. He wants to improve and develop his work in - house thus to satisfy his customers. This is his first loan, his long term plan is to take a loan for higher education because he intends to study at the university after having stabilized and improved his financial position, he will be able to also marry and to have children by continual savings.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a computer

loans.name: Danson

texts.en: Danson is a married man.  He is a young entrepreneur who sells mattresses.  He also operates a grocery store to earn more income. He has been in the business for roughly ten years.  His shop is situated in a populated area.  Therefore, he has good clientele.  He has been able to improve his business through his savings with a group in Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES.  He will use the loan to add to his stock of mattresses.

loans.use: purchase mattresses for resale

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia A. is 69 years old and widowed; she has only one son,  Jameson, who is 42 years old and a fisherman. She is a God-fearing and fearless mother. She and her son have helped each other to overcome the poverty that impeded their family.

In 2003, Lilia joined Kiva partner ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI in the Philippines, to acquire capital for her fishing business. As a member of ASHI for almost 8 years, she has noted good performance in her credit rating (basis of loans) and is therefore being trusted by ASHI to obtain bigger loans. For almost 8 years of her membership in ASHI, Lilia has been a model member dedicated to managing her family’s fishing operations. This loan is her 6th – she has made good use of her previous loans to expand her business and income. Lilia has applied for a new loan of 28,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to support the needs of her fishing business. Lilia dreams of expanding her business into a full-fledged fish farm. She also engages in other businesses for supplementary income.

She dreams of sending her grandson to school until he finishes college and finds a good job. Until that dream happens, Lilia is happy with the way in which ASHI and Kiva have touched her family's life and given them a good chance of making their dreams come true.

The attached picture of Lilia was taken August 03, 2010 with her supportive son, Jameson A..

loans.use: To support the needs of her fishing business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny S. is married and lives with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples.

S. is a motor-taxi driver and earns an income of USD 7.50 per day. His wife produces and sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 14 per day. He is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new motorbike to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s wife appears in the photograph because S. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his business

loans.name: Kayunga Market Women's Group 1, Kayunga

texts.en:
37-year-old N. Jane of Kayunga Market Women's Group 1, Kayunga, bears testament to the fact that one does not need experience to be an upstart in any business. Going by her own account, all that is needed is a sense of unwavering determination, diligence, pro-activeness, belief, and constant planning. It is now a decade since she took the reins of her vegetable and fruit selling business in Kayunga town market.

Jane is a married mother of two and, along the way, she has not had it easy. In a word, she describes her experiences as chequered, just as in any other business undertaking. That courage of conviction and perseverance, she says, have been her stock in trade.

In a week, Jane makes 60,000 Ugandan shillings and, with this loan, she wants to buy more fresh vegetables and fruits to resell and henceforth make more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Mercedes es viuda, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 5 son estudiantes, Mercedes tiene un cafetín en un colegio en donde vende comida, golosinas, bebidas, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Mercedes solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Los sueños de Mercedes son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una buena casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary). She is widowed and has eight children, five of whom are in school. Mercedes manages a school cafeteria where she sells food, candy, beverages, and fruit. This business enables her to help her children.

Mercedes is requesting a loan of 3000 PEN in order to buy candy and sodas. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals and having a nice house.

loans.use: Purchase candy & sodas

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung T. N. is 49 years old with two children who are in college. Her husband is in construction. Providing tuition for her children is very difficult. Being a farmer, she mainly grows rice and vegetables and raises 200 chickens for their eggs. She sells eggs at both wholesale and retail to earn a daily income.

As a member of SEDA since 2004, she has used loans effectively in expanding her farm. Currently, she would like a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens. Her biggest dream in life is providing good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan M. is currently in the business of designing and selling bedsheets. She is requesting a loan to design, stock and sell more bedsheets.
Juan is 36 years old and married to a driver. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To design, stock and sell more bedsheets

loans.name: Azucena Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos  a la señora Mariana, tiene 60 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, la ultima hija vive con ella en su casa. Su marido es comerciante de ganado.  Ella es parte del Banco Comunal hace ya 5 ciclos y está muy a gusto por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a atender su negocio, tiene una boutique en el centro de Charapoto, local que es arrendado y que lo tiene desde hace varios años. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 17h00, en su local vende ropa y zapatos de todo tipo y precios ya que vende productos nacionales e importados. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada quince días o una vez al mes dependiendo de las ventas que se hayan realizado.

Este crédito es para comprar mas mercadería para surtir la boutique. Sus sueños son tener su propio local para ya no pagar mas arriendo y algún día comprar un carro.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 'San Esteban' community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find 60 year-old Mariana who is married and has 5 grown-up children.  Her youngest daughter lives with her in her home.  Mariana's husband is a cattle salesman.  She has been with her community bank for 5 loan cycles and is very happy with the ease of obtaining a loan.

Mariana is a good housewife who also serves in her business.  She has a boutique in the center of Charapoto.  Her premises are rented and she has had them for several years.  She works every day from 8.00am to 5.00pm in her premises selling clothes and footwear of all kinds and at all prices.  She sells both national and imported products.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every fortnight or once a month, depending on the sales she has made.

Mariana will use this loan to buy more merchandise to stock her boutique.  Her dreams are to have her own premises so that she no longer has to pay rent and also some day to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Josée Nathalie

texts.fr: H. Josée Nathalie est née le 27 Juillet 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AKOSSOU Hervé, un fonctionnaire, Nathalie est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Nathalie vit avec sa famille depuis environs quatorze ans au quartier Midombo à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Nathalie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Nathalie mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (sucre, conserve de sardine et de tomate, lait, couscous, piles, produits de toilette dont les savons, papier hygiénique, etc.)à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est aussi dans ce même marché que Nathalie s'approvisionne. Nathalie exerce cette activité depuis treize ans et a bien remboursé le crédit antérieur obtenu auprès de ALIDé. Face à la demande de plus en plus grande, Nathalie souhaite augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux répondre à sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Nathalie sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en: Josée Nathalie H. was born July 27, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to Hervé Akossou, an officer, Nathalie is a mother of two school age children. Nathalie has lived with her family in Midombo, a neighborhood of Cotonou, for fourteen years. The couple works together to provide for the family. Nathalie only finished primary school so to make a living, she runs a business selling various products (sugar, canned sardines and tomatoes, milk, couscous, batteries, and toiletries, including soap and toilet paper, etc.) at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Nathalie also stocks up in this market.  She has been in business for thirteen years and has completely reimbursed the first loan provided through ALIDé. Faced with increasing demand, Nathalie wishes to increase stock and better serve her customers. This is the reason Nathalie is asking for a new loan.

loans.use: To buy diverse products (soap canned goods, sugar, milk, toiletries, etc.)

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza E. D. B. D. 40 años D. edad, D. 40 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo D. 11 años D. edad, junto a quienes resiD. en Ilopango. María es muy conocida en su lugar D. vivienda, ya que es muy buena vecina y amiga.  Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar y su hijo, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder a sus clientes, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. María es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella familia, la cual es la mayor inspiración para ella y la razón D. la solicitud D. dicho préstamo ya que solo D. esta manera podrá mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Maria Esperanza E. D. Beltran is 40 years old. She lives together with her husband and their 11 year old son. They live in Ilopango. Maria is well known in her community, for being such a good neighbor and friend. She has a produce market that she runs from her home. The business grants her the ability to have all that is necessary for the home and to proviD. for her son. She requests a loan to use as working capital, to equip her business with all that is necessary to proviD. a better quality of service. There have been various occasions when she lost clients for the lack of products they sought. She wants to change all that by improving her business. Maria is a visionary that dreams of coming out ahead and to work day after day for the sake of her family. They are her greatest inspiration and it is the reason why she has requested a loan. It is the only way for her to improve her sales

loans.use: To purchse general food products for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto M. S. tiene 36 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS DEL GRAN PODER, Comunidad de San Ramón esta ubicada en el cantón Chillanes, a 35 minutos de la Oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican exclusivamente a la agricultura.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para que la producción sea de calidad. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir una casa y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto M. S., 36, is married living with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The “JESUS DEL GRAN PODER” communal bank is in San Ramón which is located in Chillanes canton, 35 minutes from the Office in Chillanes.  The members of this communal bank are all farmers.

Carlos is a corn and broad bean farmer.  His purchases and sales both occur in the Chillanes canton market on Sundays.

He is asking for the loan to buy seed, manure and fertilizer so that his crops will be of good quality.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to build a house and provide an education for his children.

He enjoys family excursions.

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Almar

texts.en:
Almar M. is from the village of Danao. He is 20 years old. Almar is single. To make a living, Almar owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Almar has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Almar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Almar is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Almar from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beer and softdrinks

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 20 years and employs three casual laborers. He also earns income from his business of buying and selling horticultural products at the local market. Joshua is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy a water pump and irrigation pipes. He says that these assets will help increase his productivity and that this will earn him more income, which he will use toward educating his children. His biggest challenges have been low market prices for his products and the high cost of transportation.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Josephat Ekwam

texts.en:
Josephat Ekwam E. is a gentle man of twenty-two years who is married to Rhoda Payo, and together they have two children. They live in Eldoret town where his wife runs a grocery store. In the same area Josephat sells goat meat from place to place. He has been in this business for five years now and gets a monthly income of about $75.

This will be Josephat's first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to diversify his business and use the entire loan to buy poultry to raise and sell later at a profit. With the income that he will get, he plans to buy goats for slaughter and later sell the meat. 

In the future, Josephat wants to educate his children to the highest level and also become a big retailer of goat meat in Eldoret.

loans.use: To buy poultry for resale

loans.name: Jennyfe

texts.en:
Jennyfe T. is from the village of Pag-asa, Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Jennyfe is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75  a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jennyfe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Jennyfe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21 year-old single man from Baalback, who has been renting chairs and tables to weddings, funerals and any social activities since 2006. Ali also works as a DJ. Ali is an active man; he's young and it's his time to work hard on improving his business and putting all his effort on that. To do so, Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase the the number of his chairs and tables to cover as many events as he can. Ali hopes to develop and improve his business to reach one day a professional wedding planner level.

loans.use: To increase the number of his chairs and tables

loans.name: Sintia Giannina

texts.es:
La señora Sintia, es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños.
Lleva 2 años y medio como socia de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica al alquiler de moto car (motos), por ahora tiene un solo moto car,  más adelante piensa comprar uno más para poder trabajar  mejor y tener sus propios ingresos, su esposo es profesor, el sueldo es poco pero entre los dos solventan los gastos familiares.

Es un negocio que no le quita mucho tiempo y puede atender también a sus hijos que todavía están pequeños y necesitan mucha atención. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 comprará: 3 llantas, 3 camaras,1 sistema de arrastre,1 tapabarro, 3 litros de aceite.
Su moto car genera ingresos diarios con el cual puede cubrir la cuota de Manuela Ramos.  Tiene mucho cuidado con sus cuotas para no caer en moras y así pueda seguir solicitando nuevos créditos.
texts.en:
Sintia is a member of the Manos Unidas communal bank in the Calleria district within the Ucayali Department.  She is 24, is married and has two small children.

She has been involved with the Manuela Ramos movement for two years and rents out motocars.  She only has one motorcar for now, but she plans to buy one more in the future in order to be able to increase her income.  He husband is a teacher.  His salary is low but between the two of them they are able to cover the household expenses.

This business does not take much time and she can also care for her children who are still young and need lots of attention.  She will use the money from this 1,200 PEN loan to buy 3 tires, 3 cameras, one locking system, one mudguard, and three liters of oil.

Her motorcar generates daily income with which she is able to meet her Manuela Ramos dues.  She is very careful with her dues so that she won’t get into a bad position and will continue to be able to ask for new loans.

loans.use: to buy parts for her motocar

loans.name: Sara Francisco

texts.pt:
Sara Francisco U. nasceu no Distrito de Magude, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 20 a 26 anos de idade, destes 2 vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e naõ sustenta mais ninguem.

Saiu de Magude para Boane devido a transferência do marido, possui um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 8 anos. Naõ tem empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 900.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e a vezes consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma mobilização.Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 9.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (sumo, Feijão, caldos, cebola  e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 3.500.00mt e 3.000.00mt ambos e foram para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para concluir a construção de dependencias e da sua loja.
texts.en:
Sara Francisco U. was born in Magude District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children between 20 and 26 years old; two of the children go to school. Sara only finished fourth grade and did not continue because her parents could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Magude to move to Boane when her husband was transferred. For more than eight years she has had her own business selling staple goods. She has no employees and earns an income of about 900 meticais per month which she uses for household expenses. Sometimes she is able to save some money in her bank account.

Sara has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through an enrollment effort. This is Sara's third Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 9,000 meticais to buy merchandise (juice, beans, broths, onions and other items) to increase the amount of merchandise she has. The previous loans were for 3,500 meticais and 3,000 meticais, and both were for the business.

She promises to make her payments on time so she can take out more loans in the future. She intends to ask for more loans to finish building some bedrooms and building her shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (juice, beans, broths, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Doong

texts.en:
D. is from the village of Maular, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 55 years old, married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, D. runs a coconut farm. He has been engaged in his business for 25 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. 

D. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation.He is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, with which he will redeem his coconut farm land. HE currently rents his farm, but plans to buy it. This will be the second loan taken out by D. from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a coconut farm

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Zulekha operates a cosmetic shop, where her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a motorcycle business which contributes another source of income.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 80,000 KES she wants to purchase stock for her cosmetic business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her cosmetic business.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura, 29, is the leader of this group. She resides in Karabalta, a small town near to Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). 

Her husband went to work in Russia to make money. Ainura takes care of two daughters. Both of them are at school. 

In order to meet the family's needs, Ainura sells children's clothes at the market. At the moment, her business is running well and she decided to apply for the loan in order to increase the commodity turnover. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more clothes for trade. 

In the future, Ainura wants to purchase a vehicle and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothes.

loans.name: Wilber Edwin

texts.es: El joven wilber tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de su padre, wilber se dedica a manejar una moto taxi, viene realizando esta actividad durante 1 año aproximadamente, esta labor la realiza solo de lunes a viernes y los sábados, domingo y feriados se dedica a trabajar en el campo, generando así otros ingresos, el dinero del préstamo será invertido en comprar una moto taxi , y con ello poder ahorrar para poder estudiar una carrera corta, los desafíos que enfrenta es tener que salir a trabajar muy temprano para ganar un poco mas de dinero, el sueño de wilber es comprarse en un futuro no muy lejano un automóvil y así eso le genere mayores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida, wilber esta muy contento con confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Wilber is a 21 year old young man.  He is single, and he lives in his father’s house.  Wilber drives a “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).  He has been doing this for approximately one year.  He only does this on Monday through Friday.  On Saturday, Sunday, and holidays he does field work.  This generates other income.

He will use the money from the loan to buy a moto taxi.  With the moto taxi he will be able to save in order to be able to study for a career.

The challenge he faces is having to leave very early in order to earn a little more money. 

Wilber’s dream is to buy a car in the not so distant future.  It will generate greater income, and he will have a better quality of life.

He is very happy with the confidence placed in him.

loans.use: to buy a moto taxi.

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama el manantial , sus integrantes  decidieron  ponerle ese nombre por que su barrio se llama "El Manantial", estado de Oaxaca  esta conformado por diez integrantes  que se conocen desde aproximadamente 30 años son vecinas y familiares.

La señora Zita  es integrante  del grupo "El Manantial", ella tiene treinta y cinco años de edad, siempre ha vivido en ésta comunidad, es por ello que desde muy pequeña conoce a los demás integrantes del grupo. 
Ella estudio hasta secundo grado de la secundaria  tiene un total de cuatro hijos  dos  mujeres y dos varones , se dedica  a la venta  de calzado  y necesita el préstamo para comprar .
Necesita el préstamo para comprar mas calzado y así exhibirlos en le pequeño local que acaba de construir su esposo para  que cuando no tenga tiempo de salir vende desde su local.
Sus clientes le recomienda que venda todo tipo de calzado lo que son tenis y zapatos escolares  para que  ya no vayan  a otro lugar a comprar.
Uno de sus sueños de la señora  Zita es poner una zapatería para que así tenga algo que dejarles  a  sus hijos.

Los otros  ocho integrantes se llaman :
Isabel-representante del grupo vende frutas y verduras
Antonia- venta de antojitos mexicanos .
Juana- venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Catalina-para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan.
Gloria- para  la compra de  insumos para la elaboración de pan.
Cecilia-venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Luciana-para la elaboración de tamales.
Clara- venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Cecilia-para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Están muy contentas por el apoyo que les a dado fundación realidad para hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Manantial” (The Spring). Its members decided to call it this because their neighborhood is called “El Manantial,” state of Oaxaca.  It has ten members who have known each other for approximately 30 years; they are neighbors and family members.

Zita is a member of the “El Manantial” group and is 35 years old.  She has lived in this community her whole life and for that reason has known the other members of the group for a long time. She studied up to 8th grade.  She has a total of four children, two girls and two boys.  She sells footwear and needs the loan to buy more footwear to display in the small locale that her husband has just finished building so that when she does not have time to go out to sell she can do it from her locale.  Her customers are recommending that she sell all types of footwear, like tennis shoes and shoes for school, so that they won’t go elsewhere to buy.   One of Zita’s dreams is to set up a shoe store to have something to leave to her children.

The other group members are:

Isabel - sells fruits and vegetables.
Antonia - sale of traditional Mexican snacks.
Juana - sale of traditional Mexican snacks.
Catalina - to buy ingredients to make bread.
Gloria - to buy ingredients to make bread.
Cecilia - sale of traditional Mexican snacks.
Luciana - to make tamales.
Clara - sale of traditional Mexican snacks.
Cecilia- sale of traditional Mexican snacks.

They are very happy with the support that Fundación Realidad has given them to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy and sell shoes.

loans.name: Darling Beatriz

texts.es: Darling Beatriz no tiene mucho ingresos, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella vive en la comarca de ranchería, a pesar de no tener muchas condiciones básicas ha sabido trabajar y mantener a su familia por medio de su negocio que es la venta de productos lácteos, además ella labora como docente en una escuela pública fue así que con lo poco que ganaba fue comprando ciertas vacas y terneros hasta establecer el negocio. es por esto que solicita el crédito para la compra de cuajada, leche, crema, queso para suplir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Darling Beatriz does not earn much money, and she has 2 young children to support.  She lives in the Ranchería region.  In spite of not having many basic services, she has learned to work and support her family through a business selling dairy products.  In addition, she works as a teacher in a public school.  That is how, with the little that she earned, she was able to purchase certain cows and plots of land until she had established her business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase curds, milk, cream and cheese in order to meet her customers demands.

loans.use: to purchase curds, milk, cream and cheese.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 37 years old and married with three children between the ages of 5 and 12 years old. Her business is well organized. She employs two people in her business. She has four years experience and she owns a studio to help her photography business. Antoinette operates her business from 8 am to 7 pm every day.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy more cameras and other materials for her studio to produce more pictures. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business, save for the future and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more cameras and other materials for her studio.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has seven children, three of whom are in school.   Rebecca has a business selling sugar cane.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week.   

Rebecca sells her products in a market, retail. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of sugar cane. She also generates additional income through working as a sweeper with the Kampala City council. The main business challenges for Rebecca include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to   start growing sugar cane   and also to sell wholesale only.  

Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugar cane.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, originario de Las Delicias una comunidad localizada en Yali municipio de Jinotega, tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, padre de dos hijos, de oficio agricultor, hoy en día se dedica a la siembra de café.  Sus comienzos en la actividad de la siembra y comercialización del café fue en la finca de  su papa, después el heredo3 manzanas de tierra hace 6 años, pero el desde my temprana edad aprendió a sembrar la tierra junto con su papa quien le enseño todo lo que ahora sabe de agricultura, cuando el no esta sembrando café se dedica a sembrar frijoles como su segundo ingreso. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina de despulpar café. Con esta inversión el quiere reducir costos, pues se evitaría andar alquilando o prestando esa maquina. 
El tiene grande proyectos que le gustaría realizar en su finca uno de ello es mejorar sus finca de café hacerla mas productiva,  sacar una cosecha con una lata calidad de café orgánico, y convertir una área ecológica en parte de sus terrenos pues el se considera amante a la naturaleza y desea tener un área exclusiva solo ecológica y ambiental.
texts.en:
William is from Las Delicias, a community located in Yali, in the Jinotega municipality. He is 32, married, and the father of two children. He is a farmer. He currently cultivates coffee. He started off sowing and selling coffee on his father's farm. He inherited three manzanas [a land measurement unit equivalent to 1.740 acres] six years ago, but he learned to sow the land at a very young age with his dad who taught him everything he knows about agriculture. When he is not planting coffee he plants beans for a second income.
He needs this loan to purchase a machine to depulp coffee. With this investment he wants to reduce costs, since he won't have to rent or borrow this machine. 
He has big projects that he would like to realize on his farm. One of these is to improve his coffee farm, making it more productive with high quality organic coffee. He wants to convert part of his land into an ecological area because he is a nature lover and wants to have an area that is exclusively ecological and environmental.

loans.use: to buy a machine to depulp coffee.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 26 años, es una mujer alegre y laboriosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Yuri de 27 años y su querido hijo, a quien desea brindarle una buena comodidad. En su querido pueblo de Rosario, Zonia ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por ende que ahora es toda una conocedora de la actividad agrícola. Hoy trabaja en sus propias tierras al lado de su amado pareja donde viene cultivando cacao, café y árboles maderables, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a los miembros de su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde percibe mejores precios por cada uno de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder cumplir sus objetivos y por lo cual esta dispuesto en cumplir con el pago respectivo de sus cuotas. Con los 3, 000 soles solicitados, adquirirá abonos y fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus plantas y así sacar buen provecho en cuanto a sus frutos.
texts.en: Zonia, age 26, is a happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her partner Yuri, age 27, and their beloved son, to whom she wants to provide all the comforts. Zonia has spent the majority of her life in her beloved village of Rosario. From a very young age she learned the family business, and now she knows everything there is to know about farming. She now works on her own land with her beloved partner. They cultivate cocoa, coffee, and timber-yielding trees. This work has provided them with the necessary income to maintain their family. They sell everything that they harvest to the distribution centers in San Francisco city. There they receive better prices for all of their products. What she most enjoys about her work is sowing her lands, and she does so with great care. She has done this work for 10 years and finds the most difficult part to be transporting her products, since the freight cars are scarce in the Valle Rio Apurimac forest region. With time, she wants to buy new lands with the goal of increasing production. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she hopes for a small loan so that she can achieve her goals. She is prepared to repay her quotas. With the 3,000 requested soles, she will buy manure and natural fertilizers to improve her plants and thus benefit greatly from the harvest.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nadien

texts.en: Nadien is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives in Rafah City in Gaza, located in the Palestine. Nadien's family owns a grocery store which is the only source of income for them. She wants to purchase more groceries for the store so that there will be a better selection for sale, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for them, so she needs to take out a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Nadien gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more groceries and have a better selection for sale and thus share in increasing the family income and improving the family's standard of living. Nadien is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for the grocery store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman and she and her husband have four children, whom they hope to give good education, up to the university level. She owns a tailoring services business in which she makes and sells clothes to the local people. 

Anna's business is located at a busy market in Nairobi. She has been running this business for the last 12 years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is financial constraints. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more materials to make more clothes to sell, especially as we near Christmas festivities. She describes herself as resilient and outspoken.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Erenia Maritza

texts.es:
Erenia de 50 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada  “Suburbio”.
El negocio de ella lo inicio hace 13 años, es un bazar ubicado en la parte delantera de  su vivienda.,
Ella inicio esta actividad con un pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, e la cual con un pequeño capital incremento su negocio, ahora es un bazar.
El horario de ella es de lunes a viernes, inicia de las 8:00  hasta las 22:00.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia ya que su sector se ha tomado peligroso.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: lápiz, cuaderno, borrador, plumas, etc.
El sueño de ella es que con la bendición de Dios y la ayuda de banco D-Miro empiece a incrementar  su negocio en donde generar más ingreso de dinero
texts.en:
Erenia is 50 years old and lives in a suburb called "Suburbio". She started her own business 13 years ago. She runs a bazaar located in the front part of her house. She started this business with a small business selling soft drinks and which with a small capital investment she grew into what is now a bazaar. She works Monday through Friday from 08:00 until 22:00. The problem she faces is crime as her area has become dangerous.

She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise such as: pencils, notebooks, erasers, pens, etc. Her dream is that with 'la bendicion de Dios' ('God's blessing') and the help of the communal bank D-Miro she can start growing her business in the areas that are the most profitable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pencils, notebooks, erasers, pens, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year-old married man living with his wife and five children. He has 15 years of experience working as a farmer and has been running his own farm since 2001. He cultivates all types of vegetables and uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents allow him to better monitor his products' quality during the year. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the supplies he needs to install a new plastic tent in his farm. He estimates that during the coming harvest, his profits will be increased by 10%.

loans.use: to buy the supplies he needs to install a new plastic tent in his farm.

loans.name: Sikulu Reformed A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sikulu Reformed A Group in Western Kenya! Solomon is the facilitator of the Sikulu Reformed A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Solomon is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Solomon had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Solomon was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Solomon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Solomon will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sikulu Reformed A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 47 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Liloan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years, she has been selling fertilized duck eggs. Esterlita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost two months.

Esterlita is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilized duck eggs to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her standard of living and earn a lot through her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilized duck eggs to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
To earn a living, Beverly and her husband help each other in managing their corn farming business to increase their yields. They endure the hardships and difficulties they encounter in life because they want to improve their state of living and give their children a bright future. They aim to increase their yields so that they will earn a higher income and finance the education of their children.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy farm materials like fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of their corn production business. She and her husband believe this loan will help them to make an improvement in their business, and they hope they will have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm materials like fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of her corn production

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Josefina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Josefina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Josefina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mujeres De Choxbajan Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Veronica es casada, tiene 24 años  de edad, cursó  los 5 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la venta de artículos de costura, a la mercería, vende hilos de diferentes clases, telas para blusas, adornos para delantales, entre otros. Inició este negocio con un capital pequeño ya hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mercería para su negocio, consistente en hilos de alta ceda, hilos carrizo, adornos para delantales, cipers, y entre otros productos. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, agricultura, y a la agropecuario.
texts.en:
Verónica, 24, is married.  She attended fifth grade in elementary school.  She has a son.  She sells sewing supplies and notions.  She sells various kinds of thread, fabric for blouses, decorations for aprons, among others.  She started the business with a small amount of capital and to date has four years’ experience.  Her husband, who is a merchant, supports her efforts.

She organized a group to request a loan that will help her buy merchandise consisting of high-quality silk thread, wicker thread, decorations for aprons, zippers, among other products for her business.  The rest of the members are merchants, farmers and raise livestock.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lyova

texts.ru:
Лева родился  в 1958 году в городе Капане. Он окончил Ереванское Педагогическое училище, и по специальности он учитель истории. 
Лева женат и у него двое детей: сын и дочь. Сын женат и живет отдельно от родителей, дочь окончила Ереванское Педагогическое училище и сейчас проживает вместе с матерью в Ереване. Лева в данный момент живет со своим отцом-пенсионером. 
Лева более 7 лет является руководителем благотворительной организации, которая организует бесплатную раздачу еды малоимущим пожилым людям. Параллельно со своей работой, Лева занимается выращиванием овощей, фруктов и ягод на продажу начиная с 1990 года. У него есть участок земли в деревне Багабурдж (Baghaburj), Сьюникской области, где он выращивает яблоки, груши, клубнику, зелень и т.д. У него много постоянных клиентов как в самой деревне, так и в городе Капане.     
 Лева является клиентом организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon) уже на протяжении многих лет, и сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 900.000 драм для постройки теплицы. В теплице Лева сможет выращивать клубнику и зелень круглый год, что позволит ему увеличить доход своей семьи в будущем.
texts.en:
Lyova was born in 1958 in the town of Kapan. He graduated from Yerevan Pedagogical School and by specialty he is a history teacher. 
 
Lyova is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. His son is married and lives separately from his parents; his daughter graduated from Yerevan Pedagogical School and now lives with her mother in Yerevan. Lyova currently lives with his retired father. 

For more than seven years, Lyova has been the head of a charitable organization that organizes free distribution of food to low-income seniors. In parallel with his work, Lyova is engaged in growing vegetables, fruits and berries for sale since 1990. He has a plot of land in the village of Baghaburj, Syunikskoy district, where he grows apples, pears, strawberries, greens, and the like. He has many loyal customers in the village and also in Kapan.     
 
Lyova has been a client of Nor Horizon for many years, and now he needs a loan of 900,000 drams for the construction of a greenhouse. In the greenhouse, Lyova can grown strawberries and greens year round, allowing him to increase the income for his family in the future.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is taking another Kiva loan of 50,000 to boost her retail shop business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and pay for her business permit. The previous loan had a lot of impact as she was able to stock her retail shop which increased her monthly income. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale and pay for business permit.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA, sont toutes des femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 49 ans, 4 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Koulikoro, Région de Ségou (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de céréales.
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur vingtième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments et des céréales.
La cliente AWA, deuxième personne debout à partir de la droite, compte acheter des condiments avec les grossistes de Massigui pour ensuite les vendre  à domicile et en ambulante dans le village  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The members of the Djantoyerela group are all married women, averaging 49 years of age, with four children, and living in traditional extended families in the village of Fala Koulikoro, Segou Region (the second administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell food condiments and cereals. The members of the Djantoyerela group are on the 20th solidarity loan, to be used for the purchase of condiments and cereals.

The client Awa, the second person standing from right to left, plans to buy condiments from wholesalers in Massigui in order to resell them later out of her home and as a street vendor in her village to a customer base composed mainly of women. She plans to achieve an average monthly benefit of 12,500 West African Francs, which will be used for family needs, with one part reinvested in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments.

loans.name: Djidja Group

texts.fr:
Djidja est un regroupement de femmes  du quartier Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers : habits, parures, poissons,  savons, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.  Kadia est un membre du groupe Djidja, première personne à droite, qui fait de l’habillement et des parures.        
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des colis d’habits et de parures pour enfants pour les revendre.   Elle se procure de ses habits et parures au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue ses ventes  en détail, au comptant et à crédit à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djidja comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 210 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Kadia  compte réaliser 240 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement de prêt, elle utilise une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Djidja is a group of women from the Koulikoro neighborhood of the city of Koutiala, who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 44 years old, married, and mothers to at least four children. This group of women sells sundry items: clothes, jewelry, fish, soap, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. 

Kadia is a member of Djidja, pictured first on the right, who makes clothing and jewelry. She plans to use her loan to purchase parcels of children's clothing and jewelry to resell. She gets her clothes and jewelry at the Koutiala market and conducts her retail sales on a cash and credit basis at home and at the market. Her customers are both male and female. While the other members of the Djidja group hope to make a monthly profit of 210,000 francs CFA each during this cycle, Kadia expects to make 240,000 francs CFA. In addition to loan repayment, she will use a portion of her income to meet her personal expenses and increase her business funds.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelina R. Marquez has a small butcher shop. Every day her sons help her in the business. She started selling groceries but then she changed to sell meat. She started the business 3 years ago. The business is growing and running very well, that's why the business needs a bigger freezer. This new freezer will give a better customer service and more meat sales.

Mrs.Evangelina R. needs a bigger freezer because the current one is very small and is not working very well. Mrs Evangelina knows that most important for a butcher shop is a good freezer. She is asking for a loan of $1200. With this money she plans to buy the freezer. Mrs Evangelina R. wants to pay back in 1 year.

Español

La Sra. Evangelina R. Marquez tiene una pequeña Carnicería. Sus Hijos la ayudan en el negocio, ella comenzó vendiendo abarrotes y luego cambio a la venta de carne. El negocio va bien y va creciendo, por lo cual necesita un congelador mas grande y mejor. Este nuevo Congelador proporcionaría un mejor servicio a los clientes y mayores venta de Carne razón por la cual la Sra. Evangelina R. necesita para su negocio un congelador nuevo, con mayor capacidad y con mejor funcionamiento, ella sabe que lo mas importante para un a carnicería es un buen congelador. Ella solicita un préstamo de $1200.00, con este importe planea comprar un congelador nuevo con mayor capacidad, planea pagarlo mensualmente durante un año.

loans.use: new freezer

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Kubra A. works out of her home making hand-made carpets in the small town of Devechi, which is just south of Khachmaz. She is looking for funding so that she can purchase more supplies and hire another worker to increase productivity. It takes a long time to make a carpet by hand and she has more requests then she can currently handle.

loans.use: To hire another employee and to purchase more supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of quality shoes for sale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith E. is 32 years old, married with three children, and sells foodstuffs for the public. She is eager to expand her business with an additional loan amount.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
Enedina is originally from San Juanito, Chihuahua. She is married and has 2 daughters. Her husband works in a sawmill, but his salary is not enough to cover all the family's expenses. Due to the need of extra income, Enedina started her own business by opening up an ice cream shop. Due to her clients' demands, she also added video game machines (video arcade). Thanks to her good customer service and good location, her sales have increased considerably.

To keep growing, Enedina is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD to purchase a video game machine in order to provide better customer service. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of the development of this business and of the lives of Enedina and her family. They greatly appreciate your trust and support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Enedina es originaria de San Juanito en Chihuahua, está casada y tiene dos hijas, su esposo trabaja en un aserradero de la localidad pero el salario que recibe no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante la falta de un ingreso extra Enedina inició su propio negocio vendiendo helados, a petición de sus clientes después incorporó la renta de máquinas de video juegos y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y a su buena ubicación se han incrementado mucho sus ventas.

Para continuar creciendo como hasta ahora Enedina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de una máquina de video para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de Enedina y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To purchase a video game machine

loans.name: Merciana Clara Salom

texts.pt:
Merciana N. is 48 years old, single and a mother of 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Patrice Lumumba in Maputo. She has a stall in the Patrice Lumumba market where she sells various basic food products. She entered the program in April of 2007 with an initial loan for 6,000MT. She wants to take out another loan for 12,000MT to be repaid within 6 months to purchase additional merchandise for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Merciana N. tem 48 anos de idade, é solteira , mãe de 5 filhos e vive no bairro Patrice Lumumba em Maputo.Tem uma barraca no mercado Patrice Lumumba onde vende diversos produtos de 1ª necessidade.Entrou para o programa em Abril de 2007 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT.Vai tomar um empréstimo de 12.000MT pagável em 6 meses para compra de mercadoria para o negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: I am a mother of four children: three boys and one girl. My husband works at a government institute and his pay is very scanty. It was impossible for us to manage our living with his salary.  In order to increase our household income, I started a thread reels business. I get thread on order from various thread producing factories, wind it on small plastic reels and then wrap them in plastic covers. I then supply these reels back to the factory who in turn gives me a reasonable rate of profit. I want to expand my business for which I request a loan of $350. I will buy a machine to wind thread on plastic reels. This way my work will become efficient and I will be able to take on bigger orders.

loans.use: Buy a machine that is used to wind thread on reels

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Don Justo was born in a farming family, it is natural of Quebrada Imperial and he always wished to become a great farmer, he feels he focuses on the cultivation of potatos and peas, until now he conserved his optimism for progress and thinks that the losses of the past year are not for consideration and observes with much optimism his future. Don Justo doesn’t neglect his role as a father and many times he sacrifices during long hours of endless working days with the objective of the wellbeing of his family. These days his dear wife confronts a delicate situation, due to a health condition she has deteriorated considerably. He is father to three children whom he has trained with a lot of care to forge in them the useful values of correct involvement in the community. He wished to buy fertilizer for his crops and fortified seeds for this sowing season. We consider the petition so that this father of a family can increase his profits and give his dear companion adequate medical treatment.
