Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Justo nació en una familia netamente agrícola, es natural de Quebrada Imperial y siempre anheló convertirse en un gran agricultor, su siembra se concentra en el cultivo de papa y arveja, hasta ahora conserva ese gran optimismo por progresar y piensa que las pérdidas del año pasado no son de consideración y observa con mucho optimismo su futuro. Don Justo no descuida su rol de padre y muchas veces se sacrifica durante largas horas de interminables jornadas con el objetivo de otorgarle bienestar a su familia. En estos momentos su querida esposa enfrenta una situación muy delicada, debido a que una afección en su salud la ha deteriorado notablemente. Es padre de tres hijos a los que ha instruido con mucho cariño a fin de forjar en ellos valores muy útiles para su correcto desenvolvimiento dentro de su comunidad.Anhela comprar abonos de granja para sus cultivos y semillas mejoradas para esta época de siembra. Posibilitemos su petición para que este padre de familia incremente sus ganancias y pueda otorgarle un adecuado tratamiento a su querida compañera.

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer for his farm lands and fortified seeds to increase the quality of his products.anhelo

loans.name: Mercedes De Fatima

texts.es:
Senora Mercedes started her small business because she needed to help cover her household costs. Her husband was not earning enough to take care of the house and the children's education. She began 13 years ago in the market at the Leon station, and has generated income to take care of her family and grow the business.

It's important to note that Mercedes is a very hardworker, opening her business very early in the morning every day to serve her loyal customers. For 3 years now she has been working with loans from Ceprodel, which have helped her invest in her business. So far she has received and repaid 10 loans.

La pulpería de la señora Mercedes nace a partir de la necesidad de mantener su hogar debido a que su esposo no obtenía suficientes ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijos en edad escolar. El negocio nace desde hace 13 años en el mercado la Estación de la ciudad de León y hoy en día ha generado ganancias que le han servido para mantener su hogar y su negocio.

Algo muy importante de destacar es que la señora Mercedes es muy esforzada debido a que todos los días desde muy tempranas horas abre las puertas de su negocio para esperar a sus fieles clientes. Desde hace 3 años ha obtenido créditos en Ceprodel que según cuenta le han beneficiado para sacar adelante su negocio e invertir en la infraestructura de su local que es su meta. Su record es de 10 créditos con Ceprodel.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL GENERAL STORE WHICH SHE RUNS FROM A STAND IN THE STATION OF LEON.

loans.name: Carmita

texts.es:
Carmita S. is a single mother who has supported her daughter selling clothes, for the past six years, initially in the area where she lives and later in nearby towns. She also works as domestic help three days a week, which allows her to meet new clients. Her 17 years old daughter has married and lives with her husband, but Carmita continues to sell clothes, as this is her main income. In the future she wishes to have her own store.

At present Carmita doesn’t have a lot of merchadise in stock. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $300, which she will repay in five months. With the money she will be able to buy more season clothes and increase the variety she offers. With your help, Carmita will be able to establish her business and save for expenses that might arise.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmita S. es madre soltera y durante 6 años ha mantenido a su hija vendiendo ropa, inicialmente en la comisaría donde vive y después en poblaciones cercanas. También es empleada doméstica 3 días a la semana, lo que la ayuda a conocer más clientes. Su hija, quien tiene 17 años, ya se casó y vive con su esposo, pero ella continua vendiendo por que es su único ingreso. En un futuro ella desea tener su propio local.

Sin embargo Carmita no cuenta actualmente con mucha mercancía. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 5 meses. Con este dinero Carmita podrá comprar más ropa de temporada para poder tener variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Carmita podrá establecer su negocio y ahorrar para los gastos que se le presenten.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys O. is 42 years old, married with 3 children, and lives in Benin City. She buys yams from the northern part of Nigeria and sells them to retailers in Benin City. She started this business in 2005 and learned how to do it for 16 months prior to that from her friend. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $875 to enable her to buy more yams to sell. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour S. is a weaver, and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. Silk dresses are very expensive because they are hard to make and it takes time to complete each dress. A well-made silk dress with good decoration and silk can cost about $100. Hand woven fabric is more expensive than machine-made, and people prefer hand-made fabric. People wear silk dresses during the Khmer New Year and other traditional ceremonies.

Hour S. earns an average of $9 per day. Her husband teaches the Khmer language. He earns about $1.50 per day, which supplements the household income. They have two children, who are students.

To expand the weaving business, Hour S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase silk, beads, and sewing needles.

loans.use: To purchase silk, beads, and sewing needles

loans.name: Thouen

texts.en: Thouen N., 27 years old, is a housewife and resides in Siem Reap where her two children are students. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. Her husband,Tem Sokhon, who is 29, is a motorbike mechanic and earns approximately $3 US per day. At home they care for an elderly father. To earn more money, Thouen plans to purchase a plot of land near the school to open a small stand to sell groceries.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land near the school and open a small stand to sell groceries.

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan Santos owns a farm business producing cereal crops in the Somotillo district in the city of Chinandega. His efforts have made him known as a successful businessman and enabled him to support his wife and two children.

Currently Juan is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of crop inputs and has turned to Ceprodel for credit. With the loan he will be able to save his crops, have an excellent harvest and, in doing so, improve his financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Juan Santos es un caballero que se dedica al negocio agrícola a la producción de granos básicos en su municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha destacado para salir adelante en su negocio y mantener a su cónyuge y dos hijos.

Actualmente el propósito por el cual solicita el crédito es para la inversión en la compra de insumos para los cultivos. Este es el motivo por el cual él acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito y de esta manera salvar sus cultivos para tener una excelente cosecha y así mejorar su condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase of inputs for planting crops

loans.name: Edna's Malaika Group

texts.en:
Edna is 33-years-old, married and has four children, ages 18, 11, 8 and 2. She began selling clothes and cosmetics in 2003. She works from 8AM to 12PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Edna now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and cosmetics items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, shop ownership, fish and tomatoes sales, clothes sales, and rice and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and cosmetics items for resale

loans.name: Asha's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Asha is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 7, 5, and 2 years old. She has been a coconut seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 65 from her sales.

Asha is now requesting a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, bites sales, and fish sales.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Davann

texts.en:
Mrs. Davann Y., 44, cooks food to sell from her house in her village. She has been selling food since 2005 and typically earns around US$ 5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Phoun Y., 44, is a carpenter who earns around US$ 7 per day.

Davann has four children, all of whom live at home and help Mr. Phoun with his work, living in Ratanak Commune in the Siem Reap Province. To increase income for the family, Davann wants to sell her food by transporting it to customers' homes. She needs a motorcycle to use as transportation, but lacks the money to purchase one. Hence, she would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to use as business transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use for her business

loans.name: María Maximina

texts.es:
La señora María Maximina tiene 73 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Decididas II y al Club de Madres Cristo Redentor. Vive en la calle Las Jadeítas Mz A21 lote 25, de la Urbanización La Rinconada, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
María Maximina no estudió porque no tuvo apoyo de sus padres, es analfabeta, pero le enseñaron a escribir su nombre. Se casó a los 25 años con Pablo Vaca y tuvieron 7 hijos, todos ya independientes.
Se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y panca para alimento de animales pequeños, lo hace en la puerta de su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas,  recuerda que en ese tiempo vendía como ambulante en la avenida César Vallejo, compró pan para volver a vender y fue allí donde empezó a vender panca y alfalfa porque con el préstamo también compró esos productos.
Con este crédito de 700 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en panca y alfalfa.
María sueña con estar completamente sana y tener una tienda dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
María Maximina is 73 years old and she belongs to the “Mujeres Decididas II” (Determined Women II) communal bank and to the “Club de Madres Cristo Redentor.” She lives on Las Jadeítas Street, Block A21, Lot 25, in the La Rinconada development, in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department, Peru. María Maximina didn’t study because she didn’t have the support of her parents. She is illiterate, but she was taught how to sign her name. She got married when she was 25 years old to Pablo Vaca and they had 7 children, all of whom are now independent. She sells alfalfa and corn leaves as small animal feed. She does this from the door of her house. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 payments, she remembers that at that time she was working as a street vendor in Cesar Vallejo Avenue. She bought bread to sell and that is when she also started to sell alfalfa and corn leaves, because with that loan she also bought those products. With this loan of 700 soles, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy alfalfa and corn leaves. María dreams of being completely healthy and having a store inside her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase corn leaves and alfalfa.

loans.name: Pouv

texts.en:
Mr. Pouv C., 45, is a teacher who teaches secondary school and gets a salary for $50 per month. He lives in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province, and is married to Mrs. Phon Long, 43. Phon makes a living farming rice. She is the mother of four kids who attend school. 

Pouv is applying for a loan to purchase raw materials to make stoves and to buy nets to resell as another source of income. This income increase will help with supporting the children and their education.

loans.use: to purchase stove-making materials

loans.name: La Alianza Group

texts.en: La Alianza is a group from an extremely poor area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic. In this group, many of the women have already received loans and have their own small business. Dionicia S. is the group representative, and a great example of the power of micro-credit. She came to Esperanza International with no form of income and was living in extreme poverty. Dionicia is the mother of 4 older children, and had to give everything she had just to feed them. As her children got older and she started to have a little more time she realized she wanted something different from her life, and knew she had to do something about it. She then applied for a small loan so she could start her own small store, which she started as a small stand in her neighborhood. She sold simple things like candy, rice, and other cheaper items. She worked hard and was able to increase her business to the point today where she has her own small store! She is finally making some good money, and is happy with what she is doing. She can finally save money and help out her children when they need it. She finally feels like she can provide, and feels like she has something of her own. She is a great story of success, and is continuing to increase her business. She hopes to keep on increasing in size and hopes to have a giant store someday.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase food for her store

loans.name: Aperila

texts.en: Aperila T., 31, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in a BBQ business. She sells to the passing traffic 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD). SPBD loans are Aperila’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of loan will help in renovating her house.

loans.use: To purchase a box of chicken, lamb flaps, sausages, soya sauce, cooking oil, onions, foam plates, and foils.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Q. es comerciante de carne de res y tiene una tienda de abarrotes, trabaja con su esposa e hijos. Toda la familia colabora para que el negocio pueda generar recursos económicos para la manutención de la familia, tiene su casa propia ubicado en la zona Villa Ingenio ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería, de esa forma podrá surtir con diferentes productos para satisfacer a su clientela.
 
Es el sexto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Miguel Q. is a beef vendor and runs a general store. He works alongside his wife and children. The whole family collaborates so that the business can generate financial resources to cover the household expenses. He has his own house, which is located in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise so that he can restock his shop with a variety of products to meet customer demand.

This is his sixth loan with Impro. His excellent repayment history with the institute qualifies him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
El señor José Mercedes Portillo Ortiz está casado con la señora Valeriana Guillen, tienen 4 hijos; todos mayores de edad y viven en forma independiente.

 El señor José en principio se dedicaba en construcción de casas,  de esta actividad comenzó a  juntar un poco de capital y con el cual monto una cabina telefónica en el predio de su casa. Como tiene una esposa muy activa y emprendedora  monto un pequeño  copetín que les  genera también un ingreso de consideración. El crédito solicitado es para comprar saldo de mini carga telefónica para su posterior venta al público.

Tiene casa propia, y su máximo sueños refaccionarlo de a poco, por que actualmente tiene con esternit y con el tiempo quiere cambiar por tejas, el cliente ya fue beneficiado con los créditos que ofrece kiva y manifiesta que le sirvió bastante porque gracias a eso pudo aumentar sus ingresos, pero sigue con la necesidad de inyección de capital para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Mercedes Portillo Ortiz and his wife Valeriana Guillen have four grown children who are now living on their own. Jose mainly works in housing construction, and has been successful enough to put away sufficient capital to allow him to install a cell phone booth outside his house. His wife is also quite entrepreneurial and she manages a small coffee shop which provides them with additional income. The purpose of the loan is to allow Jose to buy phone minutes which he can then re-sell to the public at a profit. With his earnings, he hopes to be able to make improvements to his house, such as replacing the asbestos cement roofing sheets with clay tile. He has successfully obtained Kiva loans previously, and they have helped him increase his income. He expects to be able to continue increasing his earning power with the present loan request.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase phone minutes for re-sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 24 años se dedica a la venta del platillo llamado “papa rellena”, lo hace de manera ambulante, recorriendo las calles de su localidad para vender lo que ha preparado con tanta dedicación. Se levanta muy temprano para salir a partir de las 9am con una fuente y las salsas con las que acompaña a su platillo. Cada mes Martha se abastece de sacos de papa para tener siempre el producto base de su actividad, además de otros ingredientes que ella utiliza en su elaboración. Una vez que termina de vender, Martha descansa por las tardes y permanece en su casa para atender a sus hijos. En el futuro quiere seguir vendiendo comida al paso, pero con un carrito sanguchero, que es como una pequeña cocina móvil que incluye una pequeña parrilla para diversas frituras, esto lo haría por las tardes, frente a su casa y por las mañanas continuaría con sus papas rellenas. Es la tercera vez que Martha tiene un préstamo con MFP, es una integrante que promueve el trabajo solidario, por lo que es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más sacos de papa de 100 kilos, queso, carne y demás ingredientes para la preparación de su platillo.
texts.en:
Martha, 43, lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. For 24 years she has sold the dish called "stuffed potato", traveling through the streets of her area to sell what she has prepared with such dedication. She gets up very early to be out by 9am with the dish and the sauces that accompany her dish. Every month Martha stocks up on sacks of potatoes so she will always have the basic stock for her creation, as well as the other ingredients that she uses in her creation. Once she has finished selling, Martha rests in the afternoon and stays in her house to tend her children. In the future she would like to keep selling her food, but using a "carrito sanguchera" that is like a little mobile kitchen including a little grill for various frying. She would do this in the afternoons in front of her house, and in the morning would continue to sell her stuffed potatoes. This is the third time that Martha has taken a loan through MFP. She is a member who promotes self-employment because she is one of the founders of this communal bank. The money that she is requesting is to buy more 100 kilo sacks of potatoes, cheese, meat, and other ingredients for the preparation of her dish.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of potatoes for the preparation of her dish

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda tiene  65 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y sus hijos, quienes son las personas que la motivaron a crecer cada día como madre, pareja y comerciantemente. Y gracias al esfuerzo que muestra en su trabajo logró adquirir una casa donde están enfocados todos sus sueños por cumplir. Desde que se casó tuvo que buscar la forma de  mantener su hogar, para ello trabajó junto a su esposo en el comercio. Gracias a los años de trabajo, su pareja logró adquirir un auto con el cual trabaja ahora todos los días. Entonces Florinda optó por dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, y desde hace 5 años sale a las calles con sus catálogos en mano para visitar a sus amistades, quienes se han convertido en sus clientes más fieles, dándole la posibilidad de crecer como promotora y consultora de belleza. Sin embargo, los costos de venta tienden a variar en diversas fechas y cuando esto sucede confecciona algunos tejidos o peluches para venderlos en las ferias. Esta labor la mantiene ocupada todo el día, sobre todo porque hay que cobrar por los productos distribuidos; siendo este motivo el que la llevó a tomar la decisión de asociarse con su hija mayor para instalar, en su domicilio, una botica, donde trabajen sin tener que trasladarse a diversos lugares, sino solo velar por la buena atención al cliente. Florinda lleva varios años en MFP, trabajando en grupos, pero éste es su primer crédito individual y espera ser cumplidora con los pagos, de la misma forma que ha sido en su grupo de socias donde trabajan en equipo y de manera organizada. El préstamo de 1000 soles será destinado a la compra de mercadería y vitrinas para su botica, ya que los productos están en espera de ser exhibidos.
texts.en:
Florinda is 65 years old and she shares her life with her husband and children who are the people who motivate her to grow each day as a mother, partner, and businesswoman. Thanks to the effort that she has put into her work, she has been able to buy a house where she can focus on her dreams. Ever since she got married she has had to find a way to maintain her household and for this reason she worked with her husband in sales. Thanks to years of work, her husband was able to buy a car that he uses for work every day. Florinda decided to dedicate herself to the sale of cosmetics and for the past 5 years she has taken to the streets, catalogs in hand, to visit her friends who have become her most loyal clients. This has given her the possibility to grow as salesperson and a beauty consultant. But her costs tends to vary depending on the date and when this happens, she makes knitted objects and stuffed animals to sell at fairs. This work keeps her occupied the entire day, mostly because she has to collect payments for the products she has distributed. For this reason she decided to become a business associate with her oldest daughter to start a drugstore in her house where they can work without having to travel to different locations. They can just focus on providing good customer service. Florinda has been a part of MFP for many years, working in groups, but this is her first individual loan and she hopes to be reliable with her payments, the same way that she had been in her members group where they work as a team in an organized manner. The loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) will be used to purchase merchandise and display cabinets for her store, because her products are waiting to be put on display.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise stock

loans.name: Minovar

texts.ru: Миновар – 34 лет. Она замужем и мать 4-х детей. Её муж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Миновар было всего лишь 10 овец. Но год назад она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Сейчас у Миновар две дойной коровы. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат. Миновар очень рада что в трудный момент ее жизни наша организация помогает ей.
texts.en:
Minovar is 34 years old. She is married and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband went to Russia to work. Here he could not find a good job in order to save money and purchase livestock for himself. Minovar had just 10 sheep. But a year ago she found out about credit from our organization and came to take out a loan to purchase one dairy cow. Today, Minovar has two dairy cows. Until her husband finds a job in Russia and sends her money, her brother will help her. Minovar is very happy that our organization is helping her at a difficult moment in her life.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Aïssatou Thierno

texts.fr: Aïssatou Thierno D. est une femme mariée de 41 ans avec 5 enfants en charge. Elle tient un étalage de commerce de divers légumes au marché et  aimerait renforcer cette activité. Les revenus générés lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Thierno D., age 41, is a married woman who has five children to support. She has a display for selling various vegetables at the marketplace, and she would like to bolster this business. The revenues generated will enable her to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables and various condiments

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 54 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Adnan has been selling electrical items since 1988. He requests this loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work.

This is Adnan's third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Adnan first started his business, he didn't have a lot of cash. He chose his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his electrical goods store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 32 años, es soltero y un hombre muy consecuente; tiene su casa propia, pero para las horas de almorzar frecuentemente visita la casa de su madre. Se dedica a las labores agrícolas, en especial a la siembra de piñas y como desde muy joven ha sembrado esta fruta, en su pueblo lo llaman “el piñero”. Todos estos años sus cultivos le han resultado muy rentables, la única dificultad que tiene es que en el momento de la cosecha algunas hojas hieren sus manos hasta sangrar, a pesar de esto, le gusta mucho su trabajo y para comercializar sus productos los envía a un mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Lima. Samuel presta toda su atención y cuidado a sus cultivos, puesto que sabe que gracias a ello adquirió un carro con el que ahora trabaja haciendo transporte de carga desde las chacras hasta el pueblo y eso le genera otro ingreso económico. Ahora, sus sueños están en conformar su propia familia, para después emprender un negocio de compra y venta de frutas. Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, durante los cuatro periodos concluidos demostró responsabilidad en cada uno de sus pagos y del mismo modo se compromete a seguir cumpliendo. Cabe recalcar que Samuel es un hombre muy cumplidor, digno de confianza, tiene el cargo de fiscal en su banco comunal, puesto que en cada una de las reuniones demuestra formalidad, por lo que todos le guardan respeto. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de 28 sacos de fertilizantes químicos, calcula que le costará un aproximado de 2660 soles, el resto del dinero es para pagar el jornal de sus trabajadores.
texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years old, single, and is a very consistent man. He owns his own house but for lunch he often visits his mother’s house. He works in agriculture, especially planting pineapple, and because he has been planting this fruit ever since he was young, they call him “El piñero” (The pineapple man) in his town.

All of these years his harvest has been very profitable. The only difficulty that he has is that when he harvests the fruit some of the leaves cut his hands until they bleed, but in spite of this, he really likes his job. To sell his produce he sends it to a wholesale market in the city of Lima. Samuel puts all of his care and attention into his crops because he knows that thanks to them, he was able to buy a car which he now uses to transport cargo from farms to the town and this generates another source of income for him.

Now his dream is to satisfy his family’s needs, so that later he can start a business buying and selling fruit. This is his 5th loan with MFP. During the previous four terms he showed responsibility in each one of his payments and he intends to continue the same way. It should be emphasized that Samuel is a very reliable, honorable, trustworthy man. He holds the fiscal manager position in his communal bank and he takes each of the meetings seriously, for which all members respect him.

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of 28 bags of chemical fertilizers, which he calculates will cost about 2660 Soles, the rest of the money is to pay his day laborers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pay day laborers.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren S., 60, lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest son is 29 years old and is currently unemployed. His 17-year-old son is a high school student.

Purevsuren is a carpenter. He makes wooden furniture, including sofas, chairs, tables, etc. He has been in the carpentry business since 2000. Compared to the beginning when he started with 300,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT), his business has expanded and business capital has increased to 2,100,000 MNT. He says that, because of his small business, he has been able to raise his five children and help the three oldest ones to have their own lives. His hope is now to make sure that his two youngest children get married and launch their own businesses.

Purevsuren requests a loan to purchase more wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood as a raw material

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo D. est un jeune homme de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il désire avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son magasin en l’approvisionnant de nouveaux produits.
texts.en:
Kodzo D. is a 33 year old young man, married and father of two children. He owns a general store in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He wishes to increase the size of his store by stocking up on new goods.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for his store

loans.name: Elsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Elsa es soltera, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Elsa vende comida, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente, lo lleva al colegio Guaman Poma, además Elsa vende comida en la puerta de su casa por las noches, Elsa tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de golosinas.
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Los sueños de Elsa son prosperar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Amauta Community Bank. She is a single 39-year-old mother of two children. She sells food outdoors at the Guaman Poma school and also out of her home in the evenings. Elsa plans to start selling snacks and is requesting a loan of 1250 soles (approximately $450) to purchase products. Elsa's dreams are to prosper with her business and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong E., age 40, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. She sells food at a tourist place in her province, earning approximately US $3.00 per day. Her husband operates a motor-taxi in the provincial town, earning an income of US $2.00 per day. 

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, E. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, E. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase wood to build small benches for tourists to sit on when they visit the river. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Santa Rosa Mazocruz, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 50 años D. edad, estado civil viuda y es madre D. 08 hijos, estudio educación primaria (transición), vive en el Barrio Alianza S/N.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. comida. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. carne, arroz, fideos, aceite, verduras, condimentos, combustible, etc. Para la preparación D. comida.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando para vivir mejor ya que sus hijos ya son casados y también trabajan.

A ella le gusta la forma D. trabajo ya las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de carne, arroz, fideos, aceite, verduras, condimentos, combustible, etc.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de céréales dans le marché de Hanoukopé à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1991 à Lomé, au moment où son mari militaire est allé à la retraite. Ils ont 02 enfants et c’est grâce à ce commerce que le couple arrive à assurer l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle dispose de nombreux clients à qui elle vend en gros mais aussi en détail ; elle s’approvisionne à Amlamé, une localité située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Elle compte dans l’avenir disposer d'un autre point de vente au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle pense renouveler son stock en état d’épuisement en ce moment ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 sacs de maïs, 04 sacs d’haricots et 05 sacs de Soja. Elle a l’assurance qu’elle remboursera son prêt à temps, vu sa meilleure connaissance du marché.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, d'haricots et de soja

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is from Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 56, married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, she owns & operates a business selling a variety of vegetable products. She has had this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP,  which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
 
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Pedaylinda

texts.en:
Pedaylinda C. offers massage services to hotels and homeowners in Tagbilaran and Panglao. She is 46 years old and has three children, her eldest being 17 years old. She wants to work hard in order to send her children to school.

Pedaylinda joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan with a low interest rate. She’s requesting a loan of Php 16,000 to buy uniforms and materials needed for massage services. She also needs a cellphone to easily communicate with her customers to make appointments.

loans.use: To buy uniforms and materials needed for massage services

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old. Victoria is married and has 5 school-age children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Victoria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hayel

texts.en:
Hayel is a single 30-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon. Hayel is newly engaged and is planning to get married very soon. Hayel is a car electrician who owns a garage; he also has been selling car accessories for nine years.

Hayel requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy more car accessories to increase his income. Hayel has been a micro-credit client for two years now and has always repaid on time. His clients are those who own a car. Competition was one of the problems he faced but his experience is different from others. He plans to improve and expand his work in the future.

loans.use: To buy more car accessories to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 3 años atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 32 años de edad, estudiò primaria completa, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. 
Susana se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado ovino y porcino y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles invirtió en la compra de alimentos para los animales.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar forraje y alimento para animales.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Yunguyo. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
For the last three years, Señora Susana has been a member of the “Tupac Amaru I” (First Tupac Amaru) Communal Bank in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, has a primary education and is married with two children. Susana works at buying and selling livestock, sheep and pigs, and she tells us that the first loan of 300 New Sols which she requested from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos was used to buy feed for the animals. She will now request a loan of 300 New Sols with which she will be able to buy fodder and animal feed. Her hope for the future is to have her house in Yunguyo. The thing she likes most about her Communal Bank are the meetings with the members and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder and animal feed.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy A. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP every four months.

In 2005, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the tenth loan that Daisy has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn H., 36, is married and lives with her five school-aged children in Kompongchnang Province, Cambodia. H. is a teacher for a public secondary school in her province. She also sells porridge in her village every morning to earn extra income. Both jobs make it possible for her to earn an income of US $4.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been doing these businesses since 1987. Her husband is a village chief, earning an income of US $2.30 per day to help assist the family. H. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses to provide for the daily necessary expenses. As a result, H. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase groceries to start another business at home. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start another business

loans.name: Nemeno

texts.en:
Mr. Nemeno H. is from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 58 years old and married with seven children. He owns a business selling spare parts. Aside from this business he owns a rice field of more than three hectares. He has managed his business for more than three years, earning approximately $220 a month. 

Nemeno successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. He has a new loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC which will be used for additional capital to purchase new spare parts to sell.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

  *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is 61 years old and married with three daughters who are grown up. As a father, he has fulfilled his duty, as his daughters are professionals and financially independent. Modesto works in transportation. He owns two buses in the Paraguarí bus company. His goal is to continue increasing the number of vehicles he owns and creating jobs in the region. Modesto has a desire to get ahead in life and is requesting this loan so that he can offer his passengers the best possible service.

loans.use: To purchase tires

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: El Señor Alfonso de 59 años de edad, tiene un negocio de taller de mecánica, que se caracteriza  para prestar servicio de reparación de de vehículos. Este no es el primer financiamiento que se le ha otorgado. Inicio con la necesidad de poder apoyar económicamente a sus padres ya que eran una familia de bajos recursos, aprendió el oficio y no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando solamente termino su educación primaria. la descripción del negocio se caracteriza de reparación   compra y venta de repuestos como: llantas, anillos chisperos, filtros, aceites, reparación de vehículos etc. A través de todos los años de experiencia con mi negocio fundación León 2000 me ha prestado su apoyo con respecto a los créditos que para el desarrollo de mi negocio y de mi familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo. He cumplido el sueño de poder tener una casa propia a través de mi trabajo y dedicación, he cumplido con mi propósito de mantener y superar mi negocio día a día.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 59, has a machine shop that specializes in vehicle repairs. This isn't the first loan he's had approved. He started out needing to help his parents economically because they were a very low income family. He learned his trade but was unable to continue with his formal education; he only finished elementary school. The business consists mostly in repairs and replacement parts, such as: tires, piston rings, sparkplugs, filters, lubricats, car repair, etc. "Throughout all my years of experience with my business, Fundación León 2000 has supported me with loans to develop my business and my family" The funding requested now is for working capital. "I have reached my dream of having my own home through my work and dedication; I have met my goal of maintaining and improving my business day to day"

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy auto repair merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Galdaansuren

texts.en:
Galdaansuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a “ger”. They have been living together in their current home for three years. His two sons haven't yet reached school age and they stay at home.

Currently, Galdaansuren operates a flour and rice trading business with his wife in her home province. He started his business in 2007 with a working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs.

Galdaansuren purchases flour and rice at wholesale prices from local salespeople and resell them for a profit from the shipping container that he owns. He has been planning to purchase the products that he sells from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to save the transportation cost. Thus, he has been planning to purchase his own truck which will help him to increase the business profit.

Galdaansuren and his wife work very hard and they are quite enthusiastic about their future. They have many plans for the future and Galdaansuren says, “I would like to expand my business and to purchase a truck. In addition, I would like to bring up my children in the right way and to be financially able to support their education.”

Galdaansuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more flour and rice for his trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing produces toilet disinfectant and detergent. She does this in her house. She learned the skill from a church seminar and she decided to start her own production. Though she has been in the business for the past three years, she is faced with financial constraints that keep her from increasing her business and profitability. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more chemicals to produce more detergent and toilet disinfectant to sell.

She is married with six children. She is 50 years of age. Her husband is an automobile engineer and he supports his wife in the production process when there are no customers in his workshop. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more chemicals

loans.name: Petrona Otilia

texts.es:
Doña Petrona G. es madre soltera y con 4 hijos bajo su cargo, tres son mujeres y un varón los cuales están en edad escolar, el hijo que tiene la edad de 23 años tiene el oficio de contador pero aun no esta laborando y la mayor de todas esta en Costa Rica. Doña Petrona  trabaja como domestica y aparte de su salario recibe remesa familiar cada quince días de parte de su hija la que esta en Costa Rica.

Con nuestra institución es primer crédito que se le otorga, el cual le han servido para realizar mejoramiento en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona G. es madre soltera y con 4 hijos bajo su cargo, tres son mujeres y un varón los cuales están en edad escolar, el hijo que tiene la edad de 23 años tiene el oficio de contador pero aun no esta laborando y la mayor de todas esta en Costa Rica. Doña Petrona trabaja como domestica y aparte de su salario recibe remesa familiar cada quince días de parte de su hija la que esta en Costa Rica. Con nuestra institución es primer crédito que se le otorga, el cual le han servido para realizar mejoramiento en su vivienda.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para mejoramiento de Vivienda. (Cemento, Cerámica, Puerta, Ventanas)

loans.name: N.reyes' Group

texts.en:
Naida R. is from the village of Manamong. She is 29 years old. Naida is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is N.R.' Group.

Naida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Naida owns & operates a "sari-sari" (generalstore) business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Naida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Naida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Naida has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Naida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Naida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa U. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Elisa is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elisa owns & operates a business selling tamarind candies, potato chips and peanuts in the local community. Elisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Elisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw products and ingredients. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jmv

texts.en:
Jmv is 35 years old and married. He has 2 children. His first child is 5 years old and the last one is 3 years old. Jmv takes care of four dependents in his family. Jmv's wife is a teacher. They both work to develop their family so that they can progress in their daily activities. 

Jmv sells various products, as you can see in the photo. He has 15 years of experience in his business. His business is open from 5:00 a.m. in the morning to 9:00 p.m. in the evening every day.

Now, Jmv is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more products, which can attract more customers. Once these customers are reached, Jmv will be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Melania Yolanda

texts.es:
Melania tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiebe dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Bambamarca, una zona que pertenece a la sierra norte del país, a 2 532 m.s.n.m., pertenece a la región Cajamarca y se encuentra ubicado a nueve horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Melania se dedica a trabajar vendiendo comida desde hace mas de veinte años, ella cuenta con un peuqño puesto de venta dentro del mercado de su distrito, allí ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de platos típicos de la zona para el momento de desayuno y almuerzo, el negocio cuanta con un buen grupo de clientes debido a que la zona es muy frecuentada y también porque ella prepara sus alimentos con buena sazón.

Melania desea ampliar sus ventas para poder percibir mayor cantidad de ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente adquirir mas insumos para preparar más platos de comida, siguiendo su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de productos no perecibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras, aceite, bebidas gaseosas, etc.

Melania es una mujer bastante concida y estimada en su trabajo y en el barrio donde vive, sus conocidos y amigos la consideran una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Melania is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives with her family in the Bambamarca district, an area belonging to the northern highlands of the country at 2,532 meters above sea level. It is part of the Cajamarca region, and is located approximately 9 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Melania has worked selling food for more than 20 years. She has a small stand inside the market in her district, and there she offers her customers dishes that are typical of the area for breakfast and lunch. Her business has a large group of customers because it is a popular business in the neighborhood and also because she prepares very tasty dishes. Melania wants to expand her sales so that she can increase her earnings. For this reason, she has seen fit to buy more supplies to prepare more dishes to sell. To do this she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy non-perishables such as rice, sugar, noodles, beans, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. Melania is a woman who is well-known and highly regarded in her work in the neighborhood where she lives. Her friends and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trust-worthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to make plates of food to sell to expand her business

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita C., 39 years old, is a sari-sari storeowner. She is also a fish vendor. She is doing these to be able to buy the needs of their family. She is a widow with four children. 

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell. In that way, she will be able to offer her customers more products with variety. She likes the CEVI services because she is also covered by micro-insurance benefits.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Robina Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Robina Kousar lives in the small city of Borewala in south Punjab, Pakistan. She is a thirty-year-old lady with a daughter in sixth grade. Her husband is a carpenter who not only makes furniture on order, but also has a furniture showroom in the market where he displays his handmade furniture such as bed sets, tables and chairs. He has been in this business for over 20 years and understands about different trends in the city. Robina is a housewife. She wants to support her husband financially in his business which is why she has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy wood in larger quantities to execute larger orders on time. Robina is very confident that her husband has the ability to improve his business by making positive use of the loan. 
This is the first time she has applied for a microfinance loan and she hopes that it will be profitable.

loans.use: Purchase wood in larger quantities to make furniture

loans.name: Gertrudis Antonela

texts.es:
Gertrudis es  de la ciudad de Pdte. Franco, tiene 20 años y  está cursando el 3° año de la carrera de Enfermería y Obstetricia en la Universidad del Norte  (UNINORTE) de  Ciudad del Este. Ella es una joven muy adedica a sus estudios, trabaja en un negocio en el centro de  la ciudad, mediante este empleo ella puede pagar sus estudios y otros gasto que tiene.

Los padres de Gertrudis son comerciantes y están orgullosos de su hija ya es muy responsable y estudiosa y además es hija única en la familia.Ella se  caracteriza como un joven capaz para esta profesión ya que le mediante las practicas en su estudio pudo sentir que tiene vocación y carácter para esta profesión y considera muy importante atender a las personas que necesitan de cuidados para recuperar su salud.

Actualmente quiere aprovechar los créditos ofrecidos por la Fundación Paraguaya para estudiantes ya que ayudara a pagar sus estudios y también ya podrá contar con antecedentes para otros emprendimientos que quiera realizar.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is from the city of President Franco, is 20 years old, and enrolled in her 3rd year in nursing and obstetrics at the Universidad del Norte (UNINORTE) in Ciudad del Este. She is a young person who is very dedicated to her studies and works in a business in the city's center. By means of this job she is able to pay for her studies as well as her other costs. Her parents are merchants and very proud of their daughter who is already very responsible and studious and, in addition, is the only daughter in the family. She is a young person whose character is very appropriate for this profession; seeing her practice in her studies, one can sense that she has a vocation and character for this profession. She considers it very important to attend to people who need care to recover their health. Now she wishes to seize the loan opportunity offered students by Fundación Paraguaya, that will help her pay for her studies and also, help her afford other costs that she wants to cover.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay University fees, including monthly payments and exam fees

loans.name: Francis Maina

texts.en:
Francis Maina is 32 years old, is married to Pauline Wambui, and has two children aged four years and two years old. He and his family live in Githurai.

Francis Maina sales tapes, CD’s and videos right in the town center along Mfangano Lane near the bus stage where most of his clients are passersby and those who have various commitments in town. He has been in this business for one-and-a-half years and earns a profit of Kshs 5,000.

Francis Maina learned about KADET LTD through one of its credit officers who enlightened him about the organization. Francis Maina is borrowing his first loan of Kshs 20,000 with which he intends to use half to add more stock of tapes, CD’s and videos and use the other half to pay rent.

In the future, Francis Maina desires to own a music shop that will create him the opportunity to achieve financial stability and hence improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To add more stock of tapes, CD's and videos and to pay his rent

loans.name: Zurelly  Antonia

texts.es:
Zurelly es una joven casada y con dos hijos, que al conocerla su rostro inspira ternura y mucha confianza, y son  estos los valores que  justamente   hacen que cada día crezca la clientela de su microempresa llamada: “Corte y peinado cabecita alegres “,  donde su razón de ser  es la imagen  infantil.
Su negocio nació cuando su hermana y cuñado la visitaron en la ciudad de Bucaramanga, lugar donde Zurelly  trabajaba en una peluquería para niños, al ver todo lo que ella sabia  respecto al negocio de peluquería infantil, le propusieron iniciar ese mismo negocio en la ciudad de Barranquilla, teniendo en cuenta que seria una oportunidad innovadora, porque no existía una peluquería dirigida a  los niños, por eso esta idea se convirtió en un emprendimiento innovador.
Zurelly dice que ella le debe esta iniciativa a Dios y a su gran propósito con su familia en el tema de unidad laboral; ellos iniciaron las tres hermanas y en la medida en que se dieron a conocer fueron enseñando a otras personas para que trabajaran con ellos;  porque este es precisamente su gran desafío, el encontrar al personal idóneo que aprenda las técnicas  y principalmente  que tengan  la relación, paciencia y la delicadeza para sus clientes estrellas: los Niños.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues han invertido todo sus ahorros en sacar su sueño  adelante y sus esfuerzos de inversión  los ha dirigido a la publicidad para darse a conocer y esto no es una tarea fácil, por eso como en la actualidad necesita tener un capital de trabajo para diversificar su oferta sobre todo en los peinados que requieren muchos insumos, como lacas, flores, cintas y detalles que adornan las cabecitas de los niños.
Su sueño es tener un local  propio para su negocio y además vender accesorios para bebes e infantil en general; su  mayor satisfacción es saber que con la ayuda de Dios todo es posible, lo demás es nuestro aporte en  perseverancia, , dedicación, empeño y amor  para lograr   lo que nos  propongamos.
texts.en:
Zurelly is a young woman who is married and has two children.  Anyone who has met her knows the look on her face inspires both tenderness and confidence, qualities that have helped her grow the customer base of her business called “Happy Cuts and Styles for Little Heads”.  The reason for her business is to promote children’s self-image.  Zurelly started her business when her sister and brother-in-law visited her in the city of Burcaramanga, where she was working at a children’s salon.  Since Zurelly knew everything about this type of business, her family suggested that she start her own establishment in the city of Barranquilla.  This would be a unique opportunity since a children’s stylist did not exist in the area, so she decided to turn this idea into an innovative enterprise.

Zurelly says she gives credit to God and to her family for the chance to work together to make this idea a reality.  She and her three sisters started by teaching other employees how to work with them since finding qualified staff is a great challenge.  They must learn the techniques for establishing relationships, demonstrating patience, and being sensitive with their star clients, the children.  

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Zurelly and her family have invested all of their savings so that they could move forward with their dream.  Their efforts have been invested in advertising because trying to draw publicity is not an easy task.  At the moment, Zurelly needs operating capital to diversify the services she offers.  She needs different types of supplies such as coloring, flowers, ribbons, and adornments used for styling children’s hair.

Her dream is to have a separate area within her business where she can sell general accessories for babies and children.  Zurelly says her greatest satisfaction comes from knowing that with God’s help, anything is possible.  She continues to demonstrate perseverance, dedication, commitment, and love in order to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Purchase supplies used for styling children's hair

loans.name: Debie Reynette

texts.en: Debie Reynette M. is from the village of Wigan, Santiago. She is 40 years old. Debie Reynette is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Debie Reynette runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Debie Reynette has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Debie Reynette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Debie Reynette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Debie Reynette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Debie Reynette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: C4569 Twizerane Group

texts.en:
Monique is 30 years old and she is married with three children who are 4, 7 and 9 years old.  Monique is the leader of a group “Twizerane” who  are commonly known in the business of selling charcoal.  This group has been in this business for a long time and they work from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Monique and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Monique and her team will expand their business through purchasing additional sacks of charcoal for sale and in addition to this; they will create another source of income selling a variety of foodstuffs.  If successful, each member of this group will continue building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: additional sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Samundri, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan. It is known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the area named Christian colony, which is a residential area of city Samundri. She moved there 15 years ago with her family. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is a very responsible person who does her work with full concentration.
 
She is married to E. M., who has a painting business. He paints houses and buildings. He has contracts with different building and house owners and finishes the work on an agreed schedule. Razia has a son who earns a meager income as a government employee. She could not provide an education for him, and he had to start a job to financially support the family.
  
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy different colors of paint boxes to offer more variety and better service to his clients. She is hopeful that by using his experience in this profession, her husband will successfully be able to increase his profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia V. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Lilia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snacks in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is an active entrepreneur managing three ventures- sari-sari (variety) store business, frozen foods and little carenderia (ready-to-eat-food). Her previous loan from KIVA has provided working capital to expand her businesses and purchase more inventory for her ventures.

With the loan, Purita has witnessed that her monthly income has almost doubled, since she has attracted more customers with additional stock. Positive growth from her businesses has helped Purita finance the education of her children. All of them finished college and are now seeking better employment. 

Since joining ASHI, Purita has experienced positive changes in her life. She uses the additional income to support maintenance of her three ventures. Purita hopes her businesses will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family. 

Therefore, she is now requesting another KIVA loan, this time for 45,000 PHP, to purchase more inventories of food stuffs for her store, greater supply of frozen foods products, and more ingredients for her food preparation. This will allow her to grow her businesses further so that she will able to help fund the education of her grandchildren and experience a life that’s full of contentment.

With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Purita is hopeful that her businesses will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life, out from the spiral of poverty. Purita hopes that her businesses will expand, so she will have savings for future use.

As a member of ASHI for almost ten years, she has shown very good performance in her credit rating (basis of loans); therefore, she is being trusted by the institution to acquire larger loans.
 
The attached picture of Purita was taken December 07, 2010 with her supportive husband and her granddaughter.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of food stuffs for her store, a greater supply of frozen foods products, and more ingredients for her food preparation (ready-to-eat-food)

loans.name: María Clementina

texts.es: María Clementina B., es una joven madre de un pequeño de 8 años de edad, con quien vive en Sensuntepeque, departamento de Cabañas, así mismo vive junto a su madre la cual le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. María posee una cafetería en la que comercializa productos alimenticios como: desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo vende bebidas y golosinas, su negocio se encuentra en el punto de microbuses de la ruta 12, en donde comercializa sus productos con motoristas y usuarios del transporte público. María desea aumentar la cantidad de productos para comercializar, y así de esta manera aumentar sus ventas lo cual es su principal objetivo.
texts.en: María Clementina B. is the young mother of an 8 year old.  She lives in Sensuntepeque, in Cabañas department, with her mother who helps her with the household expenses.  María owns a café in which she sells food such as breakfasts and lunches.  She also sells soft drinks and candy.  Her business is located at the bus stop for route 12 minibuses.  She sells her products to motorists and public transport users.  María would like to increase the quantity of products she sells and thereby increase her sales which is her main goal.

loans.use: To buy perishables to sell

loans.name: Mery Cris

texts.en:
Mery Cris C. is from the village of Biasong, Dipolog City. She is 32 years old, married, and has 2 adult children. Mery Cris operates a family member's business in the retail sector, primarily buying and selling rice. She has been engaged in this business for 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mery Cris joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to expand her business. Mery Cris is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase palay (rice grain) for her rice trading business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mery Cris from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase palay

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia F. is from the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old and single. To make a living, Ophelia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ophelia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her business.

Ophelia joined PMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous PMPC loan of 5000 PHP, which she used to purchase breeding livestock. She is requesting a new loan of 4500 PHP that will likewise be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her third loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Jane Gathoni

texts.en:
Jane has run her private Kindergarten in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 38 years old, married to Julius Kinyua, and the mother of one child. Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her third loan. She repaid her previous loans well within their terms, and she plans to use the loan to buy materials to finish a block of classrooms she is building.

In the future, Jane hopes to expand her Kindergarten into a primary school.

loans.use: To buy materials to finish a block of classrooms she is building.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin M. is twenty-seven years old, married to a businesswoman, and they have one nine-year-old child to whom they hope to provide a good education to the university level. Benjamin's business is located in a busy market in Kakamega, which is the region in Kenya known for the production of sugar canes, also known as the sugar belt region. 

He sells music discs and tapes to the local people. He has been running this business for four years now and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints.
