He is using his loan of 40,000 KES to buy more music discs and tapes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as a very visionary man.

loans.use: Music discs and tapes

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic M. is from the village of Poblacion North, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Marivic is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a welding shop. She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials

loans.name: Solidario Salamanca Group

texts.es:
Solidario Salamanca
Está conformado por 4 socios los cuales se dedican a diferentes negocios.
Mayra tiene una abarroteria,Silvia una miscelanea,Veronica venta D. ropa y Vilma venta D. comida.
Mayra tiene  52   años,es casada y tiene dos hijos  uno D. ellos ya esta casado y el otro estudia y trabaja,ella lleva 10 años D. tener su negocio el cual le ha ido muy bien sus clientes estan muy satisfechos por su trabajo,gracias a que su negocio   esta situado en su domicilio ella ha podido ayudar y sacar adelante a su familia, su esposo trabaja para cubrir los gastos del hogar pero para ella aun no ha podido tener lo que sus clientes merecen, ella necesita un credito para poder invertir  en productos comestibles D. primera necesidad para generar mas ganacias y cumplir su sueño.
ella es la lider del grupo las demas socias solicitan el credito para la compra D. mercaderia bariada  para surtir su tienda y asi poder generar mas ganancias para ayudar a su familia y asi tener una mejor calidad D. vida,
texts.en:
The Salamanca Communal Bank is comprised of four members, who devote themselves to different businesses.  Mayra has a grocery business, Sylvia has a general store, Veronica sells clothes, and Vilma sells food.

Mayra, age 52, is married and has two children.  One of them is married, and the other goes to school and works.  She has had her business for ten years, and it has gone very well for her.  Her customers are very pleased with her work.  Thanks to her business being in her house, she has been able to help and to get her family ahead.  Her husband works to cover the household expenses.  

She still has not been able to have what her customers need.  She needs the loan to be able to buy basic needs food products.  This will generate more income and fulfill her dream.

She is the leader of the group.  The other members request the loan to buy varied merchandise to stock their stores.  That way they will be able to help their families and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to be able to buy basic needs food products

loans.name: Nancy Isabel

texts.es:
La señora  Nancy es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas, del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo.
Son 19 ciclos los que lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos, gracias a los préstamos recibidos ha podido seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y con ello cubrir los gastos D. casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 3 bujías, 5 repuestos para motos, 2 sistemas D. arrastre, 1 caja D. ceras, 1 litro D. aceite para moto.
Espera seguir trabajando para dar comodidad a sus hijos y amortiguar un poco los gastos del hogar.  "Gracias a Manuela por el apoyo bridado y poder salir adelante".
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Manos Unidas community bank of the district of Calleria, departament of Ucayali. She is 46 years old, married and is raising one child.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 19 cycles. Thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to continue investing in her business and with that, cover her household expenses. 

With her new loan of S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, she will buy 3 spark plugs, 5 replacement parts for motorcycles, 2 pull clutch systems, 1 box of wax, 1 liter of motor oil. 

She hopes to continue working to proviD. for her children and cushion the household expenses a little. "Thanks to Manuela for the support it has given and for being able to get ahead."

loans.use: To buy spark plugs, pull clutch systems.

loans.name: Orlando Carlos

texts.pt:
Orlando Carlos L. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 2 filhos o mais velho vai a Escola. Fez 10ª classe nao continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa cedida pelos pais com a sua familia e naõ sustenta mais ninguem.

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, faz prestação de serviços de canalização de agua e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt, a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despasas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu cunhado que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos ( cerveja, refrescos e outras bebidas) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro, pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir uma mercearia e adquirir um meio de transporte para facilitar o seu trabalho.
texts.en:
Orlando Carlos L. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two children, with the oldest attending school. He completed 10th grade, but didn't continue in school due to his financial circumstances. 

He lives with his family in a home given to him by his parents, and doesn't support anyone else. He has never left his native region. He provides plumbing services and has monthly earnings of around 3,000 to 4,000 meticais. He uses these for household expenses and manages to save a portion in his bank account. 

He has never taken loans from other banks, and learned of Hluvuku through his brother-in-law, who is a client of this institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and is for 20,000 meticais. He plans to use the loan to purchase products (beer, soft drinks, and other drinks) to increase his inventory level. He is committed to repaying on schedule to be able to access other loans in the future. He plans to request new loans to build a grocery store and to obtain a vehicle to facilitate his work.

loans.use: to purchase products (beer, soft drinks, and other drinks).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine for her daughter

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family. Margaret has a tailoring business.  She has been in this business for ten years, working one day a week, selling her products in a retail shop.    

She generates additional income through roasting yellow bananas and maize. The main business challenges for Margaret include the rainy season and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to open a tailoring school and also to start sewing bridal gowns.  She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.   

Margaret has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy clothing materials and threads.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.Perlita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, spices, oils & vegetables. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks, vegetables & spices.

Perlita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Perlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks, vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Junnior Alonso

texts.es: El joven junnior, es soltero, trabajador  y vive en casa de sus padres quienes también trabajan y juntos están en la lucha de llegar a crecer y mejorar su calidad de vida, junnior se dedica a vender hamburguesas y salchipapas en las noches teniendo una gran acogida, y también se dedica a otra activad que es la crianza de cerdos, con lo cual le genera otros ingresos, junnior esta solicitando el crédito para comprar unas mesa y sillas para su negocio además de comprar algunos utensilios e insumos para el mismo, el sueño de junnior en el futuro es crecer mas en su negocio además de invertir en comprar mas cerdos y así tener mas ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, junnior esta muy agradecido por la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Junnior is single, and he is hard-working young man.  He lives in his parents’ house; they also work.  They struggle together to grow and to improve their quality of life.

Junnior sells hamburgers and “salchipapas” (a traditional dish made from fried potatoes, fried sausages and condiments).  He sells at night with great success.

He also has another business activity, raising pigs.  This business generates other income.

Junnior is requesting the loan to buy tables and chairs for his business.  He will also buy some utensils and supplies for the business.

Junnior’s dream for the future is for his business to grow more.  He also wants to invest in buying more pigs.  That way he will have more income in order to improve his quality of life.  Junnior is very grateful for the trust being placed in him.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and utensils for his business

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot tiene 34 años, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos por quienes trabaja arduamente. Juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Margot viene laborando en este negocio aún desde muy joven, siempre trataba de ayudar a sus padres en poner las semillas y cultivarlas, desde entonces decidió tener su propio negocio el cual implicaba tener su propio terreno de cultivo, propiedad que sus padres le cedieron para que lo trabajase. Es así que cultiva cacao y Noni, ya que  para Margot, son productos que tienen mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello que se levanta desde muy temprano para trabajar en su parcela y darle el cuidado respectivo. Por lo general siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus peones cuando es temporada de cosecha, siendo éstos vendidos en los centros de acopio y en el mercado de su comunidad por el cual su margen de rentabilidad esta en alza. En el futuro aspira tener su tienda de abarrotes, con la necesidad de poder diversificar su cartera de clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera tener el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda continuar con su trabajo. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en contratar peones para que lo ayuden a limpiar su parcela.
texts.en: Margot is 34 years old and a single mother. She has 3 children, for whom she works very hard. They live together in their own house, located in the community of Puerto Mayo, in the district of Pichari. Margot has worked in this business since she was very young, always trying to help her parents planting seeds and cultivating the crops. Because of this, she decided to have her own business, which meant having her own fields to farm. Her parents gave her some property so she could farm it. She now cultivates cacao and Noni, since for Margot, these are products which are in great demand on both the national and international levels. For this reason, she gets up very early to work on her parcel of land and give the crops the necessary care. In general, she always has support from farm workers when it is harvest season. She sells her harvest at the wholesale buying centers and at the market in her community, and her profit margin is rising. In the future, she hopes to have her own grocery store, so that she can diversify her customer base. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes to have the support of every one of you so that she can continue with her work. With the 1,000 Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will invest in contracting farm workers to help her clean up her parcel of land.

loans.use: to hire farm workers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 41 años, es una mujer decidida, vive en compañía de Cesar, su esposo desde hace 14 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos, ya que sus hijos mayores, viven en la ciudad de Huánuco, donde estudian educación superior. Como mujer de campo que nació y creció entre las verdes praderas, aprendió a sacar el máximo provecho de las enseñanzas de sus padres, quienes le cedieron terrenos agrícolas, donde ahora siembra papa, arveja, maíz y habas. “Con el fruto de mi trabajo y el apoyo de mis padres, ahora tengo 6 terrenos de cultivo”, menciona. Además de poseer 5 vacas lecheras, con las que elabora queso, asimismo posee  7 toros que le ayudan en el arado de la tierra. Según cuenta, que en temporadas de cosecha, se dirige a la ciudad de Tarma durante el fin de semana, para comercializar su producción, así como los moldes de queso que elabora. Ya tiene clientes fijos, quienes conocen de la calidad de productos que vende. Ahora su principal prioridad es pagar los estudios de sus hijos, a quienes desea legar el valor más preciado, “la educación”. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Norma de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en su próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en: Norma, 41, is a very determined woman who lives with Cesar, her husband of 14 years.  Together they have 4 children, but they only live with 2 of them, since their adult children live in the city of Huanuco where they are in college.  As a countrywoman who was born and raised among the green meadows, she learned to take maximum advantage of the teachings of her parents, who gave her agricultural land where she now cultivates potatoes, peas, corn and beans.  "As the result of my work and the help of my parents I now have 6 plots of land to cultivate," she states.  In addition, she has 5 dairy cows, with which she produces cheese, and also 7 bulls to help her plow the land.  She says that in the harvest season she goes to the city of Tarma on the weekends to sell her produce, as well as the cheese that she makes.  She already has regular customers who know the quality of the products that she sells.  Now her main priority is to pay for the education of her children, because an education is the most valuable asset that she can leave to her children.  She belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Jerusalen," and this is the 2nd loan that she has taken with MFP, where she awaits the cooperation of all of you so that she can continue to reach for her goals.  In addition, she is committed to making her payments on time.  Once she receives the loan, Norma will use the money to buy 2 sacks of pea seeds and a number of sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over her next crop of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
Llusmila  tiene 67 años de edad, ella es viuda y  tiene  01 hijo menor de edad, ella vive con su familia (hijo), en un caserío del departamento de Cajamarca, esta zona el caserío es mediano con aspiraciones a superarse.
 
Lusmila  se dedica a la crianza, engorde de ganado vacuno y adicionalmente vende leche desde hace varios años ella se dedica a esta labor, por que actualmente cuenta con clientela fija y fidelizada a su negocio rubro, Lusmila  cría su ganado en corrales cerca de su domicilio y los vende en los mercados locales  y vende leche al colegio de dicho caserío.

Lusmila está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar ganado pequeño para su engorde y alimento balanceado para su ganado porque actualmente que cuenta con bastante pasto natural.

Lusmila es una mujer de buen carácter que le gusta ayudar a los demás y tiene muy buenas referencias , por parte de las personas que la conocen
texts.en:
Lusmila is 67 years old and she is a widow. She has a young son. She lives with her family (her son) in a community in the department of Cajamarca. It is a medium-sized community which aspires to improve. 

Lusmila raises and fattens cows and she also sells milk. She has been in business for many years so she has a steady and loyal clientele. Lusmila raises her cattle in corrals located near her house and she sells them in the local markets. She sells the milk to the neighborhood high school.

Lusmila requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase calves to raise and fatten and to purchase balanced feed for the cattle she currently has. She has plenty of natural grasses.

Lusmila is a woman of good character and she enjoys helping others. She has very good references from those individuals who know her.

loans.use: to purchase calves and livestock feed.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is 32 years old, single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the last five years, he has earned a living by running a retail store out of his house. He earns about PHP 3,000 a month. Earlier this year, Ramil joined GDMPC as a way to improve his business. He is applying for this loan to buy more grocery items to sell to his customers. He plans to start saving so that he can buy a motorcycle, which will make it much easier for him to get around.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Namsraijav

texts.en: Namsraijav is 45 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife works at the local railway. His oldest son is a college student and his daughter is a high school senior. Namsraijav was born in the Huvsgul province. He started to work as a researcher at the local community hospital in 1986. He moved to Ulaanbaatar in 1996 and started a shoe-making and repair business. He has built his business and has much work experience in his field. He is a hard-working and diligent man who says "I am working hard for life and for my family." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to expand his service room and purchase more materials to make shoes for children.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 27 years old and lives in Potungan, Concepcion. He is married and has one child. 

Raul has a shop that sells grocery items. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries. 

Raul has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Chhan, age 27, is a domestic rice trader in the Kompong Speu Province. She and her husband work together in the same business. They can earn an income from their business of around $6.75USD each day. In addition, Chhan’s husband also runs a trailer motor service to all passengers and other villagers for additional fees. They have been married for over five years and they are blessed with one child who studies in the local school. To generate more revenue, Mrs. Chhan and her husband have decided to ask for a loan as working capital for expanding their rice-selling business by purchasing more rice to stock up for future sales.  This loan will help provide the family  with better living conditions. To enlarge her existing house is a part of Chhan's future plans and also she needs to sustain her child to graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to stock up for future sales.

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Gorreti is a tailor. She operates her business from home on a retail basis and works seven days a week. She has been in her business for the last nine years. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her primary goal and aspiration is to build rental houses and to also expand her business into a tailoring school.

She lives in her own house in Kampala, Uganda, with her husband and four children. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, as all her children attend school.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Haydee; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 17, 15, 13, 5 años de edad; La socia se dedica  a la elaboración de diferentes potajes y a la venta de los mismos, la socia tiene un stand en el cual ella ofrece sus diversos platos, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de insumos para continuar con sus negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas, la socia desea invertir en la compra de insumos como arroz al por mayor, aceite, para las frituras y otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para elaborar sus potajes.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank ”IMASUMAC II” which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Haydee. She is 38 years old, married and has 4 children aged 17, 15, 13 and 5 years. The member makes and sells different kinds of stew. The member has a stall at which she sells her various dishes. On this occasion, the member wants to use the loan to purchase supplies to continue with her business and in this way improve her sales. The member wants to invest in the purchase of supplies such as: wholesale rice, oil for frying and other products. The member is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of supplies to make her stews.

The member is grateful for the loan and agrees to make the repayments in accordance with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies with which to make her stews.

loans.name: Gulnoz

texts.ru: Гулноз жительница района Шахринав. Ей 32 года. Она разведена. У нее пятеро детей. Гулноз у себя дома занимается торговлей мужской и женской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Она берет кредит для приобретения теплых свитеров и рубашек.
texts.en: Gulnoz is a resident of the Shahrinav district.  She is 32 years old, divorced and has five children.  Gulnoz is involved in sales of men's and women's clothing at home.  She has been in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of warm sweaters and shirts.

loans.use: to buy warm sweaters and shirts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y su deseo es progresar. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus tres hijos en su casa que es propia, inmueble que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de ropa, mercadería que lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, pues tiene una amiga que vive en dicha ciudad y es ella quien le manda por encomienda las prendas que le solicitan sus clientes. Tiene un año realizando ésta activbidad, y gracias al apoyo de su pareja es que ha captado muchos clientes. Lo que le gusta de sus actividad es que le ha permitido contar un ingreso económico, con ello puede ayudar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar y satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos. Sin embargo debe saber a que cliente vender su productos, pues son variso lo que le han fallado en el pago. Su mayor anhelo es abrir una tienda de ropa, sabe que la manera que la unica manera de conseguirlo es base de mucha dedicación y sacrificio. Este sería el segundo crédito con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda con el grupo comunal, pues los considera como personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más ropas en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 40, is a hardworking woman who desires to make progress. She lives with her partner and their three children in their own home, which they were able to purchase with much effort. Rosa sells clothing and acquires her merchandise in the city of Lima. She has a friend who lives in that city and ships to her the clothes that her customers order. Rosa has been in this business for one year. Thanks to her partner, she has been able to attract many customers. What she likes about this job is being able to generate an income so that she can help her partner with the household expenses and meet the needs of their children. However, she must be selective of the customers to whom she sells because she has had several who have failed to pay. Her greatest wish is to open a clothing store. She knows that the only way to accomplish this goal is to press forward with great dedication and sacrifice.

This will be her second loan with the MFP organization. Rosa feels comfortable with her Communal Bank group because she considers the members to be responsible and supportive individuals. The amount she requested will be invested in more clothing in larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 27 years old, married to Gilbert, and blessed with two children who are ten and three years old.  She has been running a beauty salon for the past seven years.   

She has good credit history with KADET LTD, and after repaying the previous loans successfully, she is applying for her third loan of KES. 50,000.  She hopes to use the loan amount to purchase cosmetics for her salon and buy a new blow drier.

With the anticipated profits she will save and meet her family's needs.  She hopes to grow her business, and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a blow drier and other cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Umoja A Group

texts.en:
Ben takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have farm inputs in time for planting. In the recent 2011 season, Ben had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ben was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Ben will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing and his business to save for future use.

Ben is the facilitator of the Umoja A group. The photograph shows Ben with his group members. The field officer is standing on the far left. Ben and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Umoja A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ben and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mercidita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mercidita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercidita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sepoleka

texts.en:
Sepoleka is 52 years of age and a widow with 4 children. Sepoleka owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products to the local community. She has 2 years of experience in this business.    

Sepoleka needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Spoleka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sepoleka's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El  Sr. Juan es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Optaciana de 39 años de edad, tienen 2 Hijos, todos aun son pequeños y están en la escuela.
El se dedica a la producción y venta de carbón en su propia casa, cuenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que últimamente el carbón tiene mucha salida. Además de eso se dedica a la venta de leche y a la agricultura, el es un hombre muy emprendedor y trabajador, como se puede ver.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con lo cual podrá aumentar la producción de leche y de esa forma tener más en stock para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is from the city of Santaní. He is 43 years old and married to Sra. Optaciana, age 39. They have two young children who are in school.

Juan produces and sells charcoal from his home and has very good sales. He has had great success in this business as of late. Juan also sells milk and engages in farming. It is evident that he is a hardworking and enterprising gentleman.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase milk production and have more inventory to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Blessing” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koindu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Hannah. Hannah is age forty; she was born in eastern Sierra Leone.  Hannah resides in Koidu city, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman and two of her children are attending primary school and two are in secondary school. For two years now, Hannah has been selling provisions – milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, sardines, etc. With this loan, Hannah is going to buy more provisions to add to her business inventory.
 
(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, sardines, etc. to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Djekadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe DJEKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le pois sucré avec Maminata assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et de semences agricoles

loans.name: Good Wishes Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Peris. She is 40 years old and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to gain skills on how to run and expand her business through Enterprise and Financial Management. She operates a cafe and is borrowing a Kiva loan for the second time to buy more crockery for her business. This will lead to better customer service which will lead to her earning more income.

She hopes that the Kiva loan will improve her living standards through easy provision of food and clothes to her family. She will also pay school fees for her three children in school.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and she promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more crockery for her business. This will lead to better customer service which will lead to her earning more income.

loans.name: Estebina

texts.en:
My name is Estebina R. and I sell edible goods. I have had my business for three yeras. I have a good customer base and am located by a bus station. My business generates enough revenue to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and have a greater variety of products. With my profits, I hope to remodel my house and pay for the education of my children This loan will be used to purchase juice in cans and boxes, softdrinks, churros, candies, soap, toothpaste, water, sanitary napkins, chocolates, chocolates, matches, combs, bags, bath soap

Mi nombre es Estebina R. me dedico a la venta de productos comestibles, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada a la par de una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mi inventario y tener un mayor surtido de productos, con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa y mantenerles el estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de jugos de lata y caja, refrescos, churros, confites, jabon, paste para baño, agua, toallas sanitarias, bombones, chocolates, fosforos, peines, bolsas, jabon de baño, gatorade

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is married and lives in a household of nine in Kabul, Afghanistan. 

She has a shared business with her husband, who has five years' experience from his bakery shop. He bakes and then sells bread in the bazaar. Due to a lack of material she took a loan so they can buy wood, flour, etc. 

She prepares the yeast for her husband, then he bakes the bread and sells it at the bazaar. She is very happy to support her family through this business.

loans.use: Buying wood, flour, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Mrs. Gladys O. is 45 years old and married with six (6) children. She sells baby clothes for mothers and has no cause to regret it. She says, "My numerous customers always give me satisfaction." She will use the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. runs a very successful shop from which she sells groundnut oil, palm oil and bags of rice. She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband and seven children in Benin City. She is seeking a loan to expand her business and buy more oil and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use:
To buy more groundnut oil, palm oil &
 wholesale rice

loans.name: Moe

texts.en: Being a 54 year old mother of 10 and grandmother of 26, as well as one of the elderly in her community, Moe runs her business just like any other business person.  Two years ago, she received financial assistance from SPBD and that helped start the business, which is a well-known shop within the district.  Although it is successful, she has again requested financial support to maintain the shop in proper order, as well as to set up a communication service for passers-by and many without phones in the area.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the business

loans.name: Clara Carlos

texts.pt:
Location: Chali neighborhood – Catembe-Maputo
Client: Clara Carlos N.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 15,000 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 600)
Loan use: Purchase clothing for resale
Start date: 10/6/2007
End date: 1/28/2008

Clara Carlos N. was born in Maputo on July 14, 1979. She grew up without her father, since he and her mother separated when she was only 2 years old. She endured many difficulties due to her mother's inability to provide her and her brothers with basic necessities. This in turned sparked her entrepreneurial spirit - in 2005 she opened a clothing business, servicing several boutiques in the city and some clients in her neighborhood and nearby areas.

She is currently attending the 12th grade, supporting her studies via the business and taking care of five people. The amount of the loan will provide an impulse for her business by increasing her working capital and allowing her to meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she would like to set up a boutique where she can sell clothing and generate a higher revenue. She also plans on opening a beauty salon in her backyard.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chali, Catembe-Maputo Cliente: Clara Carlos N. Actividade:Comércio Valor do Empréstimo: 15,000.00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação do valor : Compra de Roupa para revenda Início:06/10/2007 Fim:28/01/2008 Clara Carlos N., nasceu em Maputo aos 14 de Julho de 1979, não teve o aconchego do pai uma vez que este se separou da sua Mãe quando ela tinha apenas dois anos. Viveu várias dificuldades uma vez que a mãe com a qual ficou a viver não tinha condições para lhe proporcionar uma vida com minimas condicoes junto com os irmãos, facto que lhe despertou o espírito de negócio em 2005. Iniciou o negócio de venda de roupa, negócio que desenvolve até então fornecendo algumas Boutiques da Cidade e a alguns clientes do seu Bairro e zonas a fins. Actualmente está frequentando a 12ª classe suportado os estudos atraves do negócio, e vivendo com cinco passoas na sua responsabilidade. O valor de empréstimo vai empulcionar mais o seu negócio uma vez que ira aumentar o seu capital de giro e que estava débil conseguindo deste modo responder á demanda dos seus clientes. Futuramente pretende obter uma Boutique onde poderá passar a vender as Roupas o que pode lhe proporcionar mais rendimentos tambem tenciona montar um salão de beleza femenina no quintal da sua residencia.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Entin

texts.en: Entin is 38 years old and a mother of a 9 year old son. She sells some clothes and veils on credit. She has to go around various places to offer and sell them. She can earn $5 per week. Her husband is a driver in Jakarta. She requests a $100 loan to buy more goods, and hopefully will earn more income to fund her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Mrs. Zulma has 3 teenage children, her husband sells food products in the country’s interior. Zulma was an employee of a business in the municipal market, and little by little she saved her money to be able to open her own business.

She began selling sugar, flour, and some other groceries, and with the earnings she was able to continually expand her business. Today she has a good number of customers that daily do their shopping in her store.

Zulma wants to continue to grow and expand her business, so today she is asking for a loan in order to be able to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices, especially drinks such as soda pop, juices, beer, and wine as these products are in high demand this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra Zulma tiene 3 hijos adolescentes, su marido es vendedor de productos alimenticios en el interior del país. Zulma era empleada de un negocio en el mercado municipal y de a poco con unos ahorros que iba juntando logro obtener el capital suficiente para abrir su propio negocio.

Empezó vendiendo azúcar, harina y algunos que otras mercaderías, y con las ganancias que obtenía iba surtiendo cada vez más el negocio. Hoy día ya posee una buena cantidad de clientes que diariamente van a hacer compras a su despensa.

Zulma desea seguir progresando y expandiendo el negocio, por lo que hoy solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir mercaderías al por mayor especialmente bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, cervezas y vinos pues estos son los de mayor demanda en esta época de año.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as soda pop, beer, juice, and wine.

loans.name: Hindun

texts.en: Hindun, 36, sells fried snacks and ice door-to-door around the villages earning $5 a day. Her husband, A., is a coolie who earns an irregular income. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Reyna Margarita Beat

texts.es:
Reina Margarita is married and has a young son who is 2 months old. To be able to pay for the household expenses, she rents taxi license plates and has a driver who reports on what he makes every day. She has been doing this for a few years, but recently she used some of her savings and was left without capital for unexpected expenses, such as the one she has now when that she wants to maintain the car.

This is why she is requesting a loan for US $250 which she is willing to pay in a period of 3 months. With this money Reina will be able to fix her car so that it keeps working. With your help Reina will be able to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Reina Margarita, está casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 meses, para poder pagar los gastos de su casa renta unas placas de taxi y tiene chofer que diario le entrega cuentas desde hace algunos años lo ha venido haciendo, a ultimas fechas dispuso de unos ahorros y se quedo sin capital para imprevistos, como es el caso de ahora que desea darle mantenimiento al carro.

Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Reina logrará arreglar su carro para que este siga funcionando. Con tu ayuda Reina podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Fix the taxi (Arreglar el taxi)

loans.name: Marta Arlinda

texts.pt:
Marta Arlinda M. was born August 9, 1972 in Maputo where she spent her childhood. In 1979, due to her father being transferred, she came to Namaacha and began school in the same year at the elementary school of Mugado. She completed 5th grade in 1983.

Her father left her mom and went to neighboring South Africa abandoning his children. Despite this situation in 1984 she went to High School and with many difficulties finished 6th and 7th grades, and in 1986 she was able to finish 8th and 9th grades.

In 1989 she entered the Namaacha Center of Formation of Elementary Teachers and she did her first year living in a boarding school. Her father returned from South Africa in 1990 and prevented her from continuing her studies alleging that she was too young and couldn't live in the boarding school. He ordered her to stop her general education.

In 1991 she returned to High School and tried to finish 10th grade, but unfortunately she was not able to finish. In 1992 her father returned to South Africa and again she faced a financial crisis so she went back to the boarding school to conclude her teaching courses in 1994. In 1995 she started work in an elementary school in Mugado as a teacher where she still works. In 1999 she married her husband. She became pregnant in 2002 but lost her child and never had any others.

With help from her husband and his earnings she was able to construct a small commercial establishment and an installation to raise chickens. She learned of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA through a conversation with her colleagues so she solicited a loan for 15,000MT to purchase products for her business. In the future she intends to construct a house and improve the chicken coop infrastructure so she can run 2 businesses and diversify her risk.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Marta Arlinda M., nasceu aos 09 de Agosto de1972 em Maputo, passa a sua infância na cidade de Maputo. Em 1979 devido a trasferência do pai vem a namaacha e inicia os seus estudos no mesmo ano na Escola Primaria de Mugado onde conclui a 5ª classe em 1983. O pai separa-se da mãe e emigra parra a vizinha Africa do Sul, abandonando assim os seus filhos, devido a esta situação em 1984 ingressa na Escola Secundaria e com muitas dificuldades faz a 6ª e7ª, e em 1986 consegue terminar a 8ª e 9ª classe. Em 1989 ingressa no centro de Formação de Professores Primários de namaacha e faz o 1º ano vivendo no internato. O pai volta da Africa do Sul em 1990 e impede-a de continuar com os estudos alegando que ela era menor de idade e não podia viver no internato, manda-lhe concluir o ensino geral. Em 1991 de volta a Escola Secundaria tenta fazer a 10ª classe e infelizmente não consegue transitar de classe. Em 1992 o pai volta para Africa do Sul entra assim de novo numa crise financeira e volta de novo ao internato e conclui o curso de Professorado em 1994. Em 1995 começa a trabalhar na Escola Primaria do Mugado como professora, onde está a trabalhar ate então. Em 1999 une-se com o seu esposo, fica grávida em 2002 e perde o seu filho, e assim não teve mais filhos, com ajuda do marido e do seu vencimento consegue construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial e um instalacoes para criação de frangos. Soube da existência da HLUVUKU- ADSEMA numa conversa com seus colegas e a aproximou-se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 15,000MT para aumentar stocks de produtos no estabelecimento dela. Pretende futuramente construir a sua casa e melhorar as infraestruturas de criacao de frangos para gerir dois negocios, diversificando desta maneira o risco.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is married and has two children, ages 21 and 14. Yusta is a fish seller; she started her own business in 2003. Every day, she works from 7 am to 5 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$250 from the sales.

Yusta now hopes to receive a loan to buy more fish for her sale.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for sale

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Hugo M. is 38 years old and is married to Mirian Rodríguez. The couple has three school-age daughters. In 1993 Hugo opened a store in a well-known market in the city of San Lorenzo. Today he owns three different stores in the market.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of winter clothes as well as shoes.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Quely

texts.es:
Mrs. Quely G. Ruiz is a member of the “Las Margaritas II” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region of Peru, in the Province of San Martin, District of Banda de Shilcayo. She makes money renting internet stations at an internet café located in her home, which is situated next to a major road.

Quely used to sell sweets but she had to be away from home quite a lot and decided to get another job for the wellbeing of her children, who still needed her care. She chose a business that would allow her to keep an eye on her children and at the same time improve her finances. She took advantage of the lack of an internet café in her neighborhood and was the first to open an internet café and build clientele.

With the loan of 800 soles ($275), which she will repay over four months, she will buy a printer and furniture for the internet stations which are necessary for the implementation of her business.

Mrs. Quely is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her two children who support her in everything she does. She knows that she has to work hard every day to achieve her goals. She is a very hard-working woman and a dreamer.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Quely G. Ruiz es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, ella genera sus ingresos dando servicio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet, su negocio se ubica en su propia casa situada en la carretera marginal sur.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de golosinas, pero tenia que salir mucho, por eso decidió cambiar de actividad para buscar el bienestar de sus hijos por que aun necesitan de cuidado, opto por este negocio que le permite estar pendiente de ellos y a la vez mejorar su economía, aprovecho la falta de este servicio por el barrio donde vive para ser la primera y captar a sus clientes.

Con el crédito recibido de S/.800.00 que cancelará en 4 meses, comprará una impresora y muebles para cabinas que faltan para la implementación de su negocio.

La señora Quely tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes le apoyan en lo que ella se propone, sabe que tiene que esforzarse cada día para alcanzar sus objetivos, ella es una mujer emprendedora y muy soñadora.

loans.use: Purchase printer and furniture for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Rit

texts.en:
Mrs. Rit S., 21, sells chickens that she buys from family raisers in her village and resells for a profit. She has been selling chickens since 2005 and makes around $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Tin Ten, 21, is a farmer who farms in two seasons, rainy and dry. He earns around $4 per day. They live with their one child in Sampor Village, Kampong Thom Province. Because of the difficulty to transport chickens for sale, S. is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for her chicken business. The loan will allow her to improve her business and increase the family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for her chicken sales

loans.name: Eusébio Gilbe

texts.pt:
Eusébio Gilberto M.  é natural de manjacaze província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique tem 59 anos idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos, com idades entre 34, 28, 26, 22, 20 e 18 anos respectivamente e todos são estudantes. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Eusébio Gilberto M. estudou até 11ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras, a sua infância fez junto a sua família ate aos 18 anos e depois mudou se da província de Gaza para Lourenço marques para continuar comos estudos e por lá ficou até se casar e fez sua família vivendo lá ate hoje numa casa própria.

Eusébio é funcionário da saúde  a 21 anos na área de medicina. Aprendeu o trabalho na escola de ciências de saúde a 31 anos atrás. Tem um salário mensal de 5.400,00mt não consegue poupar nada.

Eusébio para ele este é o 4º empréstimo na hluvuku e também já se beneficiou dum outro no Novo banco no valor de 7.000,00mt qual usou para compra de produtos para revender ( comercio) o seu sonho é de recondicionar a sua casa para melhor albergar a sua família.
texts.en:
Eusébio Gilberto M. is a native of the Manjacaze province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. He is 59 years old, married, and the father of 6 children with ages 34, 28, 26, 22, 20, and 18 respectively. All of them are students. He only supports his family. Eusébio Gilberto M. went to school until the 11th grade and did not continue because of poor financial conditions. He spent his childhood with his family until he was 18 when he moved from the province of Gaza to Lourenço marques to continue with his studies. From there he stayed until he married and had a family, and he lives there today in his own home. Eusébio has been a health official for 21 years in the area of medicine. He learned his work in a school of health sciences 31 years ago. He has a monthly salary of 5,400MT but is unable to save anything. This is his 4th loan through Hluvuku, although he also benefited from another loan from the New Bank for 7,000MT which he used to purchase products to resell (commerce). His dream is to refurbish his home so he can improve his family's lodging.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Shadida And Zuwena. Group

texts.en:
Shadida is married with 10 children between the ages of 8 and 28 years. She has been a milk and coconut seller since 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Shadida is now looking for a loan to buy more milk and coconuts for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Zuwena, who has a business dealing with tailoring.

loans.use: To buy more milk and coconuts for re-sale.

loans.name: Rocio Edith

texts.es:
La señora Rocio Edith tiene 37 años de edad, es la tesorera del Banco Comunal Hilos de Plata y vive en la Mz G lote 6 Víctor Raúl-Manuel Arévalo, distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y ya no continuó estudiando porque no tenía medios económicos. Tenía su pareja pero se separó y ahora es madre soltera con un hijo de 11 años que depende de ella.
Primero trabajó vendiendo abarrotes, pero no obtenía mucha ganancia, entonces optó por vender fruta en forma ambulatoria en su triciclo y de esto si obtiene buena ganancia, ahora vende fuera del mercado Acomar en Manuel Arévalo.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró fruta.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en fruta e incursionará en la cria de pollos.
Rocio sueña con tener una tienda muy grande donde se venda variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Señora Rocio Edith is 37 years of age. She is the treasurer of the community bank "Hilos de Plata" and lives in Mz G lot 6 Víctor Raúl-Manuel Arévalo, district of Huanchaco, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied completely through secondary school and is not continuing to study anymore because she does not have the economic means. She had a husband but they separated and now she is a single mother with one son who is eleven years old and he depends on her. First she worked selling groceries, but she didn't earn much money. Then she opted to sell fruit in a traveling manner with her tricycle and she earns good money this way. Now she sells outside the market Acomar in Manuel Arévalo. With the first loan of 300 Soles, repaid in four months, she bought fruit. With this loan for 800 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will invest in fruit and branch out by starting to raise chickens. Rocio dreams of having a very big store where she sells a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fruit and begin raising chickens.

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.ru: Алиев Абдуджабор житель района Шахринау. Возраст 22 года. Совсем недавно женился , но живет с женой и с родителями. Семья очень большая. И уже 4 года он работает в лепешечной. Выпекает лепешки для реализации оптом. Дело приносит доход, но в связи с тем , что в зимний период увеличивается спрос на продукцию и  он не успевает закупать муку. Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот , а так же привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdujabor A. resides in the Shahrihay region. He is 22 years old and, although he married recently, he and his wife live with his parents. Their family is quite large. For the past four years he has worked in a bakery which makes traditional bread, sometimes called naan, Bukharan bread, or lepeshka. He bakes bread for sale wholesale. The business yields a return, but the fact is that the demand increases in the wintertime and he is unable to purchase flour. Therefore he has decided to take out a loan, which will enable him to increase his output as well as attract new customers. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad Akjerana, sector Achacachi  de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas y media  de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa, quien se encarga y cuidado del ganado; Apolinar trabaja también como profesor en un colegio del área rural. 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera y así mejorar su producción de leche y  por lo tanto sus ingresos. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro., la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Apolinar raises cattle, and sells the milk he produces to the PIL Andina (the Andean "Planta Industrailizadora de Leche"). He lives in the Akjerana community, Achacachi sector, in the Omasuyos Province of the La Paz Region, located three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who takes care of the cattle. Apolinar also works as a teacher at a rural school. This loan is targeted for buying a dairy cow in order to improve milk production and thereby improve their income. This is his second loan with Impro, having undergone an evaluation which qualified him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group requests loans that contains three members.  S. is the leader of the group.  She is 48 years old and living in Battambang province.  

She sells used clothes by transporting to customers' homes.  Another source of income for her is raising pigs to sell.  Normally, S. buys used clothes from the market and sells to her customers to make a profit.  Besides the clothes selling business, she raises pigs from her house from which she can generate extra income for her family.  

Presently, she lives with her husband and three children.  Her husband, 48, works selling clothes with S..  All of her children are in school: one in high school, one in secondary school, and another one in primary school.  

Because her business is going well, S. needs a loan to increase her capital by purchasing more used clothes for selling and use the remaining money to purchase food to fatten her pigs, which she expects to sell for slaughter soon.

The other two members in the group are: 

- Mrs. S. who grows vegetables to sell and also raises pigs.  She needs a loan to purchase food for her pigs

- Mrs. Y. who is a beef seller in the market.  She needs a loan to use for changing her store from a small one to a bigger one.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Luz es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 4 hijos, Luz vende artículos de limpieza, como escobas, ambientadores, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor a las tiendas y al crédito, diariamente se dedica a la cobranza.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de escobas.
Los sueños de Luz son comprar una casa y establecerse en una tienda.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Communal Bank Buena Suerte (‘Good Luck’). Luz lives with her partner, is 28 years old, and has 4 children. Luz sells cleaning supplies, such as brooms and air freshners. Her sales are carried out wholesale to stores and on credit, and she daily dedicates herself to the collection payments. Luz needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of brooms. Luz’ dreams are to purchase a house and to become established in a store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase brooms.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet K. is 39 years of age and is married to Jimmy Ntambi. The couple has 4 children, the eldest being 16 years old, whereas the youngest is 7 years old. Annet sells clothes in Jinja town, where she rents the stall for USH  200,000 (1 USD = 1,970.00 USH) per month. 

She earns the loyalty of her customers by selling quality products at fair prices. The business earns Annet an  average profit of approximately USH 500,000 per month. Based on her 3 years of experience in the business, Annet dreams of opening up another outlet. The loan proceeds will enable her to replenish her stock of clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce T. is 49 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three males and two females. According to her, some of her children are currently learning trades while the rest are in junior high school. Her husband is a cocoa and palm nut farmer. Joyce lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Joyce is also into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She adds the procured palm nuts to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Joyce wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. It is her dream to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is 36 years old. She is a married woman with four children. Three children are in school, while the fourth is a newborn. She lives with her family in Eguase in the central region of Ghana. 

For the past two years, Juliana has been baking bread and other pastries such as cake, doughnuts, etc., to take care of her household in spite of the challenges she faces. She bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, etc., and sells them to her customers. 

She says she makes sure her food quality meets her customers' expectations. Her customers book their orders in advance; before they come, their orders are ready. She also sells to individuals for their morning breakfast through  house-to-house selling. She says the price of commodities are increasing, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. And the daily demand for bread is high. 

Juliana needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood. She said your assistance would be very welcome. Juliana belongs to a group called called "Won som," which means "let all help". This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood.

loans.name: Cerilla

texts.en:
Cerilla L. is a 45-year-old resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. She is married and fortunate enough to have seven children. All of her children go to school. Cerilla works hard for the needs and education of her children. Everyday, she aims to have income from her mini grocery store. Cerilla is aiming for an expansion of her mini grocery to cater to all the primary needs of her customers.

To be able to realize her plans, Cerilla wants a loan amounting to PHP 10,000.00 from HSPFI (a Kiva partner). She wants to purchase additional stock for her mini grocery store so she can generate more income. Cerilla is looking forward to the great support the organization will extend to her.

loans.use: For the procurement of stock for her mini grocery store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia RUTH, está domiciliada en el barrio de amadeo repeto, en la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años y es casada ella tiene 4 hijos de (12, 5, 3 y 10 meses), ella alterna sus actividades como ama de casa con el comercio minorista, ella tiene una fotocopiadora situada frente a la universidad nacional del Cusco, la cual la implementará mucho más, con la compra de papel A-4, tintas, aceite para mantenimiento de maquinas y otros suministros que necesita, ella también vende cosméticos por catálogo, para lo cual ella requiere el préstamo y así invertir en su negocio.

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida con el apoyo otorgado y así  mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Ruth lives in the Amadeo Repeto neighborhood in the city of Cusco. She is 33, married, and has four children (12, 5, 3, and 10 months). She alternates her activities as a housewife and a small business woman. She has a photo copier located in front of the National University of Cusco. She will put a lot more into her business by buying A-4 paper, inks, oil for machine maintenance, and other needed supplies. She also sells cosmetics via catalog. She needs a loan to invest in the business. She is very grateful for the support given to her, she promises to complete the payment of her loan in the scheduled period.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the photocopier

loans.name: Abed El Karim

texts.en:
Abed Al Karim is a 21 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Abed Al Karim has been working as a motorcycle repairer. Abed Al Karim has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Abed Al Karim has requested a loan.  
Abed Al Karim is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face the competition. Abed Al Karim decided on doing his business because of his experience in his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Abed El Karim will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Frida Leonor

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. FRIDA, nuestra socia es originaria de Huarán, en la provincia de Calca del departamento de Cusco, ubicado a1 hora y 20 minutos de la misma ciudad, siendo Huarán parte del corazón del valle sagrado de años Incas.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad, y es casada, ella tiene 4 hijos los último tienen (20,19), la socia alterna sus actividades de hogar con la agricultura, vende granos al por mayor y menor y el Turismo vivencial participativo,  nuestra socia desea invertir el préstamo solicitado en la implementación de sus habitaciones y baños para sus turistas que la visitan durante todo el año y se hospedan en su casita en pleno corazón del valle sagrado.

Nuestra socia se muestra muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado, lo cual le permitira arreglar su casita y seguir albergando a más turistas de manera adecuada y así mismo se compromete en el pago de su deuda según el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This communal bank member is Mrs. Frida. She is originally from Huarán, located in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco. Located an hour and 20 minutes outside of Cusco, Huarán is in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas.

Frida is 49 years old, married, and has 4 children (with the last two being ages 20 and 19). She splits her time between her household responsibilities and farming, selling grains wholesale and retail and by providing homestays for tourists. Frida wishes to invest the requested loan in constructing rooms and bathrooms for tourists who visit throughout the year and seek lodging at her cottage in the heart of the Sacred Valley.

Our member is very grateful for being granted this loan, which will allow her to remodel her cottage so that she can adequately accommodate more tourists. At the same time, she promises to repay the debt within the specified period.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build rental rooms & additional bathrooms for tourists

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach M., 40, sells chickens and palm fruit in Phnom Penh City with gross revenue of $50 per day. She lives with her husband and four school-aged children. Her husband always helps her with her current business at the market.

M. has to work hard to generate income for her children’s education-related and family expanses, so she has made up her mind to take a loan of $600 to expand her business. M. was not available, so her husband is pictured with his palm fruit instead.

loans.use: To buy chickens and palm fruit

loans.name: Grace Esi

texts.en: Grace Esi O. sells kenkey at Abura. Grace Esi has received junior high school education. She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a cleaner at UCC. Grace Esi has been selling kenkey since 1989. She is responsible for paying for fees and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey in a large quantity. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and re-invest.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare the kenkey in a large quantity.

loans.name: Abigael Arielle

texts.en:
Abigael is married and has three daughters. She runs a shop in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, where she sells cosmetics, suitcases, and jewelry. Abigael also develops photographs when her clients bring their cameras. Abigael has already obtained a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin. This loan allowed her to purchase suitcases and other goods in bulk. She was able to visit markets in Togo and Ghana, two countries west of Benin, to buy her goods. 
   
Abigael’s business is going well, but she is seeking another loan to expand her operations. In the future, she would like to start selling fabrics, and to expand her selection of cosmetic products and jewelry. Most people go to the larger city of Cotonou to buy their jewelry, so Abigael sees an opportunity to bring the market to Porto-Novo. Abigael hopes to acquire a loan and to increase her revenues.

loans.use: Fabrics, jewelry, cosmetics, and suitcases

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita C. is 32 years old and is married to Alfredo. They have two children, ages 9 and 13. Both are in school, one in high school, the other in elementary. Anita's husband is a fish vendor.

Anita runs her own hog breeding and fattening business while also attending to the needs of her children at home and doing the household chores. Anita's business started about the time she got married. At that time, she had no means of financing a hog breeding and fattening business, so she only bought piglets to fatten. Once fattened hogs are sold, after four months, the original capital is replenished; in fact, profit from this kind of business can be as much as double its capital.

When Anita joined the Kiva field partner, ASHI, in 2003, she was able to get a loan. That's when she started her hog breeding and fattening business. Now Anita has two gilts (female pigs raised for breeding) that produce piglets. Instead of selling piglets for $32 to $53, Anita chose to fatten the piglets and sell them in volume after four months, bringing in from $85 to $127 each. Profits from her business finance the family's daily needs and support her husband's fish selling business.

This kind of business also incurs a lot of expenses when piglets are newly born. They need immunizations and vaccinations to insure better growth. Feed is also expensive. In order to sustain her business by meeting its financial needs, Anita is requesting a loan from ASHI that will be much larger than the one she had previously.

Someday, Anita wants to have her own piggery, where she would breed and raise a lot of pigs. She also wants all of her children to be able to finish college.

loans.use: To finance her hog breeding and fattening business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Like most enterprising housewives in the Philippines, Florencia S., 47 years old, makes a living from buying and selling cosmetic items and apparel from prominent direct-selling companies (Avon, Sundance, Natasha, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc.), which has been a tried and tested source of income for them.

Florencia’s family lives in Pasay City, a bustling community in the middle of the metropolis.  Her husband Renato, 48, drives his own motorized tricycle, an alternative source of income for their family.  Three of their six children are now working.  

Florencia has just started with her direct selling business only last year but she is already earning at least P11,000.00 net income per month.  She is working hard to help her husband augment their basic daily needs.  Florencia needs a new loan in the amount of P15,000.00 so she can purchase goods in advance to get more rebates from suppliers.  She dreams of seeing all their children who are still in school finish their college studies.   



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy M. vive en la ciudad de Aregua, esta casado con Fidelina Esquivel hace mas de diez años con quien tuvo dos hijos ambos menores aun. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos electrónicos, accesorios para automóviles entre otros productos desde hace mas de doce años. El crédito de la Fundación Pya. lo destinó en parte a la refacción de su vivienda y a la compra de mercaderías. A través del comercio puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia como también como también refaccionar  su vivienda .
texts.en:
Mr. Fredy M. lives in the city of Aregua. He has been married for ten years to his wife Fidelina Esquivel, and they have two children, who are both minors and under their care. For 12 years Fredy has worked as a traveling salesman, selling electronics and car accessories, among other products. The loan from la Fundación Pya. will be used for the refurbishment of his home and also for the purchase of merchandise to sell. Through the retail business, Fredy is able to provide for the basic necessities of his family and also earn money to improve his family home.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his home, to purchase electronic products and car accessories for later resale.

loans.name: Shindy

texts.en:
Shindy B. is from Santiago, Iligan City. She is 24 years old. Shindy is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Shindy owns & operates a business selling scrap metal & other used-products in the local community. Shindy earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shindy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shindy is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Shindy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia E. is from the town of Aloran. She is 74 years old. Dionesia is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Dionesia owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Dionesia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Dionesia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
