loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James O. Oduor, 45 yrs old, has been in metal working for 12 years.  His business is called Lunjre Welders and he makes window frames, kiosks, gates and school equipment.  His business is located on the edge of a slum on Nyalenda Street outside Kisumu, and his clients are house builders and schools.  He has two full-time employees and three student apprentices (an apprentice is in the photo with James). James' main challenges are security for his shop and periodic power outages.  His long term business goal is to buy a container to secure his goods and to manufacture kiosks on a larger scale.  He is married to a shopkeeper and they have seven children ranging from three to 17 yrs old.  James describes himself as a hardworking entrepreneur and he hopes to educate all of his children.

loans.use: Raw materials to construct kiosks

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth P. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena  Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Maribeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribeth owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maribeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maribeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nohemi Rosalin

texts.es:
La señora NOHEMI, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y tiene dos hijos. 

La socia alterna las actividades del hogar con la venta de material de construcción con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar. La socia nos cuenta que antes solo vendía carrizo que se utiliza para la construcción de techos, estucados y divisiones propiamente de la casa. Hoy en día la socia también vende cemento, tejas y piedra chancada. Las construcciones de las casas de la ciudad del Cusco están echas de adobe (El adobe, o bloque de tierra sin cocer moldeada en forma de ladrillo y secada al sol, es un material de construcción muy presente en la historia de las civilizaciones peruanas.). Ya son varios años en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo adquirir más materiales de construcción como tejas, yeso, cemento y arena.   
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nohemi belongs to the communal bank "NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” of Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in the Cusco province of the Cusco department. She has a partner, is 28 years old, and has two children. She alternates her household activities with selling construction materials, which contribute to the economic income of the household. She told us that she previously sold reed to be used for constructing roofs, wallpaper, and other parts of the house. Nowadays, she also sells cement, tiles, and gravel. The houses in the city of Cusco are made of adobe. Adobe are blocks of untreated earth molded in the form of a brick and dried by the sun, which is a very common material in the history of Peruvian civilizations. She has been doing this business for a few years and it has been going well thanks to all the determination that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who allows her family to move ahead through adversity. She requires the loan in order to acquire more construction materials like tiles, plaster, cement, and sand. She is thankful for the opportunity given to her through this method and also commits to repay the loan according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more construction materials like tile, plaster, cement, and sand

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en:
Ofelia A. is from the village of Buenavista Santiago. She is 46 years old. Ofelia is the group leader of a thirteen-member group loan offered by the Kiva field partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ofelia A.'s group.

Ofelia is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia works as a beautician and manicurist in their community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 350 PHP daily from these activities.

In 2009, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used in purchasing additional materials needed in the manicure and pedicure business. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in the manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
T. Trần Thị (20206030045) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N..  T. is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu 1 nhóm 06 (6).

T. is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing food services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Lưu Thị Quả  (20206030046) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Kiều Thị C. (20206030047) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

3.  Nguyễn V. H. (20206030048) is a 46-year-old male who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support his business in the food sector making and selling food.

4.  Tô Thị N. (20206030049) is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Lê Thị T. (20206030050) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  Kiều V. L. (20206030051) is a 34-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

7.  Kiều Thị H. (20206030052) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Trần Thị (20206030045) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc N..  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu 1 nhóm 06 (6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ thực phẩm cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Lưu Thị Quả  (20206030046) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Kiều Thị C. (20206030047) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3.  Nguyễn V. H. (20206030048) là 46 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4.  Tô Thị N. (20206030049) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  Lê Thị T. (20206030050) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6.  Kiều V. L. (20206030051) là 34 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

7.  Kiều Thị H. (20206030052) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Wafa has been producing agro products since 2000. She produces different type of jams, spices and more. She is an active woman who does her best to improve her family’s income and is a hardworking lady. 

She is well-known in her work because she offers good quality and very tasty products. She always tries new recipes and health products to sell. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash. Wafa decided to start her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, especially since she has a big family and she wants to offer them the best she can.

She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials for her business. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.  She plans to keep on improving her business as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora Eufemia  es casada, tiene 44 años, tiene  1 hija.
Su taller de costura montó gracias a un pequeño capital que había  ahorrado durante varios años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulante de ropas. 
Quiere comprar la tela al por mayor, pues, así consigue más barato  y tiene un margen importante de ganancia.
La señora Eufemia  es una persona muy activa tiene un espíritu jovial, y cuenta con un carácter muy agradable por lo que muchas personas siempre están a su alrededor. Manifiesta que quiere mejorar su negocio ya que es la fuente de su ingreso. 
Ella se esfuerza al máximo para mejorar su hogar, pero sin descuidarse del capital de su negocio por lo que considero que es una persona a quien debemos apoyar constantemente, ya sea económica y moralmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Eufemia is 44 years old and married with 1 daughter. She started a tailoring business with a bit of money that she saved over the years. Before that, she worked as a street vendor selling clothing. She wants to buy wholesale supplies of cloth because it is cheaper that way and the extra margin would increase her earnings. Eufemia is a hard-working person and her winning personality draws others to her. She says that she wants to improve her business because it is her main source of income. She works hard to make her home nice but without neglecting her business. We consider her to be a person that everyone should support, both economically and morally.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Espino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Espino está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es Vilma Enmerita P. M. quien es la coordinadora del grupo. Esta señora de 52 años tiene una fritanga que ha ido surgiendo poco a poco, ella acredita este logro al poyo de sus hijos y la administración que ha hecho del préstamo luego de ser capacitada.

Para P. el  haber sido parte del proceso de capacitación y formación de género y desarrollo empresarial que Adim promueve fue un gran apoyo ya que izo cambiar su visión del negocio y tener mayores resultados en este. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son la joven Silvia María Pérez Díaz quien vende prendas de oro y plata y Nidia del Carmen C. Hernández que se dedica a la compra y venta de tamarindo, manís, cacao etc.
texts.en:
The group "Espino" is made up of 3 enterprising women, one of whom is Vilma Enmerita P. M., who is the coordinator of the group. She is 52 years old, and has a fritanga (street-side business selling fried foods) which has been growing little by little. She credits this success to the support of her children and the institution that made her the loan and later gave her training. For P., having been part of the process of this kind of training and business development that ADIM promotes was great support, since it changed her vision of the business, and she has had better results with this. Her fellow group members are the young Silvia María Pérez Díaz, who sells gold and silver jewelry, and Nidia del Carmen C. Hernández, who buys and sells tamarind, peanuts, cocoa, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, staple grains, cooking oil, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Yuos

texts.en:
Yuos T., age 55, cultivates a variety of crops on farmland that was inherited from her grandparents. She has financial support in her husband, who is a village advisor. For years, they have owned a medium-sized house located in a rural area of Phnom Penh, where they live with their family. The couple has given birth to nine children, six of whom are now married. 

Yuos T. has made an income through her farming work in order to feed their children from the time they were young. Yuos T. has requested a loan in order to purchase a farming machine to supply her farming business. She plans to rent her new machine to other farmers for a fee.

(Mrs. Yuos T. was not available for photographing so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a farming machine

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng R. is an old woman of fifty-two years who lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has two children, both of whom are married and live in the family home, working in the garment industry.

Since 1979, Leng R. has been cultivating various crops. Beside her farm work, she is skilled in producing cement jars. In order to earn additional profit, she requests a loan to purchase raw materials such as cement and other essential accessories that she uses to make jars for sale.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making cement jars

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D. is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has received junior high education.  Ama prepares 'Fante kenkey' (boiled maize dough) and distributes it to her customers for sale at Abura. She has been selling 'Fante kenkey' for some time now. Ama uses her income she acquires from the sale of her 'kenkey' to help her husband in taking care of the family.  

Ama will use the new loan to purchase more bags of maize to prepare her 'kenkey' to distribute to her increasing customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to establish a 'kenkey' factory.

loans.use: purchase more bags of maize to use to prepare 'kenkey'

loans.name: Atad

texts.en:
Atad R. is from the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 47 years old. Atad is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Atad owns & operates a business venture selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Atad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Atad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Atad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Atad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Atad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wali Group

texts.en:
Wali is the leader of 'Wali' group. He lives in district three of Jalalabad City. He is 23 years old and a married man who has two sons. He is a taxi driver, but his taxi tires have become old so he wants to take out a loan to purchase new tires and also repair the engine of his taxi. 

This is the only source of income through which he supports his family members. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders around the world for this effective process.

loans.use: to replace his tires and fix his engine

loans.name: Dialia

texts.fr:
Née le 17 Janvier 1976 à Sikasso ville, Dialia B. est divorcée et mère d’une petite fille. Elle réside avec sa fille chez son grand frère à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle décida de mener les activités d’achat et de vente d’habillements  il y a environ quinze ans, depuis très jeune, auprès de sa grande sœur. 
L’insuffisance des ressources financières pour bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de cette demande de prêt à Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est en partenariat depuis le 18 janvier 2006. Il a bénéficié un premier prêt qui a été correctement remboursé. 
Ainsi après une pose d’un an, elle sollicite un deuxième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter, des habits  pour enfants, 40 complets, 20 couvertures, 6 douzaines de poudre et 5 douzaines de parfums à Cotonou et à Lomé (Républiques du Bénin et de Togo en Afrique de l’Ouest). Elle revend ses marchandises au comptant dans sa boutique située sur la route de Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Dialia B. was born on January 17, 1976 in Sikasso. She is divorced and the mother of one daughter. She lives with her daughter at her older brother’s home in Sanoubougou I, one of the working neighborhoods in the town of Sikasso. After several unsuccessful attempts, she decided, at a young age, about 15 years ago, to take up the purchase and sell of clothing alongside her older sister. The lack of financial resources to conduct her business properly is the reason and cause behind her request for a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. She has been a member since January 18, 2006. She has received one previous loan, which has been fully reimbursed. After a one year hiatus, she is requesting a second loan that will allow her to buy children’s clothing, 40 suits, 20 blankets, 6 dozen of powder and 5 dozens of perfumes from Cotonou and Lomé (Republic of Benin and Togo, West Africa). She retails her merchandises for cash in her shop located on the Bobo Dioulasso road (Republic of Burkina Faso). Her customer base is mostly women. She is planning on making a monthly profit of 150 000 Francs CFA which will be used to provide for the bulk of her expenses, take part in covering household expenses, pay back her loan and invest the rest in her activity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and various other goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase and diversify her clothing merchandise for winter

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Maria del Carmen G. es soltera, tiene una hija que depende de ella al 100%, vive en el barrio Buenos Aires, Maria es una mujer muy luchadora, su negocio es la venta de comida (desayunos, almuerzos), ademas vende achineria en un nuevo puesto que acaba de inagurar y el cual se lo administra su hija.
a Maria no le gusta sonreir mucho.
el credito lo utilizara para remodelar y comprar comida para su comedor.
tambien comprara cosas para surtir el puesto de achineria.
su mayor deseo en estos momentos es que que su hija pueda continuar estudiando y se gradue de la universidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria del Carmen G. is single and has a daughter who is 100% dependent on her. She lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires. Maria is a determined woman who sells food (breakfasts and lunches). She also sells low-cost merchandise at a new vending stand that her daughter manages. Maria does not like to smile much.

This loan will be used to remodel her diner and buy food for her business. She also plans to buy merchandise to restock her vending stand. Her greatest wish at the moment is for her daughter to continue her studies and graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beef, beans, and soft drinks

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina K. is a married woman running a small business.  She sells fish, both fried and fresh fish, to her customers. She purchases fish from the market at Ferry Fish City Shopping Center in wholesale and retail shops. She also sometimes purchases directly from the fisherman. Her business income is used to meet daily family needs and for business expansion. She needs a loan of 700,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for selling

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en: Jennylyn M. is from the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Jennylyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jennylyn sells personal products in the local community. Jennylyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Jennylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jennylyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jennylyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is 53 years old and a single mother of three. She has been raising her children with income from her rental houses.  She rents the houses to low-income earners.  Because she is a single mother with all her children in college, she sells charcoal to increase her family's income.  She has been renting the houses for four years and she hopes to build better houses for more income.  Currently, she wants to renovate her houses hence she is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya.  In five years, she hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: renovating rental houses

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah M. is a National Palestinian Authority employee, married and a father who takes care of his family and parents. Salah's dad owned a workshop where he produced Aluminium home accessories such as windows, doors, cupboard... etc. Salah's salary barely covers basic needs, therefor he decided to start working with his father.

Saleh gained a good experience working with his dad and started developing the 10-years old workshop, in this attempt he took a $2,000 loan to buy an aluminum piston and other tools needed to enhance work quality and answer the customers orders.
Since Salah started working with his dad and his financial situation is improving .

loans.use: Purchase an aluminum piston

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for her coffee crop & gasoline to sell

loans.name: Maximeno

texts.en:
Maximeno F. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 70 years old. Maximeno is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Maximeno owns & operates a business harvesting & selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Maximeno has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maximeno joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maximeno has successfully repaid a previous loan of 45,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to raise. Maximeno is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fish feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Maximeno from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish feed and other supplies

loans.name: Minazini Group

texts.en:
Mariam R. is in her early twenties and is married with one son. She has been running a small grocery store since 2007, from which she sells various products such as soda, juice, mobile phone vouchers etc. The shop is open between 6 am and 9 pm and earns Mariam a low monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Mariam used her first loan to increase her stock of goods, a loan which she has now successfully repaid. With her second loan, Mariam aims to once again increase her business by expanding her stock, and introducing some new products. 

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group Minazin, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Mariam can be seen sitting second from right in the front row.

loans.use: Top increase Stock

loans.name: Margarita Cupertina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

Para la señora Margarita este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institución. Tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven aun con ella. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Desde muy joven aprendió corte y confección y es a eso que se dedica, tiene un pequeño taller de costura en el que realiza una gran cantidad de obras. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 12pm y desde las 15 pm hasta la noche, dice que no trabaja todo el día porque tiene que atender a su esposo e hijos que se dedican al campo, pero en las noches a veces se queda hasta la madrugada cuando tiene bastante trabajo. Le encanta hacer vestidos de niñas. Sus obras las entrega en el Centro Comercial de Portoviejo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más telas y otros artículos que se utilizan en la costura. Su aspiración es tener un local en el centro en Portoviejo.
texts.en:
The Colón communal bank meets every two weeks in Colón parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley, because it’s surrounded by many hills.  People here are farmers for the most part.

This is Margarita’s fourth cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it because of the benefits the institution offers.  She is 55 years old, married and has seven adult children.  Three of them still live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

She learned sewing and dressmaking while still very young and this is her occupation.  She has a small workshop where she makes a large number of items.  She works daily from 9am until noon and from 3pm until night.  She says that she doesn’t work all day because she has to care for her husband and children who work in the fields.  However, at night she sometimes works until dawn when she has a lot of work to do.  She loves making dresses for girls.  She delivers her completed items to Portoviejo’s Commercial Center.

This loan is to buy more fabric and other items used in sewing.  Her goal is to have a locale in downtown Portoviejo.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en: Mrs. Samon S. and her husband, Mr. Yi Yoeun, have been married since 1978 and have 8 children - 6 sons and 2 daughters. Samon is a weaver and her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of $350 to provide capital for her husband to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mikias

texts.en:
Mikias B. is from the village of San Roque. He is 56 years old. Mikias is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mikias owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mikias has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mikias joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mikias has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Mikias is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Mikias from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Cristo Me Ama 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
R. is excited to be seeking her first loan through Esperanza. She is the mother of six children, four of whom live with her and her long-term partner. To earn a living, she operates a clothing sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. She will save any profits generated as a result of the loan because she wants to buy a house in the future, and her business income is the only means by which she can do so.

R. is a member of the group known as Cristo me ama 1, 2, 3 ("Christ love me"). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugar cane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She thanks you for your support.

Note: the woman pictured in the lower left corner was not visible in the group picture.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus tres  hijos; pues juntos buscan salir adelante y alcanzar el progreso.Desde hace 10 años, esta laboriosa madre de familia tuvo que integrarse al trabajo de su esposo en apoyo de las filmaciones y tomas fotográficas, que él realiza. Le presta su ayuda pues en ciertas oportunidades su pareja  no se abastecía en brindar los servicios, y en la actualidad si se abastece. Por esta razón Gloria tuvo que aprender a utilizar las máquinas fotográficas y filmadoras, y la labor que ella desempeña  es tomar las fotos de los eventos donde  la contratan, de lo contrario atiende su negocio en su local situado en su vivienda. A lo largo de todos estos años han logrado captar regular cantidad de clientela; y su labor le resulta bastante rentable, por lo que está muy contenta por el éxito del negocio,  pues  su hijo mayor apoya en la edición de video. Es por esta razón que Gloria, piensa adquirir más herramientas para su negocio y para el futuro desea adquirir su propia reveladora de fotografías.Es el 14avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete en pagar  sus cuotas de manera oportuna, para seguir contando con posteriores ayudas, y así continuar progresando en su negocio.Gloria tiene planeado invertir  el crédito solicitado, en la adquisición de  una filmadora digital, para continuar desarrollando su trabajo sin problemas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  Together they work to get ahead in life and make progress.

For 10 years, this hard-working mother has been working alongside her husband, supporting him in his filming and photography work.  She started helping him because he sometimes had opportunities for work but was unable to provide his services.  With Gloria's help, he can now manage.  Gloria had to learn to use photography equipment and video cameras.  Her current work is taking photos at events where they are contacted to provide their services.  At other times she serves in their business which is located in their home.

Over the years, Gloria has managed to attract a decent number of customers and her work is quite profitable.  She is very happy with the success of the business.  Her eldest son supports them by doing some video editing work.  Gloria is thinking of acquiring more tools for her business and in the future she would like to acquire her own photo developer.

This is Gloria's 14th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time so that she can continue relying on loans in the future and thereby continue making progress in her business.  Gloria plans to invest her loan money in acquiring a digital video camera so that she can continue doing her work without problems.

loans.use: To buy a video camera to improve her business

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu city.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: Tailoring and Buying and Selling of charcoal and wood businesses.  Her husband Samie A., who is 68 years old, works as a Driver to earn his living.  They have 3 children who are between the ages of 13 to 19 years old, and all of them are currently going to school. 

Victoriana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Victoriana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 30,000 PHP, increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing 18,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials for sewing so that she could continue to save up for the future to increase their income and save for the future her family.  Victoriana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw matrerials needed for sewing.

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah M. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Shakirah has a salon business, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a big dryer and hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and buy clothes for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and add some cosmetics.
Shakirah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her positive behaviors.

loans.use: To purchase a big dryer plus hair braids for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Y Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
Dichas mujeres son de la compañía Pedrozo de la ciudad de Caacupe.
Las señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya porque gracias a las facilidades del crédito van a poder invertir y hacer crecer de ese modo sus negocios, generando mayores ingresos, que le ayudarán en un corto plazo a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
La presidenta, la Sra. Dora M., es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre de una hija que tiene la enfermedad de lupus, ella gracias a la oportunidad que le ofrece la fundación, con su facilidad de crédito y sus capacitaciones, va a poder invertir en su negocio de venta de leche, comprando las vacas que le faltan y los bidones, y de ese modo generar mayores ingresos para seguir solventando los gastos que requiere el tratamiento de su hija.
texts.en:
These women are from the Pedrozo company of the city of Caacupe.

The ladies are very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya because thanks to them they were able to receive a loan that they will invest in and see their businesses grow, which will create more income that will help them improve their quality of life and that of their families.

The president, Mrs. Dora M., is a hardworking woman and mother to a girl who has lupus. She is grateful for the opportunity given by the foundation, since it is easy to acquire loans and the preparations given by them. Mrs. Dora will be able to invest in her business, selling milk, by buying cows and bottles, she will be able to have more income and use it to meet the expenses required for her daughters’ treatment.

loans.use: To buy bottles to store the milk and to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus M. aged 33 years is married with three children; Shirley, Britney and Ann. He runs a shop located at Njiru market which is a busy market. He has been running this business for 5 years and it gives him a monthly profit of Kshs.5, 000.

He was introduced to KADET by an existing client. This loan of Kshs.80, 000 is his fourth loan with Kadet and he plans to use it to add stock of sugar, soda, cooking oil, salt and sweets. The profits expected will be used to educate his children and improve the living standards of his family.

Nicodemus’ dreams and hopes are to turn his shop into a supermarket. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, soda, cooking oil, salt and sweets.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor María T. vive en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Medellín y se dedica a la venta de pulpas de fruta, las cuales ella misma procesa. En su negocio la ayudan algunas personas de su familia quienes la acompañan en sus jornadas de trabajo de lunes a viernes.
Debido a la alta demanda de sus productos ha alcanzado a cubrir las necesidades de restaurantes cercanos, sin embargo ha encontrado problemas para poder adquirir la materia prima para sus pulpas.

Es por esto que Flor María necesita el dinero para poder comprar frutas tales como: Guanábana, Mora y Guayaba, y también para comprar empaques para el producto terminado debido a que ya cuentan con código de barras y logotipo. Flor está segura que tener la fruta suficiente para procesar se traduce en un mejor flujo de caja y logrará así posicionar su marca en el mercado.
texts.en:
Flor María T. lives in a town near Medellín and she sells fruit pulp that she processes herself. In her business, some family members help her, accompanying her at work from Monday through Friday.

Due to the high demand of her products, she has been able to cover the needs of nearby restaurants. Nonetheless, she has run into trouble being able to acquire raw materials for her pulps.  

This is why Flor María needs the money to be able to buy fruit, such as:  guanábana, rasberries, and  guayaba. She also needs to be able to buy packing material for the finished product since they already have a logo and a barcode. Flor is sure that having enough fruit to process translates into a better cash flow and thus she will be able to position her brand in the market.

loans.use: to buy fruit, packing material and baskets.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del banco comunal Las Rosas, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos 
Lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos  y eso le ha servido para mejorar su negocio, su esposo es trabajador independiente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 delineadores para sejas, 2 delineadores retráctil, 1 crema para mano, 2 limpiadores facial, 2 lociones tonificantes, 1 colonia en espray,1 exfoliante renovador, 1 crema suavizante.
Es una consultora de Unique que ha trabajado mucho tiempo y gracias a ello ha podido tener un capital que le permite seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Las Rosas communal bank in the Calleria district within the Ucayali department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two children.

She’s been working with the Manuela Rosa organization for two years and this has allowed her to improve her business.  Her husband is a freelance worker.  She will use the money from this loan of 1,500 PEN to buy 2 eyebrow liners, 2 retractable eyeliners, 1 hand cream, 2 facial cleansers, 2 toning lotions, 1 spray cologne, 1 exfoliating wash, and 1 moisturizing cream.  She is a Unique consultant who has worked for a long time.  Thanks to this, she has been able to have the capital to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Haltaji's Group

texts.en:
Haltaji S. is the leader of this group. She is 53 and married to a farmer. Together they have raised two daughters, both married, and a son, who has gone to work in Russia. In order to earn money to meet family needs, Haltaji and her husband cultivate cotton. They started this activity in 1991 with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. Haltaji has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers. In the future, Haltaji plans to start livestock breeding and make some repairs to her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is currently in the business of selling plates. She is 25 years old and married. She has 2 children, but ony 1 of them goes to school. Beatrice borrowed a loan to stock more plates to sell. She hopes to buy a piece of land and cattle(cows) in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more plates to sell.

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en:
Cleopatra, age 40, has operated a bar business for the past four years. She sells a variety of beverages such as beer, soda, and energy drinks. She tells us that one of her favorite elements of her work is the interaction with her customers. 

Cleopatra is also a college student. Her husband works with a GSM company as an administrative manager and the family lives in West Point.
 
Cleopatra is requesting a loan in order to purchase cartons of beer, soda, and energy drinks for her business. She aspires to see her children become future leaders of tomorrow.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of beer, soda, and energy drinks for her business

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 49 years old and married. To earn a living she raises pigs. She has operated this business for five years. Although the business is quite tiring, she does not mind at all because she wants to assist her husband support their needs, especially the education of their children.

To continuously manage her business, Aurea is requesting a loan of Php15,000 to buy piglets to raise and sell in the future. With additional piglets she is positive that she can earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Rolando Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Rolando, es un pequeño agricultor del municipio de Ticuantepe , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a su hermana en sus estudios ya que desde que falleció  su mamá él se hace responsable de los gastos del hogar  , don Rolando la mayor afectación  que se le presenta en el cultivo de aguacate es la falta de fertilizantes e insumos para poder sacar calidad y así de la misma manera tenga una buena paga . Agradece Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva la confianza y el apoyo. Ya que si esto no fuese posible no podría salir hacia adelante como un pequeño productor .
texts.en: Rolando is a small farmer from Ticuantepe who supports his family since his mother passed away. In order to meet expenses, Rolando grows avocados for the local market, but needs fertilizer and supplies to grow better quality produce to sell at a better price. He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for their support and trust.  Without access to credit, Rolando would not be able to prosper as a small farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer supplies

loans.name: Generalas Group

texts.es:
Las ‘Generalas’ es un grupo formado por 7 personas que se encuentran en su primer ciclo de crédito al norte de la ciudad de Escobedo en Nuevo León. Sus integrantes escogieron ese nombre porque admiran al famoso general mexicano ‘Pancho Villa’, quien formó parte importante del éxito de la Revolución Mexicana.

Blanca Leticia es una de las integrantes del grupo, está por cumplir los 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 10 años y otro de 6 años.  Blanca se dedica a la venta de comidas en una cooperativa en una escuela primaria donde ofrece a los alumnos y maestros varios tipos de comida como tacos de diferentes guisos, hamburguesas y algunas botanas. Con su crédito, Blanca planea comprar suministros para ofrecer más variedad de comidas como algunos tipos de tamales, gorditas y quesadillas. Una de las metas de Blanca es lograr que su negocio crezca para que pueda expandirse a más escuelas de su ciudad y así ayudar a alimentar a una mayor cantidad de niños y maestros.
texts.en:
'Generalas’ is a group with seven members who are in their first loan cycle.  They live in the north of the city of Escobedo, in Nuevo León.  The members chose this name because they admire the famous Mexican general 'Pancho Villa' who played an important role in the success of the Mexican Revolution.  

Blanca Leticia is one of the group's members.  She is about to turn 31, is married, and has two children aged 10 and 6.  Blanca's business is selling food in an elementary school.  She sells the students and teachers different types of food such as tacos, burgers and some snacks.  Blanca plans to use her loan to buy supplies so that she can offer a wider range of food including some types of tamales, 'gorditas' (a type of stuffed corn cake) and quesadillas.  One of Blanca's goals is to grow her business so that she can expand to cover more schools in her city and thereby help feed a larger number of children and teachers.

loans.use: to buy supplies so that she can sell a wider range of food

loans.name: Noreyni Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Noreyni du banc villageois de Sokhna Momy est créé le 09 décembre 2010. Il regroupe 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et font toutes du commerce au marché central du village.
La présidente du groupe de solidarité Ndéye Kaba est âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Sur la photo elle est à droite en boubou rose et blanc avec un châle noir sur les épaules.
Elle fait du petit commerce de fruits de saison. Elle vend ses produits au marché central du village.
Avec son prêt elle va s'approvisionner selon la disponibilité du marché en produits de saison.
Mon mari et moi subvenons aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: The  Noreyni solidarity group of the Sokhna Momy village bank was created on December 9, 2010. The group is made up of 13 women who live in the same neighbourhood and carry out business at Darou's central market. The president of the group, Ndeye Kaba, is 49 years old and married with 2 children. In the photo, she is on the right in the white and pink boubou with a black shawl over her shoulders. She has a small business selling seasonal fruit. She sells her products at Darou's central market. With her loan she is going to source seasonal produce in accordance with market availability. "My husband and I provide for the needs of our family"

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for reselling

loans.name: Heshima Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sikitu, leader du groupe d’affaire « Heshima »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 28 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants, tous étudient. Elle est  vendeuse de la viande (porc) et sociétaire d’une boucherie.  Son mari est aussi un boucher.  Elle vend ses marchandises dans une boucherie au public. Il y a 3 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  9 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  3 Cochons (porcs) à abattre.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Heshima » est restreint à 6 femmes.
texts.en:
Sikitu, our client, is the leader of the business group "Heshima". She is 28 years old, an entrepreneur, married, and the mother of four children, who are all students. She sells meat (pork) and is a partner in a butcher shop. Her husband is also a butcher. She sells to the public and has been in this business for three years. 

However, Sikitu just completed nine loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve to provide her with three pigs for slaughter. In addition, her ambition is to educate her children and to buy a plot of land on which to build easily.

Our client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. It is appropriate to note that the business group "Heshima" is restricted to six women.

loans.use: to buy three pigs

loans.name: Tuyoto

texts.en:
Tuyoto is 51 years old, married to Nateku and blessed with five children. For the last twenty years he has been a livestock trader, earning 10,830 KES a month.

Tuyoto was introduced to KADET through its staff. He is applying for his second loan from KADET of 70,000 KES, which he plans to use to purchase more livestock, including two cows, fifteen goats and other things. He will use his profits to buy a pick-up for transportation.

Tuyoto hopes to have a cattle ranch and sell the meat in Barma Market in Nairobi.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock, including two cows, fifteen goats and other things.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 59 years old, married, and has nine grown children who are independent. She has had a business making and selling food for 10 years. She sells her products, such as native cakes, pancit and chicharon, on a house-to-house basis. She sells every day to earn income for their daily expenditures. With her determination in life, she wishes to buy more products to be sell within their village. Lilia is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy ingredients for making native cakes, chicharon, bihon and other kinds of snacks in her food production business. She hopes that she can increase the income she generates from her business so that she can provide for their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making native cakes, chicharon, bihon and other kinds of snacks in her food production business.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 50 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Florita sells snacks.  She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Florita has a requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase juice and three sacks of bananas.

Florita has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Florita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase juice and three sacks of bananas.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Benedicta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Benedicta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Benedicta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
This is Hermosa, 50, a resident of Silang Cavite City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Hermosa operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and also a variety of hanging plants and other similar plants. Aside from this she also sells cooked viands (tasty food dishes) for extra income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 32,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer, garden inputs and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Hermosa hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to have her own family someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria,de 35 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos dos de ellos estudian en un instituto de la capital, el negocio de ella es una pequeña tienda donde vende productos Maxicanos como,cafe,cereal,aceite,frijol,jabon,etc. y ademas del producto Mexicano tambien vende ragalitos para toda ocacion,y mercaderia de libreria su negocio lo inicio hace 2 años, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos Mexicanos y regalitos para la venta,y de esa manera agrandar mas su negocio.el sueño de Maria es que sus hijos crezcan con la educacion nesesaria para poder tener un mejor futuro y de mas oportunidades de superar.
texts.en: Maria is 35 years old, married, and she has 3 children. Two of them attend an educational institution in the capital city. Her business is a small store where she sells Mexican products such as coffee, cereals, cooking oil, beans, soaps, etc. In addition to Mexican products, she also sells gifts for all occasions and office supply merchandise. She started out her business 2 years ago. She requests this loan to purchase Mexican products and gifts for resale. This is how she will increase her business. Maria's dream is for her children to grow up with the necessary education to have better future and more opportunities for self-improvement.

loans.use: to purchase food products and gifts for all occassions.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en: Simion is married and blessed with two children. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been running a mechanic business for the last five years to make a living. He has employed three people to help him manage the business. He also does farming to earn extra income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Simion is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.es: Jane tiene 28 años, es una mujer alegre, dinámica y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y su pequeño hijo, en una casa que es de su propiedad, se siente cómoda y a gusto por la familia que tiene. La actividad que realiza, es la venta de plátano, comercio que lo realiza en un pequeño puesto que tiene en el mercado municipal de su distrito. Es así que su actividad empieza desde muy temprano, para dirigirse al sector mayorista donde compra los plátanos en cantidad y a un menor precio. Tiene un año dedicándose a ésta actividad, y hasta el momento su pareja siempre lo ha apoyado en todo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el tener un ingreso económico, gracias a ello apoya en los gastos del hogar, por ello lo considera rentable este negocio. Su anhelo es ampliar su negocio y de esa manera podrá tener más ganancias. Este seria el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo que viene recibiendo de parte de ustdes y por tal espera contar nuevamente con su aporte. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en compra de plátanos en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old.  She’s a cheerful, dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives with her spouse and little boy in a house she owns.  She feels comfortable and at ease because of the family she has.  

Her activity is banana sales, a business she carries out in a small stand she has in the local municipal market.  Her activity starts very early when she heads out to the wholesale market to buy bananas in quantity and at a better price.  She’s been in business a year and to date her spouse has supported her in everything.  What she likes about her business is earning income thanks to which she’s able to cover household expenses and this is why she considers this business to be profitable.  Her wish is to expand the business to earn higher profits.

This will be her second MFP loan.  She feels happy with the support she’s been getting from you and hopes to count on it yet again.  She will use the amount requested to buy bananas in larger quantity.

loans.use: to buy bananas at wholesale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. She operates a piggery in her backyard and earns approximately 2,500 PHP for this work. Alma has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than a year.   

Alma is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs. In the future, she dreams of having savings for her child’s future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs

loans.name: Wekhonya Shg Group

texts.en:
Judith takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With income from maize sales, Judith will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing to save for future use.

Judith is the facilitator of the Wekhonya SHG group. The photograph shows Judith with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer. Judith and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Wekhonya SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Rashid.  He is married and has two children, aged 4 and 7 years, both of whom are in school. 

In 2001, Rashid established his artificial hair and jewelry business. He began his business because he wanted to develop a source of income to support his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Rashid has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy necklaces, bracelets and traditional jewelry. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 350,000. In the future, Rashid plans to establish his business in other cities, like Bo and Kono, build a house for his family, and educate his children well. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets, and traditional jewelry for his business.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children, aged 6 and 4. She sells prepaid mobile credit loads to her community. She has had this business for 5 years. Mary Joy earns about 3000 PHP per month with this business.

Mary Joy has requested a loan to purchase more prepaid load credits to sell. She hopes for her business to grow. Mary Joy also plans to start a sari-sari store business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid mobile load credits to sell

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Buenaventura; ella tiene 60 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa como chompas,pantalones,faldas y polos ella lleva a lugares como Quillabamba,Chumbivilcas y Pilcopata y lo vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia tambien vende choclo con queso en forma ambulatoria,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde vender la ropa . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos,blusas,pantalones y chompas y tambien para comprar choclos y quesos al por mayor. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en: The member is Sra. Buenaventura. She is 60 years old and is a native of Iscuchaka. She is a single mother and has one son. She continues to work in her business of selling sweaters, pants, skirts and shirts. She sells her clothing in Quillabamba,Chumbivilcas y Pilcopata and sells by traveling by foot. She also sells corn with cheese, selling by foot. It is by these small businesses that the member can help her son get ahead. It is her dream to have a location to sell clothing from. She is requesting this loan to but shirts, blouses, pants and sweaters and also to buy corn and cheese at wholesale. She values and is infinitely thankful for the loan granted, since it will permit her to increase her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time, she promises to make her payments on the stipulated dates.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants and sweaters and also to buy corn and cheese at wholesale.

loans.name: Sulduz

texts.ru: Sulduz yavlyayetsya uchitelem nacionalnix muzikalnix instrumentov uje 7 let. On uchit v osnovnom detey malix vozrastov. Sulduz 40 let , on jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotorix toje nauchil ispolnat na nacionalnix instrumentax. Sulduz jivet v Baku regione vmeste so sovyey jenoy i detmi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nacionalniye instrumenti "Tar" ,"Kamancha" chtobi uchit detey muzike.
texts.en: Sulduz has been a national musical instruments teacher for seven years.  He mainly teaches young children.  Sulduz is 40 years old, married and has two children, whom he also taught to perform with national instruments.  Sulduz lives in the Baku region together with his wife and children.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to purchase national instruments, such as "Tar" and "Kamancha," in order to teach music to children.

loans.use: to purchase national instruments

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 54-year-old man. He has 6 children. He operates a rental house business where he rents houses to clients. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a location with plenty of customers and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that when it rains, water fills their rooms. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to put up more houses for rent. He will use the anticipated profits to put up more rooms. 

This is the client's third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to put up more houses for rent

loans.name: Zilfaou's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Zilfaou(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans. Zilfaou est mariée à un certain Adamou. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés et deux sont à leur charge. Zilfaou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Zilfaou a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Zilfaou mène comme activité la vente de foulards et des condiments par le système de distribution. Zilfaou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Zilfaou sollicite, ensemble avec son second membre, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des foulards et des condiments.

loans.name: Jlg-016-Thanneerpalli Group

texts.en:
Kumudha has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. She works hard to support her family, and saves diligently. However, her meager income is not adequate for her family to access basic necessities like a toilet in their home.

Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, the family member are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in her family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Seeking to improve their situation, her group seeks a loan of INR 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these 3 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in her home by constructing a toilet.

loans.name: Elias Antonio

texts.en:
My name is Elias Antonio. My wife and I have worked grinding corn for eight years. This business has allowed me to support our family and put our kids through school. At the moment we need to replace some of the parts of the machinery for our business so we can continue giving our clients good service.

Mi Nombre es Elias Antonio, cuento con un molino de moler maiz, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo 8 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio en el que me colabora mi esposa, este negocio los genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, y gastos de educacion de mis hijos, pero actualmente nesecitamos cambiar algunas piezas para un mejor funcionamiento del mismo y poder dar un mejor servicio a nuestros cliente.

loans.use: compra de platos, banda y Motor  de molino para moler maíz

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Madame Vida sells wakye, a local meal prepared from a special rice and beans and served with stew. She buys her rice and beans direct from the producers in bags. A lot of people enjoy her meals and she has a large number of people who buy from her. She wants to open a mini-restaurant where she can add other local dishes to her meals. She is seeking a loan of $800 from Kiva to help her realise this dream.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is 41 years old, and is married with four (4) children. She has been a LAPO client for over 8 years. She sells kerosene to her public, and she lives in Benin City. She wishes the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sales

loans.name: Brigith Antonia

texts.es:
Brigith Antonia, 33, lives in a rented apartment with a signed lease and deposit. She lives with her husband and children in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. Her husband is an artisan, making rag dolls and earrings. His income is very small, which is why she, with the help of a loan from Kiva partner IMPRO last December, started a business selling plastic goods, such as containers, etc. Currently the business is going very well, and she has repaid the first loan in full in a span of only six months. The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her stock and give her clients a wider product selection. IMPRO describes her as an excellent client with a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Brigith Antonia vive en anticretico(una forma especial de alquilar o rentar una casa o departamento por un periodo de dos años; al principio del contrato anticretico se define el monto a cancelar y el mismo se cancela por anticipado, y al fin de los dos años, el dueño de casa, o sea el landlord, debe devolver la totalidad del monto menos gastos para arreglar la casa o departamento para un siguiente contrato). Ella vive con su esposo e hijos en la calle Caupolican de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Brigith Antonia tiene 33 años de edad, el esposo es artesano y elabora muñecas de trapo, aretes de fantasía y su ingreso es muy pequeño, por lo cual ella con el apoyo de Impro, que le desembolso el primer crédito en Diciembre del año pasado para capital de arranque, pudo comenzar un negocio dedicado a la venta de plásticos, como ser bañadores, containers, etc. Actualmente el negocio va muy bien, así que el primer crédito ha sido cancelado en su totalidad, pues era solamente a seis meses plazo. El crédito que ahora solicita es para aumentar mercadería y poder seguir sirviendo a sus clientes con mejor variedad de productos. IMPRO califica a este cliente como excelente y con buen record de pagos.

loans.use: Increase stock and provide customers with a wider selection of plastic goods

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Ry is divorced with 2 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1987 and started her silk production business then. Now her eldest daughter also weaves silk at home. She was able to do this with her first loan from MAXIMA, which enabled Mrs Ry to buy a loom for her daughter to use.
