She has now taken out 5 loans from MAXIMA to date. She is currently requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material and sewing thread, as well as pay fees for selecting, embroidering and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and embroidering and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.name: Santiqie

texts.en: Santiqie sells clothes in Kabala town, and is 26 years old and married with one child.  He started his business when he was 15 years old but it was destroyed during the civil war.  With a small loan from a friend, he started the business again four years ago, and has expanded it to the current level with several small loans from SMT.  As a young man whose aim is to build a happy family, he is seriously determined to expand his business.  For this purpose he is requesting a loan of $275.

loans.use: Expand his business to take care of his family.

loans.name: Aay

texts.en: Aay is 31 years old, and a mother of a 9 year old son. She sells some vegetables and usually earns $6 per day. Her husband, E., works at a barber shop and earns $18 income per day. She is requesting a $50 loan to expand her and her husband's business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is 48 years old, separated, and lives in Santani with her 3 children; 2 are adults and one is school age.

For 11 years, she has been working selling clothing for women and children, in the streets of Santani. Because of her hard work and dedication, she now has a well-established clientele.

Her hard work allowed her to achieve on of her most satisfying goals, owning her own home where she lives with her children.

Now she has a set goal, because she has worked in the streets for years, under harsh weather and in unfavorable physical conditions, she wants to build a store in her home. There she will sell to the public, maintaining her current activity of selling clothing, and adding a new one, selling grocery items.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Antonia es una mujer separada de 48 años, vive en Santani con sus 3 hijos; 2 son mayores de edad y 1 esta en edad escolar.

Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y niños, en forma ambulante en toda la zona de Santani, debido a su trabajado y dedicación hoy cuenta con una muy buena clientela formada.

Su gran esfuerzo la llevo a uno de los logros mas satisfactorios, el tener su casa propia donde vive con sus hijos.

Ahora tiene un objetivo trazado, ya son años de andar por las calles bajo condiciones climáticas o físicas no siempre favorables, por ello, en su casa quiere construir un salón comercial de venta al publico, manteniendo su actual rubro de venta de Prendas de Vestir y además agragarle el rubro de Despensa.

Con el crédito desea adquirir mercaderías tales como: pantalones, faldas, remeras, camisas, accesorios para damas.

loans.use: Buying pants, skirts, shirts, and accessories for women (Compra de pantalones, faldas, remeras, camisas, accesorios para damas.)

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es:
Gloria began her business with a small investment of $500 cordobas that she had saved up herself. She is a single mother of a son who is in school. 38 long years have passed since she began working in this business in the Santa Ana market in Chinandega in beautiful Nicaragua.

With much effort, sacrifice, and the goal of improving day-by-day the quality of life of her son, she has obtained 30 loans from Ceprodel over the past 5 years. These loans have contributed to the increase of her inventory and variety of seafood products, improving the conditions of her stand, and as a result, have allowed her son to attend grammar school. Gloria has the goal, with the financial help of Ceprodel, to fulfill her biggest dream - that her son will become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Gloria inicia su negocio con un pequeño capital propio de C$ 500 córdobas, producto del ahorro propio ya que es soltera y madre de un hijo en edad escolar. Ya han transcurrido 38 largos años desde que inicia esta actividad en el mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad de Chinandega de la bella Nicaragua.

Con esfuerzo, sacrificio y la meta de mejorar día a día la calidad de vida de su hijo ha obtenido créditos en CEPRODEL desde hace 5 años, durante los cuales ha administrado 30 créditos los que han contribuido en el incremento de su inventario, variedad de productos en mariscos, mejores condiciones en su local, y por ende, permite que su hijo estudie la primaria. Gloria tiene como propósito seguir con el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL para que realice su mayor sueño que es ver a su hijo ser un profesional.

loans.use: Purchase of Seafood

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S., 54, is a widow with five children who works braiding cotton scarves. She normally makes on average $1.50 a day. Two of her daughters work in Phnom Penh as garment workers, earning a salary of $60 each a month. To supplement the household income, she wants to breed pigs and resell them, and to run that business she is requesting a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To breed pigs.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Mrs. Duch C., age 47, and her husband (pictured here) own a plot of farmland and grow rice. They earn approximately $3 a day. This couple has five children; one of them is employed as a garment worker and has a salary of $70 a month. Other children stay at home and help them grow rice.

To increase the family’s income and reduce expenses, this couple requests a loan to purchase a grinding mill that takes the husks off the rice. They will hire the local people to run the machine. They will have more rice to sell, which will provide more income to sustain the family.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is married and has one child, age 12. Neema is a second-hand clothing seller; she started her own business in 2003. Every day, she works from 6 am to 5 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$150 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for a sales business

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva has always had a tendency to have more than one job. And so she equipped a small space in her cellar for use as a beauty parlor. Her good work in both occupations has earned her a lot of popularity and her premises are frequented daily by members of her community. She wishes to continue with this work and has decided to renovate her small space so that she can provide more comfort to her clients.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Elva, siempre ha tenido la tendencia de ocuparse en más de un oficio. Por esa razón en el pequeño espacio de su bodega acondicionó un módulo para desempeñarse también como cosmetóloga. Su buen trabajo en ambos oficios le ha otorgado popularidad y su local es muy visitado por los miembros de su comunidad a diario.Desea continuar con su labor y ha decidido implementar sus pequeños espacios para acoger con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To renovate her small working premises.

loans.name: Nilda Consuelo

texts.es:
Nilda Consuelo R. S. is a member of the "Virgen de la Inmaculada" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin province, district of Tarapoto. Her dressmaking workshop is located within her own home on Jiron 9 de Abril 298, in the same district.

When she separated from her husband and with the urgency to take care of her 5 children and be near them, she started up her dressmaking workshop, thanks to the support of her mother-in-law, who helped her at all times.

With a loan for 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will buy threads in various colors, different types of materials, supplies such as elastic, doilies, embroidered ribbon, good quality bias tape in different designs and other things she needs so she can satisfy her customers.

Nilda is 55 years old and lives with one of her daughters, who is her motiviation to keep going. She is a woman who has learned to make her own decisions and to be self confident. In the future she would like to install some higher grade sewing machines in her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nilda Consuelo R. S. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen De La Inmaculada”, vive en de San Martín y Distrito de Tarapoto, su taller de costura esta ubicado en su propia casa ubicado en el Jr: 9 de Abril Nº 298 del mismo distrito.

Al separarse de su esposo y el afán de sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos y estar cerca de ellos decidió instalar su taller de costura gracias al apoyo brindado por su suegra quien en todo momento lo apoyó

Con el préstamo adquirido de S/. 1,000.00 que será pagado en 6 cuotas mensuales, comprará hilos de colores variados, diferentes tipos telas, materiales como: elásticos, blondas, cinta bordada, sesgos en variados diseños y de buena calidad y tener todo lo necesario para satisfacer a su clientela.

La señora Nilda tiene 55 años, vive con una de sus hijas, quien es su principal motor para seguir adelante, ella es una mujer que ha aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones segura de si misma, desea mas adelante implementar su taller con maquinas de alta costura.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of thread and materals.

loans.name: Thi Nguyen's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. P. Thi N., born in 1951, wants to borrow 4,876,000VND (equivalent to 295USD) to sell food at the market. Her husband passed away, leaving her with their young children at Luc Canh hamlet, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh province, Hanoi. With the average monthly income of 1,500,000VND (equivalent to 95USD), Ms. N. is still having a hard time to make ends meet and provide schooling for her children. She would like to take this loan from SEDA (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to invest in her business and improve her current condition. Her group of borrowers includes:

L. Thi Thu, born in 1966, would like to borrow 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 217USD) to raise pigs.

N. Kim Hoa, born in 1967, would like to borrow 3,596,000 VND (equivalent to 217USD) to raise chicken.

D. Thi Hop, born in 1970, would like to borrow 3,596,000 VND (equivalent to 217USD) to sell clothes at the market.

H. Thi Lan, born in 1969, would like to borrow 1,060,000 VND (equivalent to 65USD) to buy some cows.

C. Thi Minh, born in 1967, would like to borrow 3,596,000 VND (equivalent to 217USD) to sell vegetabL. at the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Phạm Thị Nguyên, sinh năm 1951(Ms 23010063), mức vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đi chợ bán đồ ăn. Chồng cô đã mất, hiện cô đang sống cùng các cháu tại thôn Lực Canh, Xuân Canh, Đông Anh, Hà Nội. Với thu nhập bình quân khoảng 1.500.000 vnđ / tháng, cộng với việc nuôi các cháu ăn học, kinh tế gia đình cô còn eo hẹp. Cô mong muốn được vay vốn phát triển kinh tế để cải thiện mức sống hiện tại. Nhóm vay vốn D. cô làm nhóm trưởng gồm có: Lê Thị Thư, sinh năm 1966 (Ms 23010059), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Nguyễn Kim Hoa, sinh năm 1967 (Ms 23010058 ), mức vay: 3.596.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Đỗ Thị Hợp, sinh năm 1970 (Ms 23010065), mức vay: 3.596.000 vnđ để đi chợ bán hàng quần áo. Hoàng Thị Lan, sinh năm 1969 (Ms 23010060), mức vay: 1.060.000 vnđ để mua bò. C. Thị Minh, sinh năm 1967 (Ms 23010064), mức vay: 3.596.000 vnđ để đi chợ rau.

loans.use: breeding animals

loans.name: Haydee  Luz

texts.es:
Here is Haydee's fist Kiva loan

Haydee is a member of the communal bank "Bonanza".

Haydee is 42 years old and lives with her life partner and 2 children. She makes beautiful weaved products such as tapestries, rugs, and cushions. Her work is characterized by its originality and by the quality of her work. Her workshop is in her home. She has various looms but right now she works with 2 looms; she has two operators who run them. She also contracts work out to two other weavers. She sells all of her products in Ecuador, where she travels every 2 months, more or less, depending on the demand for her products. In Ecuador she buys bedspreads, sheets and coffee, all of which she then sells in Ayacucho to her friends and relations. Haydee also sells ceviche ( a cold seafood dish) during the day on Sundays, from a special place she has fitted out in her home.

Haydee needs a loan of 1050 soles which she will invest in the purchase of bedspreads and sheets.

Haydee dreams of supporting her children so that they go on to become professionals, opening a hardware store and having a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Primer préstamo

Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Haydee es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Haydee hace bellos tejidos en telar como tapices, alfombras, cojines, sus trabajos se caracterizan por ser originales y de buen acabado, el taller esta en su casa, tiene varios telares pero actualmente trabajan dos telares para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de dos operarios, y también contrata a otros tejedores, todos sus productos lo vende en el país de Ecuador a donde viaja cada 2 meses o dependiendo de la demanda de sus productos y de Ecuador compra colchas, sabanas, café, productos que vende en Ayacucho a sus amigos, familiares. Además Haydee vende cebiche los días domingos, sus ventas lo realiza en su casa para lo cual adapto un ambiente.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de colchas, sabanas.

Los sueños de Haydee son apoyar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, implementar una ferretería y tener un negocio estable.

loans.use: Haydee needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian soles (375 USD) which she will invest in the purchase of bedspreads and sheets.

loans.name: Tukae's Tushirikiane Group

texts.en:
Tukae, 30 years old and married, has owned a general store since 2001. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from sales.

Tukae now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses in clothes and cosmetics sales, vegetables sales, cassava sales and shop ownership.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Tempora Doris

texts.es:
La señora Témpora Doris tiene 38 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Hilos de Plata y vive en la Mz 25 lote 2 Víctor Raúl - sector Manuel Arévalo, distrito de Huanchaco.
Estudió solamente Primaria completa, pero no continuó porque no tuvo apoyo de sus padres. Se casó aun siendo una niña de trece años y tuvo su primer hija a los 19 años, actualmente tiene 4 hijos, los cuatro estudiantes.
Empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos de belleza, pero no ganaba lo que esperaba, así que cambió de negocio, comenzó a vender fruta en forma ambulatoria, ahora tiene un puesto ambulante fuera del mercado Acomar y vende fruta y verdura.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró un saco de papa, verdura y fruta.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará  yuca, lechuga, alverja y frejol.
Doris sueña con ver profesionales a sus hijos y tener un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Témpora Doris is 38 years old and belongs to the Silve Thread Bank. She lives at la Mz 25 lot 2 of Victor Raúl, sector Manuel Arévalo, in the district of Huanchaco. Témpora completed her formal education through elementary school, but did not continue because she did not have her parents' support. She married while she was still a 13 year-old girl and had her first child at age 19. She currently has 4 children, who are all school-aged. She began selling beauty products, but did not earn as much as she had hoped, so she shifted her business, and began working as a traveling fruit saleswoman. Témpora now has mobile booth outside the Acomar Market, and sells fruits and vegetables. With the first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, Témpora purchased potatoes, fruits and vegetables. With this 300 soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase yuca, lettuce, peas, and beans. Témpora dreams of watching her children grow up to be professionals, and having success in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase yuca, lettuce, peas, and beans

loans.name: Homira

texts.en:
Homira she is uneducated and single and lives with her own family. She makes brocade at her home and sells it in bazaar to shopkeepers. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years since the Taliban regime. She took her first loan to buy some necessary materials and continue her business, but now but she wants to make her business stronger.

So she requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghans for the term of 10 months to buy one or two machines for making brocade to make a better income for her family and a better future for herself.

She is very happy with this loan and she would like to thank lenders around the world. She wants to thank Kiva and AFSG for this successful loan process in Afghanistan she wants to continue her partnership to make life easier in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy one or two sewing machines

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys I. owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods, drinks and pure water. Her husband is a fuel attendant. Gladys is 37 years old and married with seven children. Her husband works in a gas station. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks, pure water, and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and pure water.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, específicamente en el Mercado La Estación, la señora María A. se desempeña en su negocio de elaboración y venta de refrescos naturales preparados por ella misma. También se ha destacado por vender gaseosas, jugos enlatados y agua helada. Es importante también destacar que ella vende ropa pero en menores cantidades.

Hoy en día, ella tiene la necesidad urgente de adquirir las frutas para elaborar los refrescos y también de comprar los jugos y gaseosas. Para ello ha realizado una solicitud en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un préstamo con el cual, al adquirirlo realizará dichas compras y luego ofrecerá estos productos en su establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
At La Estación market in the city of León, María A. sells natural beverages, which she makes herself. She is also know for selling carbonated drinks, canned juice, and iced water. It is important to note that she sells clothing in small quantities. At present, María has an urgent need to obtain fruit for making the drinks and to also buy juices and carbonated drinks. To do so she has applied to Ceprodel for a loan to make those purchases, which she will then offer for sale in her shop at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making beverages

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Carmela es casada, tiene 78 años y 6 hijos, Carmela vive en el distrito D. Chiara en donD. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, además Carmela se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno lechero, los quesos y leche lo venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Carmela necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Los sueños D. Carmela son tener mas ganado, ampliar su establo y darles todo lo mejora a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Llamkasum communal bank, which works in the Quechua language. Carmela is married, 78 years old and has 6 children. Carmela lives in the Chiara districet where she has a grocery store. In addition, Carmela works raising cows and sells their milk and cheese in the Ayacucho. Carmela needs a loan of 1500 Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and noodles. Carmela's dreams are to have more cattle, expand her barn and improve the lives of her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Genoveva tiene 49 años esta casada con el señor Sixto Zarate tienen 8 hijos 7 estan casados y trabajan y el menor estudia en el colegio.
Anteriormente la señora trabajaba en un taller de costura con el tiempo y experiencia adquirida abrió para su propio taller de costura. Empezó con una sola maquina y ahora pose cuatro.
Su marido se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.
Quiere ampliar su taller comprando más maquinas de coser y contar con algunos empleados para poder de esa forma dar tambien empleo.
El préstamo que solicitó fue invertido en la compra de una maquina de coser, hilos y telas.-
texts.en:
Genoveva is 49 years old and is married to Sixto Zarate. They have eight children, seven of whom are married and working, and the youngest is in school. Genoveva used to work at a sewing shop, and with the time and experience she acquired you opened up her own shop. She started with a single machine and now has four. Her husband makes a living buying and selling livestock. She wants to expand her shop, purchasing more sewing machines and hiring some employees. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a sewing machine, fabrics and thread.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine, fabrics and thread

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina  es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador.
Clementina es viuda, tiene 73 años, nueve hijos  mayores que están casados. 
Clementina  siempre trabajo en un mercado vendiendo frutas, hasta que dejo  ese trabajo. Después de un buen tiempo decidió  vender golosinas en su casa, su negocio fue creciendo ahora tiene su tienda de  abarrotes una de sus hijas le ayuda, A la edad  que tiene de Clementina  trabajar  por que  sé  distrae.
Clementina necesita un crédito de 800 soles, para compra mercadería, arroz fideos, aceite, detergente.
Desde que esta en Finca los prestamos le son de mucha ayuda para compra la mercadería que cada mes necesita.
El sueño de Clementina es trabajar para que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of Bancomunal Sembrador. Clementina is a widow, is 73 years old, and has nine children who are married. Clementine had always worked in a market selling fruit, until she left her job. After a while, she decided to sell candy in her home. Her business has been growing, and she now has a grocery store which one of her daughters helps out with. At Clementina’s age, she works to keep herself entertained and occupied. Clementina needs a credit of $275 to buy goods, rice noodles, oil, and detergent. Since she has been with Finca, the loans have been very helpful to purchase the merchandise that she needs every month. Clementina's dream is to work for her business to grow more.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, rice noodles, oil, and detergent

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 45 años, es una madre de familia muy preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijos, vive en la casa que consiguió con mucho sacrificio y que cuida con mucho esmero, ya que sabe que algún día se la dejará a sus hijos. Para Irma la venta de licores es un negocio muy rentable, ya que su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca) y debido al gran movimiento comercial siempre vende mucho, ella es una persona muy alegre y siempre realiza sus ventas con una sonrisa bien grande. Lleva 20 años en el negocio y lo más difícil de su trabajo es comprar los licores, ya que existen muchas bebidas falsificadas y tiene que saber diferenciarlas. Para el futuro Irma desea tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender de todo y no solo limitarse a los licores, lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes, ya que mediante ellos se puede enterar de muchas cosas que suceden mientras está en su puesto. Este es el segundo préstamo al que accede con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su primer ciclo y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre les da consejos a las demás socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados implementará mejor su tienda, comprará más licores y les ofrecerá una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma is 45 years old and is a mother concerned for the well-being of her children. She lives in a house she acquired through much sacrifice and that she takes great care of, as she knows that some day she will leave it to her children. For Irma, the sale of alcohol is a very profitable business. Her stand is located in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in Juliaca) and because of high traffic she always sells a lot. She is a very cheerful person and always makes her sales with a hugh smile. She has been in business for 20 years and what is the most difficult is purchasing the alcohol as there are many falsified products and you have to know how to tell the difference. In the future Irma would like to have a larger store where she can sell many goods and not just limit it to alcohol. What she likes most it talking with her customers, because them she finds out from them what is happening while she is at work. This is her second loan with MPF. She was very punctual repaying her first loan and hopes to be punctual now as well. At her communal bank she is very happy and always giving advice to the other members. With the 2,000 soles requested she will stock her store, buy more products and offer a better variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
S. Mukhtor lives in Khujand, a town in Northern Tajikistan. He is 44 years old and married with four children. Mukhtor is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising then selling cows and sheep at the local market. His wife (pictured) helps him with the business.

Once every two or three months he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over an eight- or nine-month period and later sells the adult cows and sheep to local butchers. Today Mukhtor is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle. That’s why he is requesting a loan of $1,000 for the term of nine months. Extend your solidarity to Mukhtor so that he can move forward successfully and accomplish all his goals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Novignon

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier d’attiegou au centre de la ville de Lomé. Elle vend de l’eau en sachet « voltic » et du jus non loin du marché local d’akodessewa, son congélateur est en panne, ce qui a ralenti considérablement son activité. Voulant reprendre son activité, elle s’adresse à WAGES et sollicite un crédit pour acheter 01 congélateur, 03 sacs de sucres  et 40 sachets d’eau en sachet « VOLTIC »
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Attiegou neighborhood in the center of the town of Lomé. She sells « Voltic » brand water in bags and juice, not far from the local market of Akodessewa. Her freezer has broken down, which has considerably slowed down her sales. Wishing to get her business back to running well, she has come to WAGES and is asking for a loan to buy a freezer, 3 sacks of sugar, and 40 sacks of « Voltic » water.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a freezer, sugar, and sacks of drinking water

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is 31 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mhammad owns a mobile phone shop. Mhammad requests a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase mobile phones and phone accessories. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan.
Mhammad is respected because he does the job well and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhammad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business and hopes to start a new business selling cars.

loans.use: Mhammad will use the loan to purchase mobile phone and phone accessories.

loans.name: Martha Adilia

texts.es: Martha Adilia es casada, tiene tres hijos: el mayor tiene 17 años esta estudiando su 1er año en la universidad Martin Lutero, otro de 13 años estudia 4to año en el instituto Ruben Dario y la niña menor de 9 añitos de edad estudia su 2do grado de educacion primaria, su esposo es Ebanista y tiene su propio negocio en su casa; doña Martha esta  solicitando su 5to credito a AFODENIC para construir una habitacion de concreto para que su hijo mayor tenga privacidad,   ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable con buenas relaciones en la comunidad, todos los dias al regresar de impartir sus clases ayuda a su marido a trabajar en el taller que estos poseen, ademas expresa que se siente satisfecha con el servicio brindado de la institución, pues ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida familiar y han logrado  mejorar su casa, sueña con tener una casa bonita y grande con las condiciones necesarias para que sus todos sus hijos se sientan comodos.
texts.en:
Martha Afilia is married and has three children. Martin Lutero is the oldest. He is 17, and he is in his first year at the university. Another child is 13 and is in his fourth year at the Ruben Dario Institute. The youngest is 9, and she is in second grade. Ebanista is her husband, and he has his own business in their house. Martha is asking for her fifth loan with Afodenic in order to build a bedroom so that her oldest son can have privacy. She is a hard working, responsible woman who has good relationships within the community. Every day, after giving her classes, she helps her husband work in the shop that they have. She feels satisfied with the service the institution offers. Her family’s living conditions have improved, and they have improved their house. She dreams of having a beautiful, large house with the necessary living conditions so that all of her children feel comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la vente de la friture, beaucoup de gens viennent acheter chez elle surtout les soirs. Les entrants dans la préparation de ses fritures sont épuisés, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 bidon d’huile, 10 cartons de poissons et divers.
 Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, c’est avec le revenu qu’elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a woman who sells fried foods. Many people come and buy from her, especially in the evenings. The ingredients for making her product are out of stock. She wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 10 drums of cooking oil, 10 boxes of fish, and various other items. She is married and the mother of four. With the revenues, she helps to support her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, fish, and various items

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is divorced and has 9 dependants. She has received schooling through senior high school. Monica sells meat at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Monica uses her income to pay fees and utility bills. Monica will use the loan to buy more meat for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to help educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more meat for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La señora Silvia S. es propietaria de una panadería en el departamento de Chinandega. A diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana da lugar a la elaboración y venta de pan en su establecimiento elaborando todo tipo de pan como pan simple, dulce, galletas, reposterías y otros derivados.

Con el propósito de elaborar todos estos productos ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y así comprar la materia prima para continuar elaborando el delicioso pan para la venta en su panadería en el departamento de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia S. is the owner of a bakery in the Chinandega department. Every day, early in the morning she makes and sells all types of breads from her shop - white bread, sweet bread, cookies, pastries, and other variations. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy the ingredients for making and selling this delicious bread in her bakery in the Chinandega department.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice R. is from the village of Puntod. She is 31 years old. Janice is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Janice owns a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Janice has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Janice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be Janice's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Ffitig

texts.en: Ffitig J. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials. Ffitig is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has one child and her child does not yet go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter un séchoir

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” ubicado en el centro poblado de Corazón Pampuyo del distrito Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos, vive en Ticaraya, ella estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado porcino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado vacuno para engorde, luego lo vende en las ferias zonales,

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y agrandar su negocio.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Cecilia is a member of the Community Bank “Corazón Pampuyo” located in the population center of Corazón Pampuyo in the district of Pomata, Province of Chucuito and department of Puno. She is 40 years old. She’s in a civil marriage and has six children. She lives in Ticaraya. She did not complete her primary education (2nd grade). She has been working with el Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She began her loan with the amount of $100 (300 PEN), which allowed her to increase her capital for her business of buying and selling pigs. Now, she requires a new loan of $900 (2500 PEN), which will allow her to buy cattle to fatten. Later she will sell them at markets in her area. Her biggest desire is to continue working and increase her business. She enjoys meetings and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es una madre de familia muy amorosa, tiene 43 años y vive en su casa propia junto a su único hijo, Elvis de 9 años, y lo que más desea es darle una buena educación.

En la localidad de Jasana Capallino (comunidad del distrito de Huancané), se encuentra el negocio de Teofila, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se preocuparon por darle una actividad con la cual defenderse en el futuro. Su ganado lo lleva a vender a la feria de Huancané, donde son muy solicitados por lo bien cuidados y alimentados que están.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastear a sus animales, ya que disfruta mucho del aire libre, lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar su ganado hasta las ferias dominicales donde lo vende. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera incrementar la cantidad de ganado que tiene actualmente, para así mejor sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Teofila con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más cumplidas y puntuales. Con los 2000 soles solicitados comprará una ternerita lechera, la cual le costará aproximadamente 3500 soles, para ello completará el monto con dinero de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Teofila is the mother of a very loving family. She is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her only son, Elvis, who is 9 years old, and what she wants most is to give him a good education. In the village of Jasana Capallino (a community in the district of Huancané), you can find Teofila's business. She raises cattle, which is a trade that she learned from her parents who always made sure she knew how to support herself. She sells her cattle at the Huancane fair, where they are in high demand because of how well they are cared for and fed. What she likes best about her job is to let the animals graze, as she enjoys the outdoors. With 20 years in this trade, she believes that the most difficult part is to deliver her cattle to the Sunday fairs where they sell. For the future of her business, she hopes to increase the quantity of her stock so that can increase her earnings. This is the second loan for Teofila with MFP, and she is willing to pay all her dues on time. At her community bank, she is one of the most accomplished members and is punctual. With the 2,000 requested soles, she will purchase a dairy calf, which will cost approximately 3,500 soles. She will add the loan amount to her savings in order to accomplish this.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf for raising and sale

loans.name: Ream

texts.en: S., 48, is a local banana trader who has been doing this business for eight years. S. always leaves from her home to buy bananas in bulk from planters and retails them to make her income. Her husband is a cook who is hired by people to cook meals for their parties.  S. has five teenage children. One of her sons works cooking food and the other four are dependent on her. Recently, S. ordered bananas on credit from her supplier and she doesn’t have enough money to pay her supplier. Thus, she would like a loan in order to pay the bill for the bananas.

loans.use: To pay for bananas to resell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont au nombre de huit femmes dont une célibataire et 7 mariées, majoritairement  dans des familles polygames. Elles ont  en moyenne  31 ans, 2 enfants et habitent dans  le quartier  Médine de la ville de Ségou  (4ème Région administrative  de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des activités de  commerce qu’elles mènent dans le même marché de Médine, à la même place de vente, habitent le même quartier et sont toutes membres d’une  association traditionnelle d’entraide.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les trois prêts précédents, elles sont à leur 4ème   de prêt  solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce prêt servira à acheter, 6 sacs de gros oignons frais, 18 seaux de pâte d’arachide, 6 grandes  boites de concentrée de tomate, 5kg de poivre, 4 paquets de divers cubes maggi, 30 paniers de poissons frais essentiellement constitués de silures, 24litres d’huile alimentaires,  4sacs de riz et 10 colis de calebasses. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  dans les différents marchés de Ségou, à la foire de Kolongo, et de Tona. La vente se fait généralement dans les marchés,  en ambulant dans les quartiers,   au comptant et  à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel  de 31.875FCFA  qui servira à rembourser les prêts, à acheter des fournitures scolaires, à payer les coopératives scolaires et à participer aux événements sociaux.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya are eight women, seven of whom are married and one of whom is single, and are for the majority in polygamous families. They are on average 31 years old and have two children. They live in the Médine area of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through a shared interest in retail activities that they each carry out in the same area of the Médine market and also live in the same area and are all members of a traditional association of mutual aid. After have correctly reimbursed the previous three loans, they are currently on their fourth group loan from Soro Yiriwaso. This loan enables them to purchase 6 bags of large, fresh onions, 18 buckets of ground nut paste, 6 large boxes of tomato concentrate, 5 kilos of pepper, 4 packets of diverse bouillon cubes of the brand name Maggi, 30 baskets of fresh fish [mostly brown bullhead fish], 24 liters of cooking oil, 4 bags of rice and 10 packages of calabash. They stock up in the various markets in Ségou and at the fairs in Kolongo and Tona. They generally re-sell the products in markets as well as traveling sales persons in neighborhoods to a clientele of both women and men. They hope to each make a monthly profit of 31,875 FCFA [approximately 73 USD] which would serve to pay back loans, to purchase education materials, to pay school co-operatives and to take part in social events.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of activities

loans.name: Sofa

texts.es:
Sofa es una mujer con muchas ganas D. salir adelante, tiene 63 años y vive con su esposo Maurelio, D. 52 años, y con sus tres hijos: Isaac D. 28, Andrea D. 25 y Nilda D. 19 años.

Ella es muy trabajadora, se dedica a la agricultura junto a toda su familia; siembran maíz, papa y olluco, los cuales comercializan (al por mayor) en diferentes zonas cercanas a donD. vive. También cría ganado vacuno y porcino con los que recibe ganancias adicionales, lo que le permite vivir tranquilamente, pues así ha logrado sacar adelante a los miembros D. su familia.
El trabajo en el campo no es nada fácil, se debe madrugar a diario y trabajar durante todo el día para tener una buena cosecha, los agricultores son personas fuertes, capaces D. soportar las inclemencias del tiempo para tener qué comer y así asegurar su subsistencia; esto lo sabe muy bien Sofa, ya que aprendió a sembrar y cosechar D. sus padres.
Para el futuro, quisiera sembrar mayor cantidad D. lo que en la actualidad, pues desea que sus hijos estudien en la ciudad y esto es un proyecto muy importante, ya que quiere que sean profesionales.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y asegura que será muy puntual con sus pagos porque sólo así logrará salir adelante. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras, ya que debe asegurarlas con todo lo necesario para que la producción futura sea muy provechosa.
texts.en:
Sofa is a woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She is 63 years old and lives with her husband Maurelio, age 52, and her three children: Isaac, 28; Andrea, 25; and Nilda, 19. She is very hard-working, and she works in agriculture together with her entire family. They grow corn, potatoes and olluco (a root vegetable), which they sell on a wholesale basis in various areas not far from their home. Sofa also raises cattle and pigs, from which she obtains additional profits. This allows her to live in tranquility, since she has been able to proviD. for the members of her family. Working on the farm is not at all easy; one must get up very early each day and work throughout the day in order to achieve a good harvest. Farmers are strong people, able to put up with bad weather in order to have enough to eat and to support themselves. This is something Sofa knows very well, since she learned how to plant and harvest from her parents. For the future, she would like to plant greater quantities of vegetables than she does now, since she would like her children to attend university in the city; this is very important for their plans, since they would like to be professionals. This is Sofa's third loan with MFP, and she assures us that she will be very punctual with her payments, because only by doing this will she be able to get ahead. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase compost and fertilizer for her fields, since she must supply them with everything necessary to ensure abundant production in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing compost and fertilizer

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. O. is 25 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a business lady.

David's business is located at Harambee-Kakamega where he engages in passenger transportation services as well as selling cereals to the local people. David is using this loan to buy cereals to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to buy more motorbikes and a matatu, and to open a store to supply to a bigger market. He is a God-fearing and determined person.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria P. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Victoria is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay H. is 33 years old and lives with another family member in Kompong Tom Province. To earn a living, Lay H. covered a hedge around a piece of her own land where she raises many ducks to produce eggs for a profit. Through this, she is able to collect a lot of eggs a day and sells them to retailers in the market.

Lay H. is married with three teenage children who are either studying or working. Her husband is a palm tree climber who taps palm juice and turns it into palm wine for sale. Beside their current work, the family also cultivates rice crops.

Lay H. is looking for a loan to purchase more ducks to breed. She has skinny cows and she will use any remainder of the loan to fatten her animals.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to breed.

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
Con mucha alegría, en el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Rosa L. se dedica a elaborar alimentos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Ella es experta en preparar el delicioso vigorón que contiene yuca, chicharrón y ensalada.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima como lo es la yuca, el chicharrón, el repollo y el tomate para continuar realizando este delicioso vigorón en su localidad.
texts.en:
Rosa L. cheerfully sells prepared meals to her customers in Managua's Mayoreo market. She is expert in preparing the delicious vigorón, a dish made with yucca, fried pork and salad. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients like: yucca, the pork , cabbage and tomatoes to continue to make this delicious vigorón in her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive junto a su padre y a su hermana en el caserío Chepito Alto, una zona rural del distrito de Morrope, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales de corral (chivos, patos y pavos). Jorge cría sus animales en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, luego los vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Este negocio le provee los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Jorge desea ampliar su corral, ya que sus animales han aumentado y el espacio con el que cuenta no es suficiente. Por ello está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utlizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Jorge es una persona conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, ellos lo consideran una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old, single, and does not have any dependent children. He lives with his father and sister in the village of Chepito Alto, a rural area in the Distirct of Morrope. This community is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past five years, Jorge has been raising and selling corralled animals (such as goats, ducks, and turkeys). He keeps his animals in a pen located behind his house and later sells them to merchants who pass through the area. This business provides the income necessary to cover his personal expenses and help support his family.

Jorge wants to expand his corral because the number of animals on hand has increased and there is not enough space. For this reason, he requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN so that he can meet his objective.

Jorge is a person who is known and respected by his neighbors. They consider him to be a responsible and hardworking person. His greatest wish is to offer his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand his corral

loans.name: Ayikoélé

texts.en:
Ayikoélé M., age 49, lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé, Togo, selling a variety of products. Specifically, she sells oil, corn, flour, rice, sugar, and homemade fritters. She began her business in 2005. 

She is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase two barrels of cooking oil, two sacks of flour, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, and other general products needed to meet her customers’ demands. 

Mrs. M. is married and has two children.

loans.use: To purchase oil, flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de dix  femmes (deux veuves et huit) mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Darabougou, village situé dans la Commune Rurale de Sakoïba (4ème Région Administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle d’entraide des femmes du village de Darabougou. 
Ces femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso et font le commerce d’articles divers. Certains membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des choux pommés, du beurre de karité, des calebasses et du henné.  
Madame Yama C. un des membres excelle dans la préparation et la vente des plats alimentaires tels les beignets de mil et les friandises de haricot.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50kg de petit mil, 10kg de haricot, 4litres d’huile, 1/2 paquet de levure, 3 kg de sucre et 2kg de sel iodé sur place et à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou. 
Pour faire les beignets de mil, elle le pile, le débarrasse du son, lave bien et prélève une partie qu’elle écrase qui servira de bouillie pour pétrir la farine obtenue après pilage. Elle ajoute du sel et du sucre et de la levure nécessaire pour le mélange. Cette bouillie est  frite à l’huile très tôt le matin pour obtenir les beignets de mil afin de servir de petit déjeuner. Le haricot, lui est transformé en farine, on y ajoute quelques pincées de sel avant de le battre fortement. Cette pâte obtenue est également frite les après midi. Madame Yama jouit d’une grande réputation due à la bonne qualité de ses friandises. 
Les membres du groupe vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes,  de femmes et d’enfants à domicile. 
Yama espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.   
NB: Alimata Traoré est absente de la photo (elle a accouché le jour même du financement).
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group ("Harmony") is composed of ten women (two widowed and eight married). Most of them live in large traditional families and, on average, are 43 years old and have four children. They all live in Darabougou, a village located in the rural municipality of Sakoïba (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of kinship, marriage or neighborhood, or because they are members of the same traditional women's association for mutual aid in their village. This is the first solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso for the members of Benkadi Group. The women have various trading activities. A few of them buy and sell firm round cabbages, shea butter, calabashes and henna. One of the members is Mrs Yama C.. She excels in the preparation and sale of food dishes, such as millet fritters and bean tidbits. She will use her loan to buy 50 kilograms of small millet, 10 kilograms of beans, 4 liters of oil, half a package of yeast, 3 kilograms of sugar and 2 kilograms of iodized salt, in her village and at the weekly fair in Ségou. She explained to us how she prepares her dishes: Yama's recipe for millet fritters: Pound the millet, remove the bran and wash thoroughly. Take part of it and mash it. Add this pulp to the flour previously obtained through pounding and knead. Add salt, sugar and yeast to the mixture. Fry the pulp in oil. Do this early in the morning and serve for breakfast. Yama's recipe for bean tidbits: Transform the beans into flour. Add a few pinches of salt and stir vigorously. Fry the batter in oil. Ideally, do this in the afternoon. Mrs Yama enjoys a solid reputation thanks to the high quality of her tidbits. The group members sell from their homes, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of men, women and children. Yama expects to make a monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs which she will use to increase her working capital. NB: Alimata Traoré is not pictured. She gave birth to a baby on the very day of the loan disbursement.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a 35-year-old woman who is married and a mother of six children. She lives in Chembulet in Eldoret and she sells second-hand clothes for her daily income. She normally gets a monthly income of Kshs 5,000, having been in this business for five years now. Elizabeth also has a poultry business where she sells eggs to her customers some of whom are her neighbors and people from the neighboring villages.

Elizabeth is a Kadet client and she has applied for a loan which she will use to buy more clothes for resale and also buy poultry feed. 

She has dreams of getting into dairy farming and buying land on which she will build rental houses. This will be so that she can get more income and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Hotensiah

texts.en:
Hotensiah is 42 years old, married to Simon Ngugi, and has five children who go to school. She has a business selling clothes as she walks around Naivasha town.
Hotensiah was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. In the future, Hotensiah plans to sell her clothes from a permanent shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is an entrepreneur who runs a business selling socks, women’s lingerie, tops, shirts and other clothing at Albion Market in her home town of Uzhgorod. She has been in this business for fifteen years.

Ildika has loyal customers who come to buy from her because they trust the quality of her inventory and enjoy her friendly and respectful service. She earns about $635 of net profit each month.

Ildika has used micro loans in the past and found them very instrumental in her business. This time Ildika is requesting a loan of 18,300 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She would like to purchase additional clothing for the summer season so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Bekmurod

texts.en:
B. Bekmurod is a 36 year-old married man with 4 children. Bekmurod’s goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals.

Bekmurod is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Spitamen region in search of customers. At the same time he raises young cattle and sells them at the market with the help of his family.

He has owned his business for 10 years. His car needs thorough repair and for this purpose he wants to borrow 4000 TJS. With part of the loan he’ll purchase young cattle. Bekmurod sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing spare parts for his car and to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 18 Novembre 1979 à Sikasso, Monsieur S. est marié et père des deux enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Mamassoni, un des quartiers péripheriques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur S. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au commerce de matériels d’électricités il y a maintenant sept ans. Il y a maintenant deux ans qu’il dispose de sa propre Quincaillerie en face du Centre de Santé Tripano.  Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle (entreprises, particuliers etc)  pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec laquelle il a bénéficié de trois prêts individuels qui ont été  tous correctement remboursés. Il est à noter que  ce troisième prêt fut même  remboursé par anticipation. 
Ainsi ce quatrième prêt lui permettra d’acheter à Bamako, Bobo, Koumassi et Abidjan (respectivement au Mali, en Burkina Faso, au Ghana et en Côte d’Ivoire) 30 cartons de contacteurs, 40 cartons d’ampoules différentes, 15 rouleaux de fil différents, 45 paires de réglettes, 20 paquets de disjoncteurs, etc. 
 Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 320 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on November 18, 1979 in Sikasso, Mr. S. is a married man and the father of two children. He lives with his family in Mamassoni, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses unsuccessfully, he became introduced to commerce in electrical supplies and equipment seven years ago. For two years now, he has had his own hardware store located opposite the Tripano Health Center. He is much in demand by his customers (enterprises, individuals, etc.) for the quality of his products. To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where he has had three individual loans, which were all repaid properly. It should be noted that the third loan was even repaid in advance. This fourth loan will enable him to buy: 30 boxes of switches, 40 boxes of various bulbs, 15 spools of different wires, 45 pairs of strip lights, 20 packets of circuit breakers, etc., from Bamako, Bobo, Koumassi, and Abidjan (respectively in Mali, Burkina Faso, Ghana, and Cote d'Ivoire). With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 320,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the interest on the loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electrical supplies for his hardware store

loans.name: Kelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Kelly Rodríguez, una joven de 30 años que vive en el Municipio de Puerto Colombia tiene un restaurante llamado “Mi restaurante” que
necesita un credikiva para comprar víveres, algunos utensilios de cocina y adecuar su estufa a gas natural para no seguir cocinando con carbón vegetal. Este negocio empezó cuando ella y su esposo se encontraban desempleados y encontraron esta actividad como alternativa de ingreso, cuando un familiar los ayudó con los primeros  $500.000 COP. Su restaurante  ya tiene más de un año de estar funcionando y la acogida ha sido inmensa, porque sus almuerzos son preparados con la más rica sazón y una calidad inigualable.

Kelly ha recibido dos créditos a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su inversión ha sido muy positiva, porque le ha permitido fortalecer sus ingresos y remodelar poco a poco su vivienda.
Ahora sueña con poder remodelar su pequeño restaurante y volverlo un lugar cómodo y acogedor para que cada días más habitantes de Puerto Colombia sean sus clientes.
Su desafío principal es la competencia pues constantemente debe estarse preparando para afrontarla, porque son usuales los negocios de comidas en este sector que es un importante puerto turístico.
texts.en:
Kelly Rodríguez, a young 30-year-old lady who lives in the Municipio de Puerto Colombia, has a restaurant called "Mi restaurante", and she needs a loan from Kiva to buy supplies, kitchen utensils, and adapt her stove for natural gas so not to continue cooking with charcoal. This business began when she and her husband were out of work and found this activity as an alternative to obtain income as a relative helped them with the first $500.000 COP. Their restaurant has been working for a year and is very popular as the brunches are prepared with rich flavor and incomparable quality.

Kelly has received two loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and the investment has been very positive as they have allowed her to increase her income and remodel her dwelling little by little. Now she dreams of remodelling her small restaurant and make it comfortable and cozy in order to receive more clients from Puerto Colombia. Her main challenge is the competition, she must always be prepared to face it as food businesses are popular as this area is an important tourist harbour.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, kitchen utensils and adapt stove.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in Western Kenya. She has been operating her mixed farm for seven years and has employed one farmhand. Her farm produces sorghum, milk, maize, tea and beans, which she sells to the local market. She also operates a shop where she makes at least 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Jackline is 48 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 13 and 6. Two of the children are currently in school.

Jackline has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to expand her shop and improve the living standards of her family.

However, she however faces the challenges of poor weather conditions, the high cost of fertilizers, and diseases that affect her crops and animals.

In the future, she would like to expand her farm by purchasing more dairy cows. She says that if you are well prepared, then you can do a lot with the money from Juhudi.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane D. is from the city of San Jose, Santiago City. She is 35 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from vending snacks such as pancit (a noodle dish), sopas (a chicken dish), and other street food. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana P., 34, is married and has four children; her children do not go to school. Her husband is a business man. Diana is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and onions at the local market.

Diana is requesting a loan to stock groundnuts to make groundnut paste. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is 23 years old and is a divorced mother of two children. She has a mixed farm that produces maize and groundnuts which she sells at a local market. She has been farming for three years in Kitale town in western Kenya. She also runs a general shop in the same location.

Rose has requested this loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that the income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family in terms of education and health. Her biggest challenges are unpredictable weather conditions that affect production and competition.

In the future Rose plans to start a poultry farm with over 500 chickens and acquire three more dairy cows. She also hopes that Juhudi will not vanish like other MFI's.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Danny

texts.es: Danny tiene 21 años, es un hombre muy valiente y bueno vive con sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia ubicada en la selva del país (localidad de Cahuide). Todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para salir a cazar al monte cupte y samaño (animales salvajes oriundos del la selva del país) y por las tardes cuida sus cultivos de café que desde niño le enseñaron a cuidar y cultivar. Hace dos años que se compró un terreno propio en el que sembró café, solo falta un año más para que dé frutos, ya que tiene que cuidarlos durante tres años, tiempo suficiente para su maduración. Danny, desea sembrar café de calidad para poder exportar; y con la ayuda de una reconocida cooperativa de su ciudad podrá vender café, ya que su localidad es reconocida por la siembra de café natural. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y está seguro que con el apoyo de su banco comunal podrá salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono para café que tiene sembrando asimismo desea comprar semillas de plátanos.
texts.en:
Danny, age 21, is a brave and well-mannered man who lives with his parents and siblings in his own home in the town of Cahuide, located in the Peruvian jungle. Every morning he wakes up early to go hunting in the mountains of Cupte and Samaño (where wild animals native to the Peruvian jungle live). In the afternoons, he looks after his coffee crops that he learned to grow and care for as a young child. Two years ago, Danny bought his own land for growing coffee. It will be another year before his crops bear fruit because it takes three years for them to mature. Danny wants to grow quality coffee for export, and with the help of a well-known cooperative in the city, he will be able to sell his coffee. The area where he lives is known for growing natural coffee.

This is his second loan with MFP and he is confident that he will succeed with the support of his Communal Bank. With the loan he requested, Danny will invest in compost for his coffee crops. He also wants to buy banana seedlings.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for his coffee crop & acquire banana seedlings

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M. is from the village of Wigan Cordon. She is 56 years old. Rosa is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rosa owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mbande Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma V. is in her mid thirties. She is married and has one son. For the past two years she has been running her own pharmacy. The pharmacy is open between 7:30 am and 9:30 pm and earns Mwajuma a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mwajuma's 2nd motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Mwajuma used her first loan to increase her stock of medicine, a loan which she has successfully repaid. With her second loan, Mwajuma aims to once again increase her stock of medicine.

Mwajuma will share this loan will her loan group, Mbande, which totals 8 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Mwajuma is seen as the woman holding a baby.

loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Margie Dapal's Group

texts.en:
Margie D. is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Margie is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Margie D.’s Group.

To make a living, Margie owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Margie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first one taken out by Margie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He is the main income provider for his family. He has eight years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2007. He cultivates bananas and citrus fruit. He uses plastic tents to grow his produce. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year.
