He works independently in his business and he delivers his harvest with his van to local vegetable markets. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase needed supplies such as fertilizers for his agricultural work.

loans.use: purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean B. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and hair cutting businesses. She lives in Purok Linasgasan, Brgy Bato, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her food vending and hair cutting businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. Jean is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase raw materials for food vending. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP10,000 which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Jean aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her business

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mirtha es una madre dedicada a su familia, comerciante de ropa y cosmético con tres años en las ventas.
Ha sido muy trabajadora pues ha tenido que apoyar a sus hijos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre. Ha trabajado en varios trabajo de domestica, y fue con su liquidación que comienza a comprar productos de cosmético el cual se afilia a la empresa Avon, en donde sus productos son buenos y accesibles al bolsillo del cliente.
Para ofrecer más productos y obtener mejores resultado de ganancia busca una alternativa de financiamiento el cual lo hace a través de Afodenic. Lo que viene ah dar mejores resultado. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: una variedad de cosmético en cremas, pintura de labio, vanidad, perfume de dama y caballero, zapatos y sandalias. Siendo el 50 por ciento de encargo por catálogos.
texts.en: Mirtha is a mother dedicated to her family. She has sold clothing and makeup for over three years. She has been a very handworker since she has to take care of her children since she doesn’t have the support of the father. Mirtha worked in different housekeeping jobs and with her severance pay she bought makeup from Avon where the products are good and accessible for her customers. To be able to offer more products and have greater earnings, she looked for a financing alternative through Afodenic (Kiva’s field partner), which has given her greater results. With this new loan she will buy a variety of makeup in creams, lipstick, perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, shoes and sandals among other items. 50 percent of her sales are made through catalogues.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, shoes, sandals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jimmy; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de desarrollo de páginas web, el socio realiza diferentes páginas web para diferentes instituciones, el socio quiere seguir estudiando y mejorando para hacer las páginas web. El  socio solicita el préstamo para su uso personal.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the Virgen Guadalupe-Cusco Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. The member is Mr. Jimmy. He is 24 and single. He divides his daily activities with his business, which is developing websites. He makes different websites for different institutions. He wants to continue studying and improving to make web pages. He is requesting this loan for personal use. He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan for personal use.

loans.name: Karim

texts.ru: Холов Карим житель района Муминобод. Ему 48 лет. Он женат, имеет 8 детей. Жена работает уборщицей в средней школе. Сам Карим имеет высшее образование, агроном. По профессии работает 20 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Karim K. lives in the Muminobod Region. He is 48 years old. He is married, with eight children. His wife works as a janitor in a high school. Karim has a college degree: he is an agronomist. He has been working in his profession for 20 years. In addition, he raises livestock. He fattens cattle for later resale. He has been in this business for 10 years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Akjol's Group

texts.en: Combining studies with a job can be very challenging for some students. However, life conditions teach them to manage time properly and make it work. Akjol J. U., 20, is a member of this group. He is a resident of a small town, Kadamjai, which is known for the largest antimony (a brittle, metallic element) factory in the country. Akjol is a sophomore in a local university and works in a local retail market of foodstuffs. Life became complicated for Akjol two years ago when his mother, who initially used to run this business, fell ill with a strong disease. Her disease requires constant treatment and bed rest, so Akjol, being the only male in the family, took upon himself the responsibility for the financial stability of the family. Two years in business helped Akjol to learn gradually the best ways of increasing his sales. He orients on customers’ shifts in taste, price of the products and quality. The derived profit is spent on the basic needs of the family and payment for his tuition. The initial start-up capital was 20,000 soms; now it yields him 10,000 soms per month. Akjol is in hopes of getting the loan, because he would spend it on medical treatment for his mother. One of the major dreams of Akjol is to increase the entire capital to 100,000 soms and buy an automobile. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To pay for medical treatment

loans.name: Cathy

texts.es: Cathy es una joven madre de 24 años, ella una hija de 2 años y juntas conviven en casa de su tía. Hace más de 2 años que posee una tienda, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad, motivo por el cual sus clientes siempre acuden a su establecimiento, adicionalmente también ofrece prendas de vestir de acuerdo a la temporada del año, dejando la mercadería a crédito. Por otro lado vende animales, actividad que lo realiza los fines de semana y con la ayuda de su tía, afirma que le agrada trabajar en su negocio porque le permite tener tiempo para atender a su hija. Por ahora su meta es tener una tienda grande con más mercadería y más capital para su negocio. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en: Cathy is a young 24 year old woman. She has a 2 year old daughter and they live together in her aunt's house. She has had a store for more than 2 years where she sells basic necessities. Her customers always go to her establishment for them. She also offers clothing according to the season, selling the merchandise on credit. She also sells animals, an activity she does on weekends with her aunt's help. She affirms that she likes to work in her business because it gives her time to attend to her daughter. For now, her goal is to have a big store with more merchandise and more capital for her business. this is hr fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always shown her self to be responsible with the payments. She is also very happy to be a part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She is grateful to the people who will be lenders of the loan she is asking for because it will be very useful for her activity's progress. With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in buying more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To outfit her store with more products.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita V. is from the village of Bayabo, Tumuini, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Julita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Julita owns & operates a business raising raising ducks for sale. Julita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Julita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Julita is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Julita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia tiene 35 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de venta de artesanía ella vende todo los que son chompas de alpaca, polos, gorros, pantalones,guantes,chalinas entre otros más, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la ciudad en la calle procuradores de la plaza de armas de Cusco, la socia es una persona bien emprendedora, optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, a la vez la socia cuenta con su casita que está terminando de construir para luego alquilarlo y así tener un ingreso mas para su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una pequeña mercadería de artesanía y el resto para comprar algunas cositas que le faltan para terminar de construir su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Richary Runa Communal Bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Ms. Luz Marina is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling artisanal crafts. She sells alpaca wool sweaters, shirts, hats, pants, gloves, scarves, and other items. She has been in this business for a good number of years. Her business can be found in the city center, on Calle Procuradores near Cusco's Plaza de Armas. Luz Marina is a very entrepreneurial and optimistic woman with a great desire to move forward. She is currently finishing construction of a house that she will rent out in order to have an additional source of income for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy a little bit of merchandise for her store. She will use the rest to buy certain things she needs in order to finish building her house. 

Luz Marina is happy to receive this loan and she promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy a little bit of merchandise for her crafts store and to buy a few things she needs to finish building her house

loans.name: Luz Y Prosperidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana runs a small business of selling medicines and shoes. She has operated her walking store for over 2 years and her loans have allowed her to increase her business. She plans to use this loan to buy slippers, women's sport shoes and general medicines (headache, fever, pain and others).

She has successfully repaid her first loans and this will be her second one with Esperanza. Ana has three grown children and she is a widowed woman. She wants to continue to increase her business by investing her profits and saving.

Ana is the group coordinator of her group Luz y Prosperidad (Light and prosperity) 2. Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients (many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR). The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town.

loans.use: to buy shoes and medicine

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée à un professeur, Mme Afi est revendeuse de poissons  frais. Elle est mère de 03 enfants. Elle vend à toutes personnes depuis 2001. Elle revend au marché de Kégué  après avoir acheté  au Bénin. Mme Afi sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des poissons frais pour revendre à ses nombreux clients afin d’avoir de bénéfices pour  s’occuper de ses enfants et  aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi is married to a professor, and resells fresh fish. She's the mother of three children. She sells to anyone since 2001, at the market in Kégué. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Mrs. Afi is seeking this first loan to buy fresh fish to resell to her numerous customers, in order to generate profits to take care of her children and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Guljakan's Group

texts.en:
Guljakan B. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a farmer. Together they have raised five daughters and a son. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Guljakan is proud of her children: they are employed and support their parents financially. 

Guljakan together with her husband cultivates agricultural products. In 2010 as a result of their hard work they got a good harvest - 10 tons of barley. And now the family has applied for the loan because they need money to purchase potato seeds, fuel and pay for tractor driver services. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, fuel and pay for tractor driver services.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with seven family members. Three of the family members work.

Hisham has had a shop selling household items since 2010. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate his shop and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, who is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. In business for three years now, she is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Pilagia

texts.en:
Pilagia is 51 years old and married with three children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pilagia is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Pilagia has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and the buying and selling of livestock. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal business in the Philippines.

Laureta requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Laureta has been buying and selling charcoal for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from selling fruit.

Laureta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Fortunata Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; la socia tiene 48 años; la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo;  La socia es médico cirujano  y trabaja en una institución pública, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar equipo médico para implementar su consultorio, la socia va comprando poco a poco sus instrumentales y a futuro desea tener su propio consultorio médico y de este modo independizarse. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo médico propio.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Choquequirao" communal bank, located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Ms. Fortunata. She is 48 years old, married, and has one son. She is a medical surgeon and works at a public institution. She needs this loan to buy medical equipment for her office. She has been buying her instruments little by little, and in the future, she hopes to have her own medical clinic so that she can become independent.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of her own medical equipment. Fortunata is very with satisfied with and grateful for the support being offered to her through this means, and she promises to repay her debts according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase her own medical equipment

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 43 years old and is married with three children. She earns an average of Php 26,000 every harvest season, twice a year, as a farmer working in the Philippines. She grows rice and has been doing this for 25 years now. 

She is asking for the loan amount of Php 10,000 to pay for labor costs to prepare her rice field and to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for good production.

In the future, Judy hopes for a bigger production of rice to generate more income for the comfortable living she wants to give her family someday.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs to  prepare her rice field and to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Mafuiane, Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 8 a 18 anos todos vaõ a Escola. Fez a 9ª classe e parou por falta de condinçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 3 enteados que vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, pratica agricultura ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de 35.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BCI).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma vizinha que também é cliente e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende investir no agro-negocio (sementes, lavoura, adubos e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 15.000.00mt,e 20.000.00mt tambem aplicados na agricultura.  
Sonha em concluir a sua obra e mobiliar para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ilda was born in Mafuiane, Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children between 8 and 18 years old; all the children go to school. Ilda finished ninth grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and also supports three stepchildren who live with her.

She has never left Maputo. Ilda has been a farmer for more than ten years and has an income of 35,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BCI).

She has never had a loan from other banks. Ilda learned about Hluvuku through a neighbor who is also a customer, and this is her third Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 25,000 meticais to invest in her agro-business (seeds, ploughing, compost and other expenses). The previous loans were for 15,000 meticais and 20,000 meticais, and they were also used for agriculture.

Ilda's dream is to finish her house and furnish it so she can make her family more comfortable. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to invest in her agro-business (seeds, ploughing, compost, etc.).

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
As the married parent of one child, Michel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Michel is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business.

Michel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Nordeliza

texts.en:
Nordeliza is married with 4 children. Nordeliza is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Nordeliza sells snacks to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan of 2,000 to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, and juice to cook snacks.

Nordeliza has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Nordeliza hopes to have a better living condition and make her children professional.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, and juice to cook snacks.

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade. Naõ estudou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia no Distrito de Boane e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É comerciante ha mais de 30 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 2.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (caldo, óleo, arroz, amendoim, peixe, e outros.) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 10.000.00mt, para o comercio.
No futuro vai solicitar mais valor para concluir o seu estabelecimento para ampliar a sua actividade comercial, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julieta was born in the city of Maputo, located in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is single and mother of 3 adult children.  She did not attend school due to a lack of financial resources.  She owns the home she lives in with her family in the Boane district and she does not support anyone else. 

She has had her own business for more than 30 years and earns around 2.000.00mt monthly, which she uses for household expenses and saves some in her bank account. 

She has never had a loan with other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (broth, cooking oil, peanuts, fish, etc.) to increase her stock of merchandise.  The first loan was for 10.000.00mt, for her business.  In the future she plans to request additional loans to complete her store and to expand her business.  She will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase products for resale (soup, cooking oil, rice, peanuts, fis, etc.)

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 25 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, 1 currently still in school. For the past 3 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which sells medicine and provides medical services to the local community. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses and expand his pharmacy into a clinic. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new medicine for resale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor cuenta con 29 años de edad, está casada con el señor Aquileo quien es taxista, tienen 6 hijos Bibiana, cristal, Álvaro, corina, alexia y betzy, de los cuales 5 estudian, la mayor está cursando segundo año de secundaria, tres más primero, tercero y sexto año de primaria, la menor esta en segundo año de preescolar, ya que la más pequeña apenas tiene unos meses de nacida, ella se dedica a la venta de maíz, hace apenas 4 meses.
Doña Leonor dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar de manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también porque quiere mejorar su calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos como: chiles, jitomates, cebollas, carnes, pollo, queso, aceite, leña, sal, etc. para continuar con las ventas en su negocio.
La meta que ella tiene para su negocio, y espera poder cumplirla es la de invertirle muchísimo más, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere construir un local, para poner una pequeño restaurante, y así mejorar e incrementar un poco mas sus ingresos, puesto que podrá asegurar el futuro y educación de sus hijos.
Le da las gracias a FRAC y a los donadores de kiva, por la confianza que le han estado brindando, ya que gracias a ese apoyo ahora puede ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y continuar con la inversión en su negocio, para que sea el mejor.
texts.en:
29-year old Señora Leonor is married to Señor Aquileo who is a taxi driver. They have six children, Bibiana, Cristal, Álvaro, Corina, Alexia and Betzy of whom five are in school (the oldest in second year of high school, three in grades 1, 3, and 6 of primary school, one in the second year of pre-school). The youngest is just a few months old. 

Leonor earns her living by selling corn, a job she’s been doing for almost four months. She started doing this to help her husband pay for the household expenses and their children’s education. She also wants to improve their standard of living. She plans to use the loan money to buy supplies such as chilis, tomatoes, onions, meat, chicken, cheese, oil, firewood, salt etc. for her stall. 

Her goal is to invest more money in her business so it will grow rapidly. She plans to build a permanent store and open a restaurant so that she can earn more money and ensure a good economic future and pay for her children’s education.

Leonor is grateful to FRAC and Kiva’s donors for the trust they have placed in her. Thanks to this help she can provide a better quality of life to her children and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy chilis, tomatoes, onions, meat, chicken, cheese, oil, firewood, salt etc.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Florence is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells dry food like maize. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and coffee for resale and will help Florence to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Florence's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and coffee for resale

loans.name: María Florentina

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 49 años D. edad,  es casada con tres hijos, D. los cuales uno depenD. D. ella.
El esposo D. María se dedica a la crianza D. bueyes, para luego venderlos. Ella se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, desD. hace 15 años, esta actividad la aprendió D. sus padres, quienes le enseñaron a ganarse el sustento diario.
Los cerdos los compra pequeñitos, en un tiangue y también a personas que viven cerca D. su comunidad. Luego los alimenta durante seis meses, para engordarlos y venderlos a buen precio. Ella los mantiene en un lugar exclusivo para los cerdos (chiquero) cerca D. su casa, para darles ahí la comida y vitaminas. María comenta que se siente muy feliz y disfruta su trabajo. A parte D. los cerdos también venD. gallinas, pavo, entre otros.
Ella es una persona feliz, que se dedica a su trabajo y lo disfruta. Es muy querida en lugar donD. vive. María solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, por que dice que es una institución que ayuda al campesino y el préstamo será  para comprar cuatro cerditos, esto le permitirá continuar con su actividad productiva, la cual le genera los ingresos para subsistir y para brindarle el estudio a su hija. Mas adelante desea mejorar la cuchera, que es el lugar donD. tiene los cerdos.
texts.en:
María is a 49-year-old married woman with three children, one of which is under her care. María's husband works breeding oxen to then sell them. She has worked breeding pigs for the past 15 years. She picked up the traD. from her parents, who taught her how to work for a living.

She buys piglets from a livestock market and also from people close to her community. Then, she feeds them for six months to fatten them up and sells them at a good price. She keeps them in a special place for pigs (chiquero) near her home, in order to feed them and give them vitamins. María says that she is very happy and enjoys her work. Apart from pigs, she also sells hens, turkeys and other animals.

She is very happy and committed to her work, enjoys it. She is very loved where she lives. María is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo, because she says that it is an institution that helps rural workers. With this loan, she will buy four piglets, which will allow her to continue on with her business, as well as pay for her daughter's education. In the future she wishes to improve the area where she keeps her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a variety of products for the holiday season.

loans.name: Faasegia

texts.en:
Faasegia is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Samata. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Faasegia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Faasegia has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Faasegia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faasegia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Faasegia is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Faasegia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Emma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
This is Emerita, 57, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Rizalino, a carpenter, and she is a mother to her two children. She manages their household, together with her husband, while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emerita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emerita hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 52 year old married man with eight children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal,Uganda. His family goal is educating all his children. His current business is selling the local gin that he prepares himself despite challenges of the continuous price fluctuations. His dream is to expand his business into new markets. Stephen needs the loan to buy bananas for making gin to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy bananas to make gin for sell this season

loans.name: Gladwell

texts.en:
Gladwell is 41 years and married. She has been successfully running a clothing boutique business for the past four years. 

Gladwell is requesting her second loan from KADET for 60,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers, and dresses to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. Her dream is to expand her business and own a bigger boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, blouses, trousers, and dresses.

loans.name: Soul

texts.en:
Soul, 52, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over twenty years and is successful in her career. Additionally, she runs a grocery store from home to generate more income for the family. All of her children are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a policeman. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions and generate extra profits to support the family, Soul is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to run one more business by purchasing rice to resell at the rice mill. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married, hard working, poultry farmer.  She has been a poultry farmer for 10 years, striving to work every day of the week so that she can maximize profits, and meet the demands of her customers.

Irene's dream is to build rentals so that she can increase her income.  She will use the loan to buy poultry feed so that she can increase production.  She is hard working, focussed, and appreciates the financial boost and support.

Irene (carrying a baby) and the UGAFODE credit staff are pictured in her poultry house.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Beaney

texts.en:
I had a grocery store on a main street of Danli for several years now. I have been running the business personally and have a strong customer base that prefers me for my personal treatment and good prices. I have been able to build a house and feed and educate my children with the profits. The business is growing and soon I will need another person to help me care for my clients.

Loan Use: Purchase of softdrinks, churros, cakes, milk, eggs and other products

Tengo varios años de tener mi negocio ubicado en una de las principales calles y de bastante transito en la ciudad de Danli, lo administro personalmente, durante este tiempo he sabido ganarme la confianza de las personas que me prefieren por el trato que les doy ademas de los productos de buena calidad y precios. Gracias a los ingresos que hemos obtenido he logrado contruir mi casa, y apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios y alimentacion. El negocio esta creciendo por lo que pronto necesitare otra ayuda, asi que pienso contratar a otra persona que me pueda ayudar atender a mis clientes.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, churros, galletas, leche, huevos y otros.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 30 year-old lady who operates a drinking bar. She sells soft drinks such as Coca-Cola, Pepsi, Fanta, Sprite, Mirinda, and other drinks like beer, Stone Lager, Castle Milk Stout, Guiness and so on.

She is seeking a loan of $1000 from Kiva because she wants to open a spacious bar that can serve 100 clients at a time and also take in more drinks to serve her customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Mr. Anthony E. is 37 years old from a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He delivers the services of panel beating to his community. He is married with three (3) children. He wants to borrow $400 to buy more instruments for his workshop and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more instruments for his workshop

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
MARIA SOLEDAD IS MARIED, HAS 3 SONS AND SHE IS 31 YEARS OLD. HER HUSBAND WORK AS A WELDER. SHE HAS A KITCHEN WHERE SHE PREPARES TYPICAL DISHES FROM HER REGION THAT ARE THEN SOLD TO CUSTOMERS THAT COME IN EVERYDAY. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP JOVEL 3. SHE WISHES TO USE HER LOAN TO BUILD A SMALL RESTAURANT IN HER HOME AND TO BUY ADDITIONAL KITCHENWARE.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA SOLEDAD ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS Y 31 AÑOS DE EDAD , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO SOLDADOR ELLA POSEE UNA COCINA ECONOMICA EN SU CASA EN DONDE HACE COMIDAS TIPICAS DE SU ZONA Y VENDE A LAS PERSONAS QUE VIENEN A SERVIRSE DIARIAMENTE. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO JOVEL 3 . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA YA INSTALAR UN PEQUEÑO RESTAURANT EN SU CASA Y COMPRAR MAS IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA .

loans.use: VENTA DE COMIDA

loans.name: Zuhuriddin

texts.en:
Zuhuriddin is a designer. He has his own workshop in the hospital. His business is to sew coats for doctors of this hospital. He is marred and his wife, Suraiohon, helps him in his business. (She is in the photo). He has three children who go to school.

In the beginning in 1990 he worked at home. He took orders for sewing clothes at home. Gradually he could save money for renting one room for a workshop at the big hospital in Khujand in 2004. Today they have a great number of clients. They additionally take orders for sewing bedclothes and draperies for hospitals. Presently Zuhuriddin wants to open one workshop to sew covers for cars. He noticed a good demand for this kind of product. For this purpose he is requesting $1200.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim runs a store selling sugar and rice.  Rice is a staple food in Sierra Leone and therefore it has a big market. With the previous loan, 42 year-old Ibarhim increased his business with six bags of rice and reduced time spent traveling to purchase the rice.  Ibarhim is married with three children and plans to expand his business and become one of the leading wholesalers in Magburaka town.  For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Expand his business by purchasing larger quantities of rice for wholesale.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia is a 34 year old elementary school teacher, though for lack of opportunities she is unable to use the degree which she eagerly obtained from a prestigious university in this fair city. This enterprising mother, upon realizing that the small salary of her beloved husband who works as a police officer was not enough to meet all of the family's needs, she decided to open a business of her own offering jackets which she sells in the San Jose de Juilaca Plaza. She would like to increase the amount of merchandise that she offers, in order to save sufficient income to finish building a second floor onto her home. This will allow her to offer wellbeing, security, and comfort to ther three young children. To make her dream a reality, she is asking for a loan. Your selfless help and your generous heart will make it possible for her to realize her plans quickly.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Lucía de 34 años de edad, es profesora de educación primaria, pero por falta de oportunidades no puede ejercer su profesión que muy ávidamente concluyó en una prestigiosa universidad de su bella ciudad. Ésta emprendedora madre, al observar que las necesidades de su familia no eran satisfechas totalmente, debido al pequeño ingreso de su querido esposo que se desempeña como policía; decidió emprender su negocio de venta de casacas, mercadería que ofrece en forma ambulatoria en la Plaza San José de Juliaca.El deseo de esta hacendosa madre es aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería, para ahorrar lo suficiente y terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casita con el fin de ofrecerles bienestar, seguridad y comodidad a sus tres hijos menores y para concretar su anhelo solicita un préstamo de dinero que gracias a tu ayuda desinteresada y a tu generoso corazón generoso le posibilitará concretar sus planes en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to obtain greater variety and amount of jackets to be sold to the general public.

loans.name: Rosa Inés

texts.es:
Rosa Vallecillo is a married woman, the mother of one school-aged son. She is hardworking and has dreams of success in both her personal life and her business. She started her business selling footwear five years ago, offering a variety of products, with a start-up capital of $900.00.

Ros Vallecillo has worked with CEPRODEL for one year and is very happy with the support they have given her. Thanks to this support she has been able to expand her business, meet her clientèle's needs and support her family. She has a history of four loans.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Vallecillo es una mujer casada, madre de un hijo que esta en edad escolar, ella es una persona trabajadora con deseos de superación tanto en su vida personal como es su negocio. Inicio su negocio de venta de calzados hace cinco años, ofreciendo variedad de productos, con un capital de U$900.00.

La Sra. Rosa Vallecillo trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a su familia. Ella tiene un record de Cuatro créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of footwear

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia decided seven years ago to invest her small savings, accumulated with much sacrifice, in the purchase of cheese, from which she's built her business. Though a single mother, Cecilia has managed with this small business to support her household and cover the expenses of the business. She's going through a period now, though, where she needs help buying the cheese she will resell and, consequently, she's looking to Ceprodel to help her with a timely loan.

Up to now, Cecilia's business has grown little by little and with Ceprodel's financial support, she will succeed in adding to her sales, offering a greater variety of cheeses such as "quesillos" (a local soft cheese), smoked cheese, "cuajada" (milk curd, perhaps?) and other locally-popular cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Cecilia S. desde hace 7 años decide invertir un pequeño ahorro que con mucho sacrifico logra reunir y lo utiliza para invertirlo en la compra de queso que es el negocio que actualmente posee. Siendo la Sra. S. madre soltera con este pequeño negocio ha logrado sustentar su hogar y cubrir con los gastos de su negocio. La problemática que atraviesa la señora S. es la necesidad de adquirir el queso y por tal razón busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos oportunos.

Hasta la fecha su negocio ha ido progresando poco a poco y con el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL logra aumentar sus ventas, ofreciendo mas variedades de quesos de diferentes tipos tales como quesillo, ahumado, cuajada, queso seco y queso fresco.

loans.use: Buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Amina's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 19 year old single woman who sells cosmetics, a business she began in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $825 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in retail and cosmetics sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Akouto

texts.fr:
Miss Akouto A. was born on June 6, 1984 in Lomé. She is single and presently runs a liquor store, also selling cases of canned drinks wholesale in her little shop, "A. & Fils". She began this business in 2006 and was selling retail at that time. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 which will permit her to purchase certain drinks that she does not presently have available in her shop. She would like to buy 10 cartons of whisky with half of the loan money and use the rest to have a display case made for her merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle A. Akouto est née le 6 juin 1984 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire et exerce actuellement le commerce de liqueur et de boissons en canette en gros dans sa boutique « A. & FILS ». Elle a commencé cette activité en 2006 et vendait en détail. Le crédit de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter les boissons dont elle ne dispose pas dans sa boutique. A cet effet elle désire acheter dix (10) cartons de whisky avec la moitié des fonds et le reste faire un étalage pour exposer ses marchandises.

loans.use:
Expand her inventory of drinks

Augmenter le stock le stock de boissons

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. is forty-two years old. She is married with three children. She is industrious and very supportive of her family. She sells maize and smoked fish. She gets her supplies from Accra, a town 85 km away, and retails to her customers. The price of maize increases daily due to the recent food crisis and it drains her profits when she buys in bids. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to enable her to sell at increased profit. She believes with increased income, she can expand her business. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. Members agree to support each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and fresh fish.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa R. is a loving mother who upon noticing the financial troubles her family was experiencing, decided to create her own source of income in her home. Thanks to her efforts, her general store has become well-known and quite frequented every day of the week. Rosa’s wish is to improve her business space so that she can serve more customers with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Rosa, es una amorosa madre de familia que observando la necesidad por la que atravesaba su familia decidió implementar su propia fuente de ingreso en casa, gracias a su esfuerzo ésta se ha hecho muy conocida y es bastante concurrida todos los días de la semana. El deseo de Rosa es mejorar su espacio de ventas para acoger a mayor número de clientes con comodidad.

loans.use: Improvement of business space

loans.name: Santa Marta Group

texts.en:
The women from the Santa Marta community in San Juan, Lake Atitlan enjoy living in their town and prefer to work in groups. Group president Albertina U. described their habits as, “tranquil, united and happy.” All of these women know each other and it is easy to sense that they enjoy being part of a team in which everyone pays back their loans as a group.

The women dedicate themselves to a variety of micro-enterprises. Eight women weave - making hammocks, traditional guipil tops and shoulder bags. Three women resell clothing. The other two raise chickens to sell or butcher. Their buyers are intermediaries who sell items in Panajachel and other villages surrounding Lake Atitlan.

When asked about their businesses, they had mixed feelings. Although sales are continuously growing, the sales were low this season. The winter months of December, January and February bring in much more profit than the rainy season of the spring months.

According to Albertina U., the loans have helped a lot and have allowed them to invest in necessities for their businesses. This will ultimately lead to increased profits. She pointed out that sometimes the cycle of a business is interrupted when an unforeseen expense arises or sales are low. The loans help to keep the businesses stable. However, this cycle is broken when there’s a lack of microlenders.

The loans support their business but more importantly support most of their dreams for the future: “the well-being of their families and the advancement of their childrens' education.”

loans.use: to purchase weaving equipment, thread, dye and cloth

loans.name: Happy's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Happy is a married woman with 2 children aged 7 and 4. She became a caterer and vegetable seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Happy has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Happy now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with maize sales and clothes sales.

loans.use: To more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Gabriela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gaby is 19 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Candelarias II” in Huaraz. We find her in her mother’s business where she helps in the afternoons, she works to be able to save and cover the cost of her studies, when she enrolls to be a police officer or flight attendance in Lima. She is single.

She tells us she has grown her business. Before she sold candy from a cart outside a school, and with the loans she received she has been able to open her own business selling clothing from home to home. The difficulty she encounters in this work is daily going to collect from her customers because they are located in difference areas of Huaraz city.

With a loan for S/800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy jeans, sweaters, shirts, and blouses in Lima.

Gabriela would like to receive training on how to improve family relations seeing as how she only lives with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Gaby de 19 años de edad pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II” de Huaraz, la encontramos en el negocio de su madre donde ayuda por las tardes, ella trabaja para poder ahorrar y cubrir los costos de sus estudios, cuando ingrese a la policía o ser aeromoza, en Lima ya que es soltera.

Ella nos cuenta que ha crecido en su negocio, que antes vendía golosinas en una carreta, afueras de un colegio, y con los préstamos que recibe ha podido abrir su propio negocio de venta de ropas a domicilio, la dificultad que ella encuentra en este trabajo es el de ir a cobrar diariamente a sus clientes que se localizan por diversas zonas de la ciudad de Huaraz

Con el préstamo de S/ 800 soles, la cual pagará en 6 cuotas, ella comprará jeans, chompas, polos camisas y blusas de la ciudad de Lima.

A Gabriela, le gustaría recibir capacitaciones de cómo mejorar sus relaciones familiares a pesar de solo vivir con su madre.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Kotognotala (Compromis Mutuel) Group

texts.fr:
Kotognotala est un regroupement de sept (7) femmes toutes mariées et vivent dans des foyers polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles résident toutes à Ouéléssébougou (une sous préfecture de la deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parenté et font essentiellement la production et vente de nourritures (soumbala et de boissons locales).
C’est dans la recherche des ressources financières complémentaires que ce groupe de femmes a décidé de collaborer avec l’institution. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe), le groupe est à son deuxième prêt.
Ces femmes comptent acheter chacune avec ce nouveau prêt 250 kilogrammes de grains de néré, un important stock de bois de chauffe et divers autres articles. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place aux marchés de Ouelessébougou et environnants pour les graines de néré (arbre oléagineux de la zone sahélienne).Quant aux divers articles (jus en poudre, dah, sucre, sachets plastiques) elles les achètent à partir de Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et quelques fois sur place. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place au village aux résidants et aux revendeurs venant des grandes villes telle Bougouni, Bamako et Kati. Les ventes sont effectuées généralement au comptant.  
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 36.000 FCFA.qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Kotognotala (meaning "mutual compromise") is a group of seven women who are all married. They live in polygamous households and average 38 years of age and six children. They all reside in Ouéléssébougou (a sub-prefecture of the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other by ties of community and blood. Essentially they produce and sell food (soumbala, which is a fermented paste made from locust seeds; and local beverages). The search for supplementary financial resources is the reason why this group of women has decided to collaborate with the institution After having correctly repaid the first solidarity loan (group loan), the group is on its second loan. These women each intend to use this new loan to buy 250 kg of néré seeds (locust seeds), a large stock of firewood, and various other articles. They get their supplies locally at the marketplaces of Ouelessébougou and its surrounding areas for néré seeds (from a tree that is a source of oil in sub-Saharan regions). As for the various articles, such as powdered juices, dah (fried hibiscus blossoms), sugar, and plastic bags, they buy them from Bamako (capital of Mali) and sometimes locally. They make their sales locally out of homes in the village and to retailers who come from the big cities, such as Bougouni, Bamako, and Kati. Sales are generally made in cash. They each intend to realize a monthly profit of 36,000 francs CFA, which will be used essentially to bolster their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making soumbala and local soft drinks

loans.name: Mrs. Mork Nhoth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mork N., a group leader of five who all live in Svay Prey Village in Kampong Cham Province, recently married Mrs. Yorn Yeth, a construction worker. They have no children. Mork owns a small plot of land upon which she cultivates rice for a living, but the land has become infertile. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizers in order to produce a good crop.

Because Mrs. Sun S., one of the group members, was not available for the picture, her husband is shown instead.

This is a group loan consisting of end-of-term loans with the exception of one group member who has a monthly payment loan. Such members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Fozia M.hussain Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji is 26 years old and resides in Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room, brick house and has been living in it for the past 16 years. She completed eight years of education and is the mother of two sons, ages five and six. Fozia baji embroiders and sews clothes to help with the household expenses. Her husband, M. Hussain, runs a grocery shop near the house. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Shahnaz bano baji requests a loan to repair her motorbikes for her motorbike rental business. Ishrat baji requests a loan to buy material (spices and cooking oil) for her food business. Haleema baji requests a loan to buy electric supplies (wires and switch boards) for her electric shop. Sardaran baji requests a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Carmin Yesica

texts.es:
Carmín es una nueva socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al siglo XXI” en Juli, tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, madre de un hijo de un año de edad, su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de motocicletas y vive en el Jr. Puno Nº 221, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.


Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados en bayeta para vender en Cusco. 

Tiene planeado abrir un Locutorio en Juli, para lo cual seguirá trabajando con su negocio de Artesanía.

Su mayor deseo es empezar su negocio de llamadas telefónicas y tener muchos locales.
texts.en:
Carmín is a new member of the “Mujeres al siglo XXI” (21st Century Women) microfinance institute in Juli. She is a married 23-year-old mother with a 1-year-old son. Her husband buys and sells motorcycles for a living. They live on Jr. Puno Nº 221, in the Juli district of the Chuchito province, department of Puno.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase baize embroidery to sell it in Cusco.

She plans to open a call shop in Juli, but in order to do so, she will keep working in her handicraft business. Her greatest wish is to start her call shop and have many branches.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baize embroidery

loans.name: Sokvang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvang H. lives in Kanthorm village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who has a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Moang Meng, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sokvang H. is 38 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school.

Although they try to work hard, they still cannot provide a better life for the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sokvang H. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income when she sells the cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
K. is a Cambodian who lives in Banteay Meanchey Province. She was born in 1960 and is a mother who has given birth to three children; all three of them are single. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious foods for the family.

K. currently sells a variety of groceries out of her home. K. is married to Mr. Ly, 38, and he earns income by raising pigs from home. K. has been planning to establish a suitable investment for her husband. Right now, she is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle O. is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells clothes. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
MIRNA F. REÁTEGUI, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su domicilio está ubicado en el AA.HH. Barrio Unido Mz B Lt 11 – San Fernando, Distrito de Manantay, tiene 36 años de edad, cuatro hijos, su esposo es estibador.

Hace un año, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, esto le ayudo a incrementar su capital para la compra de pollos, los cuales los comercializa luego en el mercado y a sus caseras en diferentes puntos de esta ciudad.

El préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, con el compraría pollos en los caseríos y traerlos a la ciudad para su venta es una actividad que le ha resultado rentable a ella, pero que también requiere bastante atención.

Está contenta con Manuela Ramos, por el apoyo que ha recibido, no ha sido grandes cantidades, pero si ha sido valioso.
texts.en:
MIRNA F. REÁTEGUI, 36, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the Manantay district. Her husband is a cargo handler and they have four children. A year ago, Mirna received her first loan (300 soles), to purchase chickens which she later sold at the market and at other locations around the town. She is requesting a new loan of 1,000 soles to purchase chickens on the outskirts of town and bring them into town to be sold. This activity has proven profitable for her, but it also requires much time and attention. Mirna is happy with the support fro Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. The loans have been small, but valuable.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens to be sold in town

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena Espinosa Pérez tiene la edad de 54 años, ella es madre soltera, el apoyo que ella obtiene es a través de su trabajo como modista y su única hija que trabaja le apoya con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar de construir su vivienda para que en un futuro puedan vivir cómodos, ya que a pesar de su edad a luchado mucho para poder hacer realidad el sueño de ver terminada su casa .Con el financiamiento va a comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar el techo de la terraza que esta en mal estado, da la gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que ha brindado a su familia para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Elena Espinosa Pérez is 54 years old and is a single mother. The support that she has received through her work as a dressmaker and through her only daughter that works with her, supports her with the expenses of her home. The plan for her family is to be able to finish constructing her home so that in the future they can live comfortably. In spite of her age, she has fought hard to be able to make her dream a reality of seeing her house finished.

With this financing, she is going to buy construction materials to improve her terrace roof, which is in bad condition. She gives thanks to Afodenic for the support that that they have provided to her family to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to repair her terrace roof

loans.name: Faima Group

texts.en: Faima is the group leader of the Faima group. There are five members in this group. Each of them wants a loan for expanding their business. Faima wants a loan for a bead working business. Farzan wants a loan for a carpet weaving business. Norui wants a loan for her brother who has a car part shop. Leda wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Shkaba wants a loan for a beauty salon business. They want a loan of 50000 afghani for the term of 8 months. They are very happy that this loan process is in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand a beadworking business

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Martha M. se dedica muy arduamente a su actividad de pulpería el cual atiende a diario siendo este su sustento con el que mantiene su hogar.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y es por esta razón que muy confiadamente espera en la aprobación del crédito para así salir adelante en su negocio que requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Ms. Martha M. works arduously in her general store, which she manages everyday because it is her sole means of support.

Today, she turns to Ceprodel so that she can be granted a loan in order to purchase goods for her general store. For this reason, she is confidently waiting to be approved for a loan so that she can move forward with her business, which needs your support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Esta casada con el señor Alcides Areco, quien se dedica a la construcción de viviendas. Los dos mantienen su hogar con mucho sacrificio.  Se levantan muy temprano y salen a sus trabajos.  Ella se dedica a la venta entre semana y cobra los fines de semana.

Ella recorre las calles casa por casa ofreciendo sus productos, sin importar el frío o calor pues de esto dependen sus hijos.

En el futuro desea comprar una motocicleta para realizar sus cobranzas. Ella necesita del crédito para la compra de mercaderías, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por la temporada.
texts.en:
Aurora is 40 years old and has two underage children. She is married to Alcides Areco who works in home construction. Both support their household with a lot of sacrifice. They wake up very early and leave to their jobs. She dedicates herself to sales during the week and goes to collect her payments on the weekends. Aurora goes around from house to house offering her products regardless of the cold or the heat since her children depend on her. In the future she would like to purchase a motorcycle to carry out her money collection. She needs this loan to purchase merchandise, given that she has a lot of orders this season.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase athletic shoes, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, capris, blankets, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Trabajando Juntos Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal trabajando juntos, esta ubicado en Huancavelica, la actividad principal D. esta zona es el comercio D. productos D. primera necesidad y también se dedican a la agricultura fuera D. la comunidad.
Rosa, tiene 3 hijos D. 20, 18 y 15 soles, es cocinera y tiene una tienda D. restaurante, le va bien, su vida es más ordenada, solicita 500 soles para la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideos y todo lo necesario para el preparado D. comida. Su sueño es comprar un terreno en lima.
Irene, es conviviente tiene 5 hijos D. entre 25 y 16 años, ella se inicio vendiendo licor ahora venD. comida pues tiene un restaurante, ella misma cocina, el negocio es familiar. Su préstamo D. 400 soles lo invertirá en su negocio para la compra D. abarrotes, su sueño es comprar un terreno mas granD. y adecuado para su negocio pues el que tiene es alquilado.
Sebastiana, es casada, tiene 1 hijo D. 17 años, empezó comprando animales como carnero en pocas cantidades, ahora tiene mayor cantidad y tiene el apoyo D. su esposo, desD. que inicio en finca a incrementado su negocio pues ahora tiene un carro con el cual se moviliza mas rápido, solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para la compra D. animales como alpacas y carneros y venderá repartiéndolo en los mercados, su sueño es terminar D. pagar su carro pues es una herramienta que le permite movilizar su mercadería.
texts.en:
The community bank Trabajando Juntos (Working Together), is located in Huancavelica. The principal activity in this area is the business of selling basic needs products and farming outsiD. of the community. Rosa, has 3 children, 20, 18 and 15 years old. She is a cook and owns a restaurant. It is going well for her, her life is more organized. She requests a loan of 500 soles for the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and other products needed for the productions of meals. Her dream is to buy land in Lima. Irene lives with her spouse and has 5 children between 25 and 16 years of age. She started by selling liquor and now sells food because she owns a restaurant. She makes the meals herself and it is a family style restaurant. She will invest her loan of 400 soles in her business, in the purchase of groceries. Her dream is to buy a larger piece of land more adequate for her business, a space for which she now rents. Sebastiana is married and has 1 son of 17 years of age. She started out buying animals, such as sheep, in small quantities. She now has larger quantities and the help of her husband. She has grown her business since she has a farm and now has a vehicle which allows her to get around faster. She is requesting a loan of 600 soles for the purchase of animals such as alpacas and sheep, which she will sell in the markets. Her dream is to finish paying off her vehicle which gives her the means to transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Hounsikpe

texts.en:
Hounsikpe H. lives in Cotonou, the largest city in Bénin. She has five children, all of whom live at home. Two children are in job training and three are still in school. Hounsikpe’s husband, Housedah Fardinah, is a gardener and plants mainly vegetables that he can sell.  

Hounsikpe is food vendor.  She sells a variety of products, including peanuts, powdered sugar and flour along the road.  Hounsikpe buys her goods at the Dantokpa Market, one of the largest open-air markets in West Africa. She started this business with her own money but has taken out two loans from ALIDé to expand her operations. Hounsikpe is seeking another loan from ALIDé to purchase more goods to sell. She would like to have access to more money so that she can sell her goods in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts, powdered sugar and flour

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 32 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Su sentido de responsabilidad y ansias de progreso, lo llevaron hace de 5 años a implementar su propia granja de cuyes para tener ingresos adicionales a sus actividades agrícolas. Su esposa es quien está siempre a su lado para ayudarlo en todas estas tareas, ellos crían estos animales para luego venderlos en las ferias ganaderas de su región. Por otro lado, cada 6 meses venden los productos que obtuvieron de su cosecha a los principales mercados de su zona, guardando siempre en su almacén para su consumo personal. Estas arduas labores han hecho que la economía de Jesús sea más sólida y vea con grandes expectativas su futuro, ya que quiere brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación e incrementar las extensiones de sus terrenos y su granja. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en MFP, le recomendaron trabajar con esta modalidad de préstamos en un banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser una persona responsable en la devolución de su crédito. El monto que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de madera para ampliar su granja de cuyes. También adquirirá productos de primera necesidad, ya que abrirá en su misma casa una tienda de comestibles que estará a cargo de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jesús is 32 years old, and lives with his wife and their 2 children in their own home. Five years ago, his sense of responsibility and anxiety to progress led him to implement his own guinea pig farm to bring in extra income and supplement his farming activities. His wife is always at his side to help with the various tasks. They breed animals and then sell them at the region's livestock fairs. In addition, every 6 months they sell goods from their harvest to major markets in the area, and always keep a portion for their own consumption. Such arduous work has improved Jesús' personal economy, and Jesús sees his future with great expectations. He wants to give his children a good education and increase the area of his land and farm. This is Jesús' first loan with MFP; people recommended that he work with a community bank. Jesús is committed to being a responsible person in the repayment of his debt. The loan he requests will be invested in the purchase of wood to expand his guinea pig farm. He will also acquire essential goods, as he will soon open a grocery store inside his house that his wife will manage.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his guinea pig farm

loans.name: Akprity

texts.fr: Cet homme a ouvert en 1998 un bar dans le quartier d'ahligo à lomé. son stock de boissons a connu une baisse, il veut le rehausser et sollicite par conséquent un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 30 casiers de bières et 20 casiers de sucreries.il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Avec près de 11 ans d'expérience dans ce commerce il sait comment faire fructifier le crédit qu’il aura.
texts.en:
This man opened a bar in 1998 in the Ahligo neighborhood in Lomé. As his inventory has been going low, and wishing to add to his merchandise, he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 crates of beer, and 20 crates of sweet drinks. This gentleman is married and the father of 3 children. With almost 11 years of experience, he knows how to get the most out of his loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of crates of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
