Joel D. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old. Joel is married and has three young children. To make a living, Joel operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Joel is just starting this business.

In 2009, Joel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Joel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en: Mr.  B. Twaha is a married man, blessed with five children. He owns a medical shop at Mbaguta Street and he stays in Lubuya. He is using the loan to purchase more medicine to improve on the stock so that he can be able to meet his customers’ demands. His future hopes are to improve and expand upon his business and more so provide better future for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to improve on the stock so that he can be able to meet his customers’ demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a second hair dryer, hair extensions and cosmetic products

loans.name: Nasur

texts.ru: Насур Джураев проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Насур вместе с женой занимается пашивкой. Помимо этого Насур работает шофером на заводе. Он занимается перевозкой муки, а дома на машинке шьет мешки для них. Жена также занимается пашивкой, она в основном шьет одежду. Кредит просит для покупки новой машинки, чтобы увеличить производство и ассортимент продукта. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Nasur J. resides in the Yovon region. He is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Nasur and his wife run a sewing business. In addition, he works as a driver for a factory, transporting flour. At home he sews bags for the flour. His wife also sews, generally making clothing. He is requesting a loan for a new sewing machine in order to increase production and the variety of products. With the profits they will earn, he wants to make home repairs.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Vandan

texts.en: Vandan B. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her husband currently lives and works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son and daughter, ages 18 and 21, are both university students. B. lives in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. B. operates a meat trading business in her town, and provides a various types of meat for her customers. She started her meat trading business in 2000 with 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD), and has gained much business experience over the years. Today she has a very loyal customer base, and her working capital exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~560 USD). In the future, B. is planning to expand her business, and hopes to one day have her own workspace. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell.

loans.use: purchasing meat to sell

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S. A. is 31 years of age and the good mother of three children. One of her children is married and the other two are dependent on her income. Sun S. A. sells bananas to earn a living and her husband works as a military policeman. In order to generate more income, Sun S. A. hopes to encourage her husband to hold another job as a Tuk Tuk driver. She is therefore applying for a loan of US$1000, which her husband will be able to use as capital to buy a trailer-motorcycle to begin offering Tuk Tuk services.

loans.use: To buy a trailer-motorcycle for Tuk Tuk services

loans.name: Saiid

texts.en: Saiid is a 35-year-old married man and father of 4 children. He has been working as a furniture maker for the past 15 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Saiid is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy necessary merchandise for his shop to develop his work.

loans.use: to buy necessary merchandise

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan T. is from the village of Rio Del Grande Enrile, Cagayan. She is 43 years old. Susan is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan makes and sells peanut butter in their community. Susan is just starting this business.

In 2009, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: S. Charlotte est née le 13 Octobre 1977 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Il y a environs 32 ans que Charlotte vit à Allomey à Allada. Mariée à AGNIDE Marcellin, un électronicien, Charlotte est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Charlotte vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Allomey. Le couple assure ensemble les dépenses de la famille. Charlotte a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire, puis a appris la couture. Charlotte mène cette activité depuis 8 ans. A côté de cela, Charlotte vend également des objets de mercerie (boutons, fermeture, etc.) dans son atelier à Allada. Charlotte s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Charlotte sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Charlotte S. was born on October 13, 1977, in the Atlantique Department in Benin. For about 32 years, Charlotte has been living in the Allomey area in Allada. She's married to Marcellin AGNIDE, an electronics technician. Charlotte is the mother of two children, out of which one attends school. She lives with her children and her husband in Allomey. The couple takes care of the family expenses together.

Charlotte attended school up to secondary level, and then learned sewing. Charlotte has been running this business for 8 years. In addition, Charlotte also sells sewing supplies (buttons, zippers, etc.) in her workshop in Allada. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Charlotte already benefited once from a loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé, which was repaid without problems. She's seeking a second loan from Alidé, in order to bolster her business and better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies (buttons, zippers, thread, safety pins, etc.)

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita D. is from the village of Olingan. She is 61 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month. In 2006, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to finance her vegetable business and to invest in pig raising. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions, especially to cover daily expenditures. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To finance her vegetable business and to invest in pig-raising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing accessories

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 23 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive junto a su familia en casa de su madre, ubicada en el anexo Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de pavos desde hace dos años. El compra pavos medianos para terminar de criarlos y venderlos en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo (mercado mayorista de la ciudad). Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta su familia por lo que da todo de si para sacar a su negocio adelante.

Enrique desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pavos, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Enrique es un joven muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos, los cuales lo consideran un joven responsable y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es poder construir su casa. En la fotografía aparece junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Enrique is 23 years old, married, and has a young child. He and his family live at his mother’s house, which is located in the Santa Rosa annex of the village of Lagunas. This community is situated in the District of Mórrope, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Enrique has been raising and selling turkeys for two years. He buys medium-sized turkeys to raise to full term and then sells them at the Moshoqueque Market (the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo). This business is his only source of income. His family has given up everything in order to move this business forward. Enrique wants to increase his business by acquiring more turkeys. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 soles. He is a young man who is well-known and respected by his neighbors, who consider him to be responsible and hardworking. His greatest wish is to build a house. In the photograph, Enrique appears with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase turkeys

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja y su hija, en su casa propia.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de carteras, calzado y bisutería, vendiendo según la temporada a sus vecinas y amistades. Usualmente desarrolla esta labor sola, puesto que su pareja se dedica a otra actividad y su hija a los estudios. Su negocio obtiene buenas ganancias gracias a que ella se esfuerza mucho ejerciéndolo, sale desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y regresa a su casa sólo para preparar el almuerzo y atender a su familia. 
Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un bazar en su vivienda para tener mayor comodidad a la hora de ofrecer su mercadería, pero para esto requiere de mayor capital y aún no dispone de todo el tiempo para dedicarle a su negocio, puesto que debe velar por su hija y las labores de su hogar, es por eso que este negocio aún está en sus planes futuros. 

Es el cuarto préstamo de Betty con MFP y promete ser tan puntual en sus pagos como lo fue en sus préstamos pasados. Con el dinero que solicita ahora comprará mayor cantidad de carteras y collares que es lo que más se está vendiendo en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Betty, 30, lives with her life partner and their daugher in her own home. For the last 2 years she has sold seasonal purses, shoes and costume jewelry to her neighbors and acquaintances. She usually works alone because her partner is involved in a different activity and her daugher is in school. Her business earns good profits thanks to the effort she puts into it. She goes out at 9am and works until 6pm only coming home to prepare lunch and care for her family. For the future, she plans to set up a store in her house so that she can sell more comfortably. For this, however, she needs more capital and she still doesn't have the necessary time to dedicate to her business because she must care for her daughter and see to household chores. This is why the store is still in her future plans. This is Betty's 4th loan with MFP and she promisses to be as punctual now with her repayments as she's been in the past. She will use the funds to buy larger quantities of purses and necklaces, which are the items that sell best during this season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy necklaces and purses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy food products

loans.name: Kima

texts.en: Kima A. lives in Ijevan with her husband, a son (now serving in the Armenian Army) and a daughter. Kima’s elder daughter is married and lives separate from her parents. For the past 12 years Kima has sold men's, women's, and children's clothes. With the income from her business, she was able to buy her own little shop where she has a section selling toys. Kima needs 1,000,000 AMD loan to renew her inventory of spring season’s clothes.

loans.use: To renew her inventory of spring season’s clothes

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El Sr. Silverio A.  vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque,  el mismo  es casado y vive con su conyuge.
 El titular cuenta con un comedor  hace 10 años en su domicilio, prepara desayunos, media mañanas, almuerzos y meriendas para personales de una fabrica de costura que se encuentra frente a su domicilio contando ya con una buena clientela formada a la fecha.
 Cabe resaltar que el mismo opera solo con  la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2002  siempre abonando en forma excelente sus prestamos. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de alimentos para la venta(carnes vacuna, porcina, de aves, fideos, harina, arroz).
texts.en:
Sr. Silverio A. is married. He and his wife live in their own home in the city of Luque.

Silverio opened a diner in his home ten years ago. He prepares breakfasts, brunches, lunches, and snacks for employees of a sewing factory located in front of his home. Silverio has built up a good customer base since he started. He has only done business with Fundación Paraguaya and has been a client since 2002. He has always been in excellent shape when paying his loans.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase ingredients for preparing the meals that he sells (beef, pork, poultry, noodles, flour, and rice).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B., 45, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Elesio, a steel man, they are blessed with four children in their marriage. Melanie makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life, managing her own buy-and-sell business which includes bags, clothes and home amenities.

A regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, Melanie regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the continued success of her business, Melanie would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan to buy more quantities of products needed to replenish and maintain the operation of her businesses. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a happy and comfortable life for her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the business

loans.name: Vergilia

texts.en: Vergilia G. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Vergilia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products such as sandals, slippers and ladies' shoes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Vergilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Vergilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Loko Massama Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Loko Massama” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo small-town, near Freetown. They are seeking a loan of SLL 700,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses and make more profits, consequently improving on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Mamusu K.. Mamusu is age 38; she was born in Loko Massama village. Now, she lives in Waterloo with her husband who is a building contractor.

For ten years now, Mamusu has sold cloth – lace, cottons, etc. She also sells underwear. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to increase her business stock and quality.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and underwear wholesale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una alegre y trabajadora mujer de 46 años de edad, comparte su vida con su pareja y su hijo Jesús de 11 años en su casa propia. Hace mas de dos años se dedica en la venta de ceviche (plato típico peruano), en un puesto que tiene instalado en el exterior de su casa. En un inicio cuando obtuvo su primer crédito, pudo mejorar su negocio y ahora prepara otros platillos de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedidos que tiene. Desde entonces debe preparar previamente los alimentos que le son solicitados, disfruta mucho de esta actividad por que debe ser minuciosa en el momento de la preparación, además es exigente para obtenga la sazón exacta que a todos sus clientes gustan. En un futuro ella quiere seguir mejorando su negocio, con el tiempo espera tener su propio restaurante. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo tanto asegura que seguirá siendo muy responsable con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes al por mayor para así economizar y lograr mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, age 46, is a happy working woman. She lives, together with her husband and her 11 year old son Jesús, in her own home. For more than 2 years, Maria has been running a business selling ceviche (a typical Peruvian dish) from a stand she had built next to her house. When Maria obtained her first loan, she was able to expand her business and now prepares many other dishes requested by her customers, in addition to ceviche. She really enjoys the meticulous process of food preparation and the challenge of working to obtain precise flavors that all of her customers will enjoy. In the future, Maria wants to continue expanding her business and in time hopes to have her own restaurant. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has assured that she will continue being very responsible with the payments. With the credit that Maria is requesting, she plans to buy ingredients wholesale in order to save money and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Claudia Asunción

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Asunción H. L., tiene 47 años de edad vive en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casada y su esposo labora como comerciante, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, que se dedican  a estudiar la Universidad, ha sido con el esfuerzo de sus padres que se dedican a la venta de ropa, zapatos y bisutería desde hace tiempo atrás apoyando de esta manera a sus hijos a la culminación de sus carreras profesionales.

Es para el negocio que solicita un préstamo, para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería y de esta manera  aumentar sus volúmenes de venta y sus ingresos le permitirán mejores condiciones que favorezcan a toda la familia en proyectos de nuevas fuentes de inversión para la mejora continua de su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia Asunción H. L. is 47 years old, married, and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla subdivision. Her husband works as a merchant and they have three adult children who are university students. To fulfill their duties as parents, Claudia and her husband have been selling clothing, shoes, and accessories for quite some time. This enables them to support their children until they are able to complete their professional degrees.

Claudia is requesting a business loan so that she can buy more merchandise to add to her inventory. This will allow her to increase her sales volume and earn more income to provide better conditions for the entire family. In addition, this new source of investment will help improve the family’s financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more inventory

loans.name: Alinnson Rafael

texts.es: Alinsson Rafael Guerreo Pérez tiene 32 años,  vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 6 meses y 10 años respectivamente, en la zona comercial del barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, al sur de Barranquilla, donde tiene un negocio de venta de drogas medicinales, que inició en el año 2000 cuando se inició como negociante distribuyendo queso y algunas variedades de mercancías; desde que hace 4 años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que en un principio la apoyó con crédito para vender queso y mercancías por encargo, ahora ya tiene un negocio de mayor tamaño en su infraestructura y en sus clientela y ha diversificado la oferta vendiendo droguería medicinal, genera dos empleos y se sostiene aunque tenga una competencia muy fuerte, porque sus precios son mejores que los de sus competidores, porque compra al por mayor y sabe donde hacerlo; su trabajo lo realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días,  ya sus clientes conocen su ritmo  por eso siempre lo buscan  y le refieren otros. Alinsson ha recibido 8 créditos y con su credikiva completa el noveno con el que comprará medicamentos genéricos y comerciales para surtir su pequeña farmacia. Está muy satisfecho con su negocio y con el apoyo institucional recibido porque su nivel de vida ha mejorado, pero aun sueña con tener una  casa propia  y convertir su pequeño negocio en una gran droguería y este su mayor desafío para lograr un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Alinsson is 32 years old and lives with his wife and their 2 children, aged 6 months and 10 years respectively, in the commercial zone of the Ciudadela 20 de Julio barrio, south of Barranquilla. He has a medicinal drug store there that he opened in 2000, the year he began his business career by distributing cheese and some varieties of merchandise. For the last 4 years he has been involved with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization that helped him initially with loans to sell cheese and merchandise on order. Now he has a larger business in both infrastructure and clientèle, and he has diversified his offerings, selling medicinal drugs. Alinnson has 2 employees and he sustains his business, despite fierce competition, with lower prices than competitors, because he buys at wholesale and knows where to purchase. Alinnson works from 8:00am until 9:00pm every day. Now his customers know his schedule and they seek him out and refer him to others. Alinnson has received 8 loans and this loan request from Kiva will be his 9th. He will buy generic and commercial medicines to resupply his little pharmacy. Alinnson is very satisfied with his business and with the institutional help he has received and his level of living has improved. But he still dreams of having his own house and converting his small business into a large drug store, and this is his major challenge to accomplish a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING GENERIC AND COMMERCIAL MEDICINES TO SUPPLY HIS SMALL PHARMACY

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena S. is from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Lorena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lala

texts.en: Lala J. is currently in the business of selling local brew and crates of beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. Lala is 47 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has four children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Silvia Liliana

texts.es:
Silvia D. 31 años D. edad, es casada vive junto a su esposo en San Miguel, aun no tienen hijos y ella se dedica al comercio D. cosméticos desD. hace 5 años, ella estudia en la universidad y aprovecha para ofrecer su mercadería entre sus compañeras D. clases. Silvia necesita D. un préstamo para fortalecer su negocio y brindar mayor diversidad D. productos D. belleza, ella invertirá en la compra D. labiales, cremas, bases y otros productos que le son demandados por sus clientes.
Este préstamo ayudara a que Silvia mejore sus ingresos aumentando las ventas y obteniendo mayor estabilidad con su negocio.
El Sueño D. Silvia es mejorar las condiciones del negocio, finalizar sus estudios y tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Silvia is 31 years old and married. She lives with her husband in San Miguel. They do not yet have children. She has been selling cosmetics for five years. She is a university student, and she takes the opportunity to sell her merchandise to her classmates. Silvia needs a loan to strengthen her business and offer a greater diversity of beauty products. She will buy lipsticks, creams, foundations, and other products that are in demand by her customers. The loan will help Silvia improve her income by increasing sales. Then she will obtain greater stability in her business. Silvia’s dream is to improve conditions in her business, finish her education, and to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 25 años, es una mujer alegre y responsable, es madre soltera de 2 hermosos hijos Jeyson de 8 y Jeniffer de 3 meses de nacida; ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (Comunidad Nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Hace ya 2 años que se dedica a la siembra de diferentes productos como plátano, yuca y maíz híbrido (llamado también polenta). Menciona que estos productos son interminables ya que lo cosecha y siembra de acuerdo a la temporada; por ejemplo: el maíz lo cosecha a los 6 meses; la yuca después de un mes del maíz y el plátano cada 15 días. Por otro lado, cuando sus cultivos están maduros; los vende a los compradores que llegan los fines de semana a la comunidad nativa. Lo que más le agrada a Lida es poder sembrar diferentes variedades de frutos, entre ellas el cítricos, por el cual posee plantaciones desde hace 8 años, por lo que se dedicará a obtener un buena cosecha, de esa manera se podrá generar mayores ganancias. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y agradece a su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de poder invertir con su apoyo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de maíz, café y árboles de mandarina.
texts.en:
Lida is 25 years old and a happy and responsible single mother of two beautiful children: Jeyson is 8 years old and Jennifer is 3 months old.  They live in their own house located in the Peruvian jungle in the Pumpuriani Native Community Center.  

She has worked for two years planting different products like banana, yucca, and hybrid corn (also called polenta).  These products are endless since she harvest and plants according to the season.  For example, corn is harvested at six months, the yucca is harvested a month after the corn, and the bananas are harvested every fifteen days.  When her crops are ripe, she sells them to buyers who come to the native community on the weekend.  

Lida likes to be able to plant different varieties of fruits, including citrus, for which she has owned plantations for eight years, so she is dedicated to having a good harvest, so she can earn more money.  

This is her second loan from MFP and she thanks her community bank for giving her the opportunity to invest with their support.  With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of corn seeds, coffee, and tangerine trees.

loans.use: Purchase corn seeds, coffee, and tangerine trees

loans.name: Raquel May

texts.en:
Raquel May B. is from the village of Wigan Cordon. She is 26 years old. Raquel May is single. To make a living, Raquel May owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Raquel May has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised pigs.

In 2010, Raquel May joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel May has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Raquel May is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Raquel May from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Alcanzando Metas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes que conforman el  comité “Alcanzando Metas” actualmente se encuentran iniciando el 1° ciclo dentro del programa comité de mujeres y son señoras vecinas del barrio, las Señoras poseen actividades diversas e invertirán en compra de mercaderías varias para su posterior venta e insumos para la producción.
Algunas de las integrantes aun no cuentan con actividades que les genere ganancias y actualmente se encuentran en proceso de búsqueda de la actividad y con proyectos para aumentar sus ingresos.
Una de ella es la señora  Mariza quien actualmente es limpiadora, y no cuenta aún con otra actividad, pero quiere realizar algunos curso de bordados en zapatillas y bijouterie para tener como actividad extra y al mismo tiempo una le genere ingreso adicional hasta llegar a independizarse por completo.
Parra ello debe pagar el curso y comprar las zapatilla y accesoR. que utilizará, y solicita el préstamo para invertir en esta idea y se encuentra con muchas ganas y espera que todo le salgan de la mejor manera. Agradece a las personas que hacen posibles este programa.
texts.en:
The members of “Alcanzando Metas” ('Achieving Goals') committee are currently beginning their first loan cycle within the women's committee program.  They are all neighbors.  The women own different businesses and they will use their loan to purchase various goods to sell and supplies for production.

Some of the members do not yet have business activities which make them profits and are currently searching for activities and projects to increase their income.  One of them is Mariza who is currently a cleaner.  She does not yet have another activity but would like to attend a course on embroidering slippers and making jewelry so that she can do this as an extra activity and at the same time make additional income until she manages to become completely independent.

For achieve this, she must pay for her course and buy the slippers and accessories which she will use.  She is requesting the loan to invest in this idea.  She is very excited and enthusiastic and hopes that everything will turn out well.  She thanks the people who make this program possible.

loans.use: To pay for a course and to buy slippers and accessories to embroider

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 29 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents and other family members.  Their home is in Eten.  It is a smaller community on the coast outside the city of Chiclayo.  Most of the residents are fisherman, commercial dealers or raise animals.

For two years now, Veronika has managed a small general store.  She sells a wide variety of products including detergent, vegetables, candy, beverages, hygienic products, and many other items.  She enjoys her role in providing for her community and increasing their access to products to meet their basic needs.  She finds that every day she is increasing her clientele and she would like to expand her market share.

This will be her first loan with Edpyme Alternative.  She plans to use the funds to increase her inventory and provide better service to her clients.  She hopes such an action will increase her profile in the neighborhood and make her existing clientele more loyal.  It is her dream to expand her business and be able to better provide for her children.  She is proud to have her own income source and to be able to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Morine Jahenda

texts.en:
Morine Jahenda E. is a hardworking 32-year-old woman. She is married to Harun Kitui, a driver, and together they have two children ages 8 and 10 years old .She has been operating a green grocery business for about five years and she earns a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She learned about KADET LTD and joined. She had no previous credit history with any other MFI. She has now applied for her first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to buy bananas to sell. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to build a market stall.

Morine hopes to expand her business and become the leading local investor and to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon L. is a 25-year-old woman who currently lives in Kompong Chhnang Province in Cambodia with her parent, who sells baskets. She works in the local garment factory sewing clothing, and she earns a monthly salary from this job. She will get married next month, but her personal savings balance is not sufficient to hold a wedding party. So Nuon L. made a decision to borrow some funds from Kiva to add to her savings to prepare for her wedding.

loans.use: To add to her savings to prepare for her wedding.

loans.name: Rosemarie's Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is from the village of Dipacamo, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Rosemarie is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosemarie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie raises pigs for fattening and sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase feed and other supplies. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Eleofina Cirila

texts.es:
La señora Eleofina Cirila T. C. vive en la localidad de Amilicingo municipio de Temoac en el estado de Morelos, México.  Estudio el 6º. Año de primaria tiene su certificado. Ella tiene 38 años de edad. Su préstamo lo va a utilizar para invertir en su negocio de venta de tortillas elaboradas a mano, ella va a comprar con su préstamo maíz y leña. Su negocio es la elaboración de tortillas a mano, lleva 2 años con esta actividad. Se organizó junto con sus hermanas para poner el negocio y así tener un ingreso adicional para su familia. Además venden picadas, tlacoyos y surten pedidos para fiestas. Antes de dedicarse a este negocio se dedicó a la venta de perfumería por catalogo Avon y Fuller, pero como no le iba muy bien su hermana la invitó a participar en el negocio de la elaboración de tortillas. 
Todos los días se traslada de su domicilio a su trabajo, se hace aproximadamente 20 minutos al centro de Amilcingo en casa de su hermana. Su negocio es importante porque se ayuda con el dinero para la alimentación y los gastos de su casa. La parte favorita de su negocio es hacer sus tortillas y trabajar con su familia porque ve a su mama todos los días. Le da mucho orgullo trabajar junto con sus familiares y que conviven todos los días. Sus clientes habituales son los mismos vecinos de la localidad y del pueblo de Huazulco, en promedio atiende entre 30 y 40 clientes. Ella considera su negocio popular porque las personas buscan mucho las tortillas hechas a mano. Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el aumento de tortillerías, lo que hace que su clientela disminuya un poco. Las ganancias las vuelve a invertir en el negocio, comprando más leña y maíz. A futuro piensa contratar un peón para que les ayude con la elaboración de sus productos.
Le señora Eleofina vive en unión libre con su esposo, él no trabaja y es la señora Eleofina la que lleva el gasto de su casa, tiene 4 hijos Chayane de 16 años de edad  no estudia, no trabaja, Iris de 14 años de edad no estudia, Iván de 12 años de edad no estudia y no trabaja y Carina de 10 años de edad estudia la primaria. Solo su hija Iris participa de su negocio ayudándole a hacer las tortillas. Sus sueños son lograr que sus hijos tengan un trabajo para ellos mismos. Se siente feliz con la oportunidad que le brinda KIVA y Fundación Realidad de recibir un préstamo y así poder lograr sus metas, también nos menciona sentirse comprometida con pagar puntualmente. La señora Eleofina quiere decirle a KIVA y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por hacerme este préstamo, gracias a ustedes tenemos este negocio, gracias por los préstamos que me han ayudado mucho”,
texts.en:
Eleofina Cirila T. C. lives in the Amilcingo municipality, in Temoac in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She has a sixth grade education, and she has her elementary school certificate.  She is 38 years old.

She will use her loan to invest in her business of selling handmade tortillas.  She will use the loan to buy corn and firewood.  She has been in her business of selling handmade tortillas for two years.  She and her sisters got together in order to set up the business as a way of having additional income for the family.

They also sell cold cuts and “tlacoyos" (fried or toasted cakes made of masa stuffed with refried beans, cheese, fava beans, chicharron or other ingredients).  They also fill orders for fiestas.  Before she worked in this business she sold perfume by catalog from Avon and Fuller.  As this did not go very well for her, her sister invited her to participate in the business of making tortillas.

Every day she goes from her home to her work, which is approximately 20 minutes to her sister’s house in the center of Amilcingo.  Her business is important because it helps with money for food and the household expenses.  Her favorite part of the business is making the tortillas and working with her family because she sees her mother every day.  It makes her very proud to work with her relatives and to share their lives everyday.

Her usual customers are the neighbors in the area and in the town of Huazulco.  They have an average of between 30 and 40 customers.  She feels that her business is popular because people look for handmade tortillas a lot.  One of the challenges that her business faces is the increase in tortilla shops, which makes her have a few less customers.  She invests her earnings in the business by purchasing firewood and corn.  In the future she plans to hire a worker to help her make her products.

Eleofina lives in a common-law marriage with her husband.  He does not work.  Eleofina is the one that takes care of the household expenses.  She has four children.  Chayane, age 16, does not go to school or work.  Iris, age 14, does not go to school.  Ivan, age 12, does not go to school or work.  Carina, age 10, attends elementary school.  Only her daughter, Iris, participates in the business by helping her make tortillas.

Her dream is for her children to have work for themselves.  She is happy with the opportunity to receive a loan from Kiva and the Fundación Realidad.  That way she will be able to achieve her goals.  Also, she tells us that she is committed to paying punctually.  Eleofina wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “Thanks for giving me this loan.  Thanks to you we have this business.  Thanks for the loans that have helped me so much.”

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood to make tortillas by hand

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita S. is from the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Expedita is separated from her spouse and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Expedita owns & operates  a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, beverages & toothpaste in the local community. Expedita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Expedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Expedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Expedita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Expedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & junk foods.

loans.name: Perth

texts.en:
Perth is 52 years old, married and has six children between the ages 15 and 30.  Perth makes and sells furniture and enjoys her work.  She has owned her business for two years and employs three people to help her. Her daily work timings are from 8 AM to 6 PM.

Perth will use this loan to purchase more items to sell, hire staff and improve her current facilities.  Perth hopes to make a profit which she plans to keep as savings.

loans.use: Purchase more items to sell, hire staff and improve current facilities

loans.name: Ara Poty Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se llama Ara Poty y se encuentra en su 4to. ciclo.
La Sra. Gasparina G. con 32 años, tiene 2 hijos y se dedica en la venta de cosméticos, por la mañana hace sus ventas por catálogos y se translada luego en moto en distintas ciudades, ya más tarde vuelve a su casa por la noche.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado, porque al llegar de su trabajo debe realizar las tareas de la casa pero todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
The committee is called Ara Poty and this is their fourth loan cycle.

Mrs. Gasparina G. is 32 years old, and has 2 children. She sells makeup. In the morning she makes her sales via catalog and later goes by motorcycle to different cities and arrives home in the evening.

Mrs. Gasparina G. has a very tough life since she has a very hectic day, because when she arrives home after work she has to do household work but she does everything to give her children a good start in life since she is a single mother.

loans.use: To buy makeup to resell.

loans.name: Annah Muthoni

texts.en:
Annah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 17 years.  She is 48 years old and married to Francis Mbugua. They have five children.  

She was introduced to KADET by her friend.  This will be Annah's third loan; she paid all her previous loans on time.  She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for farming.

In the future, Annah hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, separada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tamales ella trabaja en el mercado central del Cusco (mercado San Pedro), ella trabaja de lunes a domingo por las mañanas, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le trae muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales ya que mediante este negocio la socia saca a su hijo adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de insumos para su negocio como maíz, manteca, mantequilla entre 
otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Carlota belongs to the communal bank "Richary Runa."  This bank is located in the Cusco district of Cusco province.

Carlota is 38 years old, separated, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling tamales.  She works in the central market of Cusco (the San Pedro market.)  She works every day in the morning.  Carlota has had this business for a number of years and it has brought  her a lot of satisfaction, both personal as well as financial, because through the business she has been able to provide for her son.  

Carlota needs a loan to purchase supplies for her business such as corn, lard,  butter, and other items.

Carlota is pleased to have this loan, and she is committed to making all of her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business such as corn, lard, butter, and other products

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La señora Lisbeth es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tienen 2 hijos.  Su esposo es profesor (docente).
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, todos estos años se dedicó a la venta de mercadería diversa y es la presidenta del banco comunal, siempre ha solicitado los préstamos de acuerdo a sus necesidades, para poder cumplir con los pagos mensuales y no caer en mora.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.2,000.00 comprará 20 pares de sandalias, 3 docenas de polos para hombres, ½ docena de pantalones, 1 docena de shores.
Todas los préstamos son invertidos en su negocio, de esta forma se adastece conmercadería que luego vende a mejor precio.
Dice que con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha podido hacer algunos arreglos en su casa y por eso está muy contenta porque trabajando ha podido lograr mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Her husband is a teacher.

Lisbeth has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years.  During this time she has worked selling a range of merchandise and she is the president of her community bank.  She has always requested loans in accordance with her need so that she can meet her monthly repayments and not default.  She will use her new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy twenty pairs of sandals, three dozen men's polo shirts, half a dozen pairs of pants and one dozen pairs of shorts.

Lisbeth invests all of her loans in her business.  She stocks up with merchandise which she then sells at a better price.  She says that her loans from Manuela Ramos have also enabled her to make some repairs to her home and she is very happy about this because it means that, through her work, she has been able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and lives in Novomoskovsk. Yelena sells electric appliances in the central marketplace of her home town. She offers a variety of irons, tea kettles, TV sets and other appliances. Yelena started the business over 3 years ago with the help of her husband. A favorable location of her vending facility in a busy part of the market, as well as affordable prices, were the factors that caused the growth of her venture. Yelena receives 10,000 grivnyas of income every month. 

Yelena is seeking a loan of 20,000 grivnyas to purchase small appliances for the summer tourist season, i.e. water-coolers, electric heaters, flasks, hot food containers, etc. She is planning to re-invest any generated income in further development of her enterprise. Yelena and her husband have recently purchased a small private house. They are now in the process of remodeling it.

loans.use: to purchase assorted small appliances for retail sale

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en: Peterson is 26 years old, single and has made a living by running a car wash for the last three years. He has done well and now has four employees. He used to run a barber shop, but membership in Faulu Kenya allowed him to buy car-washing equipment and dig a well to get the water his business needs. In the future, he hopes to own rental houses. He is applying for a loan for 60,000 Kes to expand his business by buying a buffing machine, detergents, water tanks and a water pump.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a car wash.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 28 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom go to school.  Agnes sells sugar, soap, beans and rice to earn income.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more sugar, soap, beans and rice to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: Stock more sugar, soap, beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Touba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 17 aout 2005. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui viennent de la même localité. Elle font comme activités la vente de l'huile de palme, du piment et du pain de singe.

Madame Fang (à la droite de la photo levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi un enfant en sa charge confié par un parent proche.

Elle s'active dans la vente du piment qu'elle produit dans son jardin. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter sa capacité de production en achetant des semences de qualité et des intrants afin de mieux développer son activité.

les profits qui seront tirer de cette opération lui permettront de renforcer ses épargnes et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille(santé, habillement, nourriture etc.)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on August 17, 2005.  It is made up of 11 women who live in the same area.  For work, they sell palm oil, hot peppers, and fruits of the Baobab tree.  Madame Fang (at the right of the photo, raising her hand) manages the group.  She is 45 years old.  She is married and the mother of five children.  She also cares for the child of a nearby relative.

She sells hot peppers which she cultivates in her garden.  She has great experience in this area, as she has carried out this work for many years.  This loan will allow her to increase her production capacities by purchasing quality seeds and agricultural inputs in order to better develop her business.  The profits made from this operation will allow her to grow her savings and to better the livelihoods of her family (health, clothing, diet, etc.)

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and pepper seeds.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 60 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear clothing business for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. 

Anita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Bohchuluun

texts.en: Bohchuluun is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His oldest son is a student, and the younger three attend secondary school. He manages a meat-trading business in his town with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1990 and gained much experience. In addition, he works as a guard at a public organization in order to supplement his earnings. He is a responsible businessman. He is requesting a 1,500,000-Mongolian-togrog (MNT) loan to purchase meat for his business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora es una mujer alegre y amable, tiene 51 años, está casada  con León de 55 años, con quien tuvo 10 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con Silvia, Leo y Analí, todos viven en la tranquilidad de su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Palca. La vida para ella no fue fácil, pero hasta ahora sigue luchando por salir adelante. Ya recuperada de una enfermedad que la mantuvo en cama varios meses Dora cuenta que le gusta mucho alimentar a sus animales, principalmente a las vacas que cría para poder elaborar los ricos quesos. Además nos comenta, que con la producción de 20 litros de leche, obtiene una ganancia de S/. 300 nuevos soles.  Asimismo se dedica a la siembra de papa y diferentes verduras muy solicitadas en el mercado desde hace 34 años con la ayuda de sus hijos, de esta actividad recibe buenas ganancias económicas que le permite brindar una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia, sin preocupación alguna. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el trasporte público, así trae un dinero extra al hogar. Con los años de experiencia que tiene desea para más adelante sembrar follajes en mayor cantidad en busca de calidad. Es por eso que después de la cosecha de zanahoria comenzará con la siembra de culantro. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santo Domingo” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Dora de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío de papa de la variedad “yungay”.
texts.en:
Dora is a cheerful, kind woman.  She’s 51 years old, married to León, 55, and has ten children but only Silvia, Leo and Analí still live with her.  They all live together in peace in their own house located in the hamlet of Palca.  

Life for her has not been easy but she continues to struggle to get ahead.  Now recovered from an illness that kept her bedridden for several months
Dora comments that she very much enjoys feeding her animals, especially the cows she raises to make delicious cheese.  She also comments that with the production of 20 liters of milk she earns a 300 new sol profit.  In addition, she has been farming potatoes and various other vegetables that are in high demand in the market for the last 34 years with help from her children.  She earns good profits from this activity too that allow her to provide her family with an adequate quality of life free of worries.

Her husband, who works as driver providing public transportation services, earns extra money for the home.  With the years of experience she’s had she’d like to plant foliage in larger amounts seeking quality.  Because of this, once the carrot harvest is in she will start planting coriander.

She belongs to the “Santo Domingo” communal bank and this is the 7th loan with MFP where she hopes for support from all of you to meet her goals.  Besides, she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  

If Dora were to receive your support, she will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizer for her next planting of potatoes of the “yungay” type.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all four of whom are in school.  Teopista has a pub.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week.  

Teopista sells her products at the market, retail.  She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. 

The main business challenges for Teopista include thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pub.    

Teopista lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia lives in Uganda and is married with three children who all go to school. She lives in her own house which has piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include power and food.

For the last ten years Lukia has sold secondhand clothes from her home, working six days a week. Her major challenges include those of transportation and the ever-increasing price of clothes in Uganda.

Lukia has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her aspirations and goals are to start importing those bales from Dubai and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny, 31 years old, has been an industrious motorcycle operator in his community for five years. He is married and blessed with two children, one in grade school and a 2-year-old. Manny farms and provides motorcycle transport to earn a living. He attended college but did not finish because of financial problems. He got married at 25 years of age and bought a motorcycle to start a business to support his family.   

Manny is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tires and paint for motorcycle maintenance. He will also use the capital for supplies to maintain his farming. Manny works very hard to provide for all of his family's needs with his simple sources of income. He earns PHP 4,000 each month from his motorcycle business; it is minimal but he manages to budget well to avoid food scarcity.
 
Manny says that he will work harder to fully support his children's educational needs so that they will not be like him in the future. He hopes to continue to work for the attainment of his goals.

loans.use: to buy tires and paint for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a single mother who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water and electricity bills. For the past three years, she has operated an M-pesa (mobile money transfer) franchise. Her potential customers are neighbors and town dwellers.

Juliet decided to join Kiva field partner Yehu to access loans with the hope of boosting her business. She plans to use this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to increase the money float she uses in the mobile money transfer business.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase the money float for a mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nim was born in Kompot Province, Cambodia. She has resided in this province since 1979, and this is where she works as a rice cultivator. From this business, she earns approximately $2 each day. She is married to Mr. Svay, who is a rice farmer also. 

This humble couple has been blessed with four children; all of them have already married and live independently. Mrs. Nim also has a second economic activity: raising pigs. She has been doing this for many years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the persistence she brings to her work. To earn a living, she has discussed with her family purchasing more piglets but they are lacking money, so they wish to request some funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva. They hope that these funds will make their family meet happiness and prosperity and have a larger house. This is her first loan with Kiva and HKL. They are grateful to all donors in advance.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets.

loans.name: Sochidamo

texts.ru: Сочидамо честная  старательная жена. За ее плечами12 лет предпринимательской деятельности. Сочидамо  продает продукты питания. Она приобретает товар на центральных  оптовых рынках и продает на районном рынке. У нее своя торговая точка. Она замужем у них 4 детей, но бизнесом она занимается самостоятельно. У нее растут дети, чтобы обеспечить их всем необходимым и развить бизнес она  хочет расширить бизнес. Сочидамо  не имеет нужной суммы. Она хотела бы получить займ на сумму 1100$ США. Сочидамо рассчитывает на вашу поддержку и благодарит вас за понимание.
texts.en: Sochidamo is an honest and hardworking woman. She has over 12 years of experiences as a business woman on her shoulders. Sochidamo sells groceries. She purchases goods at the central wholesale market and sells them at the regional market. She has her own grocery store. Sochdamo is married and has four children, but she is managing the business independently from her husband. Her children are growing up and to provide for them all she wants to expand her business. However, Sochidamo is lacking the starting capital for the expansion. She would like to take out a loan of US$ 1100 and is hoping for your support and grateful for you generosity.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso tiene 61 años, es un hombre sencillo y trabajador, su actividad es brindar el servicio de venta de repuestos de vehículos y reparación. Hace más de 15 años, que lleva dedicándose a este medio de vida fue con este medio de vida que les pudo proporcionar a sus hijos alimento, comida y vestimenta pues todavía tiene 1 hijo de 19 años a su cargo. A pesar de los problemas de salud que atraviesa como es problemas en la columna esto no lo desanima para seguir adelante con su negocio. Este crédito es para la compra de caja de cambios, motores, parachoques, motores de arranque entre otros.
texts.en: Alfonso, 61, is an unassuming, hardworking man.  He sells vehicle spare parts and repairs vehicles.  He’s been in this line of work for over 15 years and the business has made it possible for him to provide food and clothing for his children; he still has a 19-year-old son in his care.  Despite the health problems he’s currently undergoing, like problems with his spinal column, he’s not discouraged to continue with his business.  This loan is to buy a transmission box, engines, shock absorbers and starters, among others.

loans.use: to buy car engine parts.

loans.name: Leshoko

texts.en:
Leshoko is a 37-year-old married man with three children.  To earn a living, he practices livestock farming.  He has been in this business for twelve years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with his previous loans.  He has also become more focused in his business.
Leshoko hopes to add more livestock to his farm.  Hence he has requested for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy goats.

loans.use: buy more goats

loans.name: Reyna Noemy

texts.es:
Reyna, vive con su esposo y una hija, ella se dedica a la sastrería, lleva 10 años en este oficio, este oficio lo aprendió asistiendo a una academia, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 6:00pm, tiene ya experiencia en la confección de vestidos. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de costura, como zipper, hilos, telas, para la confección de vestidos, faldas, pantalones, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener en la sastrería los insumos necesarios, aumentando el potencial.
La aspiración de Reyna es velar por todo lo necesario en el hogar, apoyando a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her husband and a daughter; she’s a tailor and has been in this occupation for ten years.  She learned the skills attending courses at an academy and she works every day from 7am until 6pm; she has experience making dresses.

She’s asking for a loan to buy sewing supplies like zippers, thread and fabric to make dresses, skirts and pants.  This investment will help her keep her tailor shop stocked with necessary supplies thus increasing potential.  Reyna’s hope is to be able to supply everything her home needs and to help her daughter with her schooling.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Borey (pictured here) is a security guard, while his wife, Saren is now a garment worker. Borey and Saren live in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have two young children:one son and one daughter. 

The couple had already asked for a loan through Kiva to purchase a new motorbike. Unhappily, the motorbike was stolen, so Borey is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy one more motorbike to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work.
